title: Full-Time Virtual Paralegal — Personal Injury Litigation
description:
LOCATION: Remote



SCHEDULE: Monday–Thursday 9am–5pm PST (California time), Friday 9am–1pm PST (California time) — non-negotiable



COMPENSATION: Competitive, based on experience



ABOUT THE ROLE:



You will be supporting a California personal injury litigation attorney managing approximately 30 active cases. This role requires someone who already understands US personal injury litigation — pleadings, discovery, demand packages, medical records — and can hit the ground running with minimal ramp-up on fundamentals.

We are looking for someone detail-obsessed, tech-fluent, and genuinely communicative. You will be on Zoom during working hours for collaboration and communication. This is not a background task role — you will be actively engaged throughout the day.



RESPONSIBILITIES:



- Draft litigation documents including pleadings, shells, and proofs of service from templates and from scratch

- Propound and assist with responding to discovery (interrogatories, requests for production, requests for admission)

- Serve documents and manage proof of service tracking

- Calendar deadlines, court dates, and discovery cutoffs in Outlook

- Organize and manage
 correspondence

- Request and organize medical records and bills

- Coordinate requests with internal firm staff

- Assist in assembling settlement demand packages

- Maintain and organize case files in Filevine

- Over time: build SOPs and templates to systematize firm workflows



REQUIREMENTS:



- Minimum 2 years of experience as a paralegal or legal virtual assistant for a US personal injury litigation firm. This is a firm requirement and is not negotiable. Please do not apply if you do not have this experience.

- Solid understanding of PI litigation fundamentals — pleadings, discovery, demand packages, medical records, service of process

- Exceptional written and spoken English — you must be able to understand and execute complex legal instructions accurately and independently. Non-native English speakers are welcome to apply, but exceptional English proficiency is required and non-negotiable.

- Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Word and Adobe Acrobat. If you are not highly comfortable in both, please do not apply.

- Tech fluent — you must be able to learn new software independently without hand-holding. This is non-negotiable.

- Extreme attention to detail — you catch errors before they become problems

- Highly communicative and responsive during working hours

- You must be available to work Monday–Thursday 9am–5pm and Friday 9am–1pm Pacific Standard Time (California, USA). This is a firm requirement and is not negotiable. Please do not apply if you cannot commit to these hours.



PREFERRED:



- Experience with Filevine or similar case management software (Clio, MyCase, Litify)

- California litigation experience

- Experience creating SOPs and workflow templates



THIS ROLE IS NOT FOR YOU IF:



- You do not have at least 2 years of paralegal or legal VA experience at a US personal injury firm

- You have never worked in US litigation and are hoping to learn on the job

- Your English proficiency is conversational but not professional and precise

- You need someone to walk you through new technology rather than figuring it out yourself

- You are not comfortable being on Zoom and actively communicating throughout the day

- You are not available to work Monday–Thursday 9am–5pm and Friday 9am–1pm Pacific Standard Time (California, USA)



HOW TO APPLY:

To be considered for this position, please submit the following:



- A short paragraph (5-8 sentences) describing a litigation matter you worked on — what type of case it was, what your specific role was, and what documents or tasks you handled

- Subject line of your application
 must read exactly: "PI Paralegal Application — [Your Name]"



Applications that do not follow these instructions exactly will not be reviewed.

title: Full-Time Appointment Setter (Health / Wellness Clinics)
description:
About the Company



We are a growing integrative health and wellness organization operating medical, regenerative, and wellness clinics. We generate inbound leads daily from paid ads, referrals, and digital campaigns. Our success depends on speed, professionalism, and excellent patient communication.



This role is critical to revenue.



Role Overview



We are hiring a full-time Appointment Setter with experience scheduling for health clinics, med spas, or wellness clinics. Your primary responsibility is to immediately contact inbound leads, qualify them, and get them scheduled for consultations using phone calls and SMS.



This is not an admin role.

This is a speed-to-lead, high-urgency role.





Responsibilities



- Contact new inbound leads within minutes via phone and SMS

- Make outbound calls and follow up persistently until contact is made

- Qualify leads and schedule appointments accurately

- Use HighLevel (GoHighLevel) to manage leads and calendars

- Update appointments and notes in OptiMantra (EHR)

- Confirm appointments and reduce no-shows

- Maintain HIPAA-compliant documentation

- Communicate clearly and professionally with patients

- Work CST business hours consistently





Required Experience



- You MUST have experience scheduling for health clinics, med spas, or wellness clinics

- Strong spoken and written English

Comfortable making high-volume outbound calls

- You MUST have experience with HighLevel (GoHighLevel)

- Experience or familiarity with EHR systems (OptiMantra preferred)

- Understanding of HIPAA and patient confidentiality

- Reliable internet, headset, and quiet work environment





What We Care Most About



Speed to lead (fast response wins)

Follow-up discipline

Accuracy and organization

Professional patient communication

Reliability during CST hours





Schedule



Full-time

Monday–Friday | 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM Central Standard Time (CST)



Voice Sample Requirement (Required)



Please record a 30–60 second voice sample answering the following:

“Hi, this is [your name]. I’m calling to follow up on your request for a consultation with our clinic. I wanted to see if you were available to talk now or if there’s a better time later today.”





How to Apply



Please include:

- Your experience scheduling for health clinics or med spas

- Please confirm you have experience working in GoHighLevel

- Confirmation you can work CST hours full-time

- A voice recording (30–60 seconds) following the instructions above



Compensation

- $1000 USD/month + bonus for shown appointments that you have scheduled

title: Remote Payment BD Associate – Commission + Growth Role
description:
Remote Payment Business Development Associate



 Performance-Based Growth Role



This is a results-driven position.



If you are not comfortable with daily online research, outbound outreach, and measurable weekly targets — please do not apply.



We are building a serious merchant acquisition team for our 2026 global expansion.



 About Us



We are a cross-border payment company working with digital merchants in Indonesia and India, mainly in online gaming, forex, trading, and other high-frequency online businesses.



We are expanding our Business Development team and hiring multiple remote BD associates.



This role focuses on merchant sourcing and qualification.

You will NOT be responsible for final pricing, negotiation, or closing contracts.



 Your Responsibilities



• Research a minimum of 20 potential merchant websites per day

• Identify websites with active deposit/payment systems

• Verify real business activity (not fake or inactive sites)

• Find
 /
 / direct contact channels

• Send initial outreach messages using company templates

• Record all outreach activities clearly in a Google Sheet

• Introduce interested merchants into a group with PAYJN core team

• Assist in early-stage merchant communication



This is structured, target-based work. Consistency is important.



 Weekly Performance Requirements



• Minimum 100 researched websites per week

• At least 5 qualified merchants per week

• At least 1 successful merchant group introduction per week



(Performance is tracked weekly.)



Compensation Structure

Trial Period – 2 Weeks



To pass trial, you must achieve at least ONE of the following:



• 3 qualified merchants successfully introduced into group communication

OR

• 1 merchant that proceeds to payment testing



Trial Allowance: USD 200



After Passing Trial



• Base Salary: USD 400 per month

• Commission: 0.02% of transaction volume fro
rchants you sourced

• Commission valid for 6 months per merchant

• Commission continues only if you bring at least 1 new merchant every quarter



This is a long-term opportunity for serious performers.



Ideal Candidate



• Experienced in lead generation, sourcing, or BD

• Comfortable with structured daily targets

• Detail-oriented and disciplined

• Familiar with
 and online communication

• Able to identify real gaming/forex/trading websites

• Self-motivated and results-driven



? Important



This role is performance-based.

We are looking for serious, long-term candidates only.



 To Apply, Please Answer:



Have you worked in lead generation or business development before? Explain briefly.



How would you identify if an online gaming website is real and active?



Are you comfortable completing a short test task within 48 hours?



Applications without answers will not be reviewed.

title: Amazon Advertising Specialist (PPC Manager)
description:
About the Role

We're looking for a sharp, results-driven Amazon Advertising Specialist who doesn't just manage campaigns — they own them. You'll be responsible for the full advertising lifecycle of our luxury Amazon brands, from strategy and execution to weekly reporting and hitting aggressive growth targets. If you understand how to market premium products without cheapening the brand, and you love turning ad spend into revenue, this role is for you.

What You'll Be Doing

You'll take complete ownership of our Amazon PPC campaigns across Sponsored Products, Sponsored Brands, and Sponsored Display. This means building campaigns from scratch, optimizing existing ones, and making data-backed decisions daily. You'll manage campaigns inside Pacvue, leveraging its automation, rules, and reporting features to run efficient, scalable advertising. Every week, you'll deliver clear, actionable reports that show what's working, what isn't, and what you're doing about it. You'll own our brand presence on Amazon -  including competitor research and monitoring, keyword strategy, and listing alignment - and you'll be directly accountable for hitting our ACOS, TACOS, and revenue targets. When targets are missed, we expect you to know why and have a plan.

You're a Great Fit If You

Have at least 2 years of hands-on Amazon PPC experience managing real ad budgets, with specific experience in the luxury or premium goods space. You understand that luxury brands require a different advertising posture — protecting brand perception, targeting the right customer, and avoiding discount-driven tactics that erode brand equity. You have direct, working experience with Pacvue and can hit the ground running without a learning curve. You're comfortable inside Amazon Seller Central and the advertising console, and you understand keyword research, bid strategy, search term harvesting, and negative keyword management deeply. You can build and maintain weekly performance reports in Excel or Google Sheets that are clean and easy to understand. You communicate proactively -  if something is going wrong, you raise it early, not after the fact.

title: Supply Chain Planner
description:
Supply Chain Planner (Remote – Philippines Based)



Full-Time | Remote | Philippines

We are seeking an experienced and highly analytical Supply Chain Planner to manage forecasting, inventory planning, procurement coordination, and supply chain reporting across our growing business.

This is a fully remote role based in the Philippines.



We are looking for someone commercially minded, highly proficient in Excel, confident working independently, and capable of building structured planning processes from the ground up. This role requires someone who can think ahead, identify risks early, and proactively solve supply and demand challenges.



Key Responsibilities

Forecasting & Demand Planning

• Build and maintain a rolling 12-month forecast across:

o Finished goods

o Raw materials

o Packaging & consumables

o GWPs and promotional items

• Analyze sales trends by market, channel, and SKU

• Incorporate promotions and product launches into forecasts

• Continuously improve forecast accuracy and track variance



Inventory & Supply Planning

• Monitor inventory health across warehouse and 3PL locations

• Manage stock coverage to prevent stockouts and overstock

• Identify slow-moving and aged inventory risks

• Recommend reorder quantities based on forecast and supplier lead times



Procurement & Supplier Coordination

• Raise and manage purchase orders

• Track supplier lead times and on-time performance

• Maintain supplier performance scorecards

• Flag supply risks early and propose mitigation plans



Reporting & Data Analysis

• Own weekly and monthly reporting including:

o Sales performance by market

o Forecast accuracy

o Inventory levels and stock coverage

o COGS tracking

o Backorder and stockout analysis

• Build automated Excel dashboards

• Provide data-driven insights to support commercial decisions



S&OP Process Support

• Prepare reporting and analysis for monthly S&OP meetings

• Highlight supply risks, demand shifts, and inventory gaps

• Track action items across departments



Systems & Process Improvement

• Improve forecasting models and planning templates

• Support Cin7 system enhancements

• Document and streamline planning SOPs

• Identify automation opportunities



What We’re Looking For

Essential Experience:

• 3+ years in supply planning, demand planning, inventory planning, or supply chain analysis

• Advanced Excel skills (Pivot Tables, complex formulas, dashboards)

• Strong analytical and numerical capability

• Experience working with ERP or inventory systems

• Experience working remotely and managing deadlines independently

Highly Desirable

• Experience supporting S&OP processes

• Experience with global suppliers and freight coordination

• Experience in eCommerce, FMCG, beauty, or consumer goods



Key Competencies

• Strong commercial thinking

• Highly organized and structured

• Proactive problem solver

• Detail-oriented (Excel skills are a must)

• Comfortable presenting insights to leadership

• Self-starter with strong accountability

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Thank you!

Nothing falls through the cracks.

s

title: Amazon Listing Specialist (Flat File Expert)
description:
We’re looking for a highly detail-oriented Amazon Listing Specialist with 2+ years of hands-on experience creating and maintaining Amazon listings with a strong knowledge of Amazon flat files (inventory file templates) who can confidently navigate complex category requirements (including regulated attributes like UL compliance in Lighting) and push listings live accurately and consistently.



If you’re the type of person who won’t stop until the data is correct, all the applicable fields are filled in (for maximum Amazon exposure), and the listing is fully compliant, this role is for you.





What You’ll Own:



Amazon Listing Creation & Optimization (Flat File Heavy)



Build new listings using flat files, completing all applicable attributes.

Know the difference between required vs. recommended vs. optional fields and fill them appropriately.

Understand when to use Amazon Valid Values vs. when custom entries are appropriate (and how to format them correctly).

Create and maintain variation structures (parent/child), ensuring clean, logical relationships.

 



Category Complexity for example Compliance (Lighting & Beyond)



Handle harder categories (e.g., Lighting) with additional compliance and attribute requirements.

Accurately input certification/compliance-related attributes (e.g., UL, safety claims, etc.) per Amazon policy and category rules.

Interpret category templates and adapt to different attribute needs across multiple categories.

 



Troubleshooting ,  Seller Support Case Management



Open Amazon cases that get useful, actionable answers (not copy-paste responses).

Be persistent: escalate, reframe, and follow up until the issue is resolved and the listing is live.

Diagnose errors/warnings in flat file uploads and resolve issues efficiently.

 



Quality Assurance



Spot-check live listings after upload to ensure every field populated correctly (titles, bullets, attributes, variations, compliance fields, etc.).

Catch missing attributes, suppressed listings, browse node issues, mismatched valid values, and formatting errors

Ensure that ALL fields are filled in to maximize Amazon exposure and Rufus understanding of our listing

 



Additional Amazon Ops Tasks as applicable



Inventory updates, price updates, and Amazon-related reporting tied to listing and catalog projects.

Support ongoing catalog maintenance and data updates as the Amazon business scales.

 



What We’re Looking For 



Required



2+ years Amazon listing experience with flat files

Strong understanding of:

Required vs. recommended fields

Valid values, attribute formatting, and template logic

Troubleshooting upload errors and feed processing results

Demonstrated ability to work through Amazon support to get real solutions.

Extremely detail-oriented, organized, and persistent.

Comfortable asking questions when stuck, and proactive about finding answers either through opening Amazon cases or internal company support

Strong excel skills to handle thousands of skus at a time – organizing, filtering, sorting data at speed

Works well independently but also part of a larger team!

title: Video Editor
description:
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:

Short-Form Video Editing (Primary)

*Edit 5–20+ short-form videos per day optimized for TikTok and TikTok Shop

*Edit short video/audio podcast (2 episodes a month)

*Create tight, fast-paced edits where cuts feel natural and almost unnoticeable

Fast Turnaround & Workflow

 Reels

 and Zoom

*Excellent English skills, and able to communicate well both verbally and in writing

title: Full-Time Video Editor (Remote) - YouTube-Style Business Content - ~$1,600/mo
description:
Type: Full-Time (40 hrs/week)

Work Setup: Remote

Hours: Must work US Central Time (CT)

Pay: $1,600/month (monthly pay, growth based on performance)



What You’ll Do

We’re hiring a Video Editor to create clean, engaging edits for professional service companies in the U.S. This role is focused on retention-driven editing: pacing, B-roll, captions, music, and graphics that keep viewers watching.

You’ll also get coaching and feedback to improve quickly while working with a YouTube creator with 555,000+ subscribers.



Key Responsibilities

• Edit long-form videos into polished, modern final cuts

• Add captions/subtitles, graphics/lower thirds, music, SFX, and B-roll

• Improve retention through pacing, clean cuts, and visual variety

• Follow feedback, systems, and deadlines consistently



Required

• Strong portfolio showing clean, professional edits

• Experience with:

o Captions (timed + styled)

o Graphics (callouts/lower thirds)

o Music/SFX + clean audio levels

o B-roll selection to support the story

• Fast, reliable, and willing to learn/improve continuously



Tools

Premiere Pro preferred, but Final Cut or DaVinci Resolve is fine.

(After Effects is a plus, not required.)



Great Fit If You…

• Love making videos feel modern and easy to watch

• Can edit efficiently without sacrificing quality

• Want a long-term role with growth potential



To Apply (Please include)

1. Portfolio link (required)

2. 3–5 relevant samples (YouTube-style / business / talking-head + B-roll)

3. Your editing software + computer specs

4. Your availability and daily overlap with US Central Time (CT)

5. One paragraph: how you increase retention with your edits



Application Subject Line: “Full-Time Video Editor – Remote”

title: Amazon Image and Design Specialist
description:
About the Role



We are seeking an experienced Amazon-focused Visual Designer to create high-converting product images for our luxury brand portfolio. Our products are design-led (e.g., premium plates and tabletop items) where aesthetic appeal, heritage, craftsmanship, and brand storytelling drive purchasing decisions, not as much the technical features or functionality.



We need a designer who understands how to visually communicate desirability, quality, brand love, emotional connection, and luxury positioning on Amazon. We have thousands of images to produce, so efficiency and AI-powered workflow expertise are required .



 



 



Key Responsibilities



Design Amazon-compliant product listing images (main images, lifestyle, A+ content, infographics where appropriate).

Translate brand identity, heritage, and craftsmanship into compelling, emotional, visual narratives.

Create imagery that elevates perceived value and reinforces luxury positioning.

Develop scalable, AI-assisted workflows to produce large volumes of high-quality images efficiently.

Ensure all assets meet Amazon image guidelines and optimize for conversion.

Maintain visual consistency across multiple SKUs and collections that match the brand vibe

 



Required Experience



Proven experience designing product images specifically for Amazon marketplace listings.

Demonstrated work with luxury, premium, or heritage-driven brands.

Experience marketing design-led products (homeware, décor, tabletop, fashion, beauty, lifestyle brands, etc.) where emotional appeal outweighs technical features.

Advanced proficiency with AI image-generation tools and automation workflows to produce high-volume content quickly.

Deep understanding of conversion-focused visual strategy for Amazon.

 



 



Ideal Candidate



Understands the psychology of premium buyers, how they shop, where they research (example social media)

Can visually communicate craftsmanship, legacy, and exclusivity.

Balances brand integrity with marketplace performance.

Highly organized and able to manage large-scale asset production.

Can work independently but also within boundaries of a larger system

title: Executive Assistant
description:
The Role

Core Studios is a premium real estate content production company with nine specialist departments, serving leading agencies and developers across Australia. We’re scaling fast and need an exceptional EA to become the operational backbone of our leadership team.

You’ll primarily support the General Manager while providing structured support to Directors across the business. This isn’t a task-taker role — you’re a strategic support partner who protects executive time, drives accountability, and ensures nothing falls through the cracks.

The principle is simple: the GM should only do what only the GM can do. Everything else is your domain.



What You’ll Own

•	Calendar & Time Management — Full ownership of the GM’s schedule. Prioritise by strategic value, prepare briefings, protect focus time, and coordinate across the leadership team.

•
 & Communications — Triage the GM’s inbox, draft responses in their voice (confident, warm, direct), chase follow-ups, and manage cross-departmental communication via
 and Slack.

•	Accountability & Follow-Through — Maintain a live priority tracker, ensure department leads deliver on commitments, prepare weekly reports, and escalate blockers before they become problems. This is the most critical function of the role.

•	Meeting & Leadership Support — Prepare agendas and pre-reads, capture minutes and action items, track accountability, and ensure Directors have what they need ahead of key meetings.

•	Financial & Reporting Support — Revenue summaries, targets vs actuals, invoice follow-up, department dashboards, and budget tracking across Xero and Google Sheets.

•	CRM & Systems — Keep CRM data clean, manage job management platforms, maintain SOPs, and support system migrations and process documentation.

•	Sales & Client Support — Draft proposals and pitch decks, track pipeline activity, prepare client-facing collateral, and research new business opportunities.

•	Operations & Production — Coordinate suppliers, track SLAs, follow up on production deadlines, and manage vendor databases.

•	Marketing & Content — Schedule social content, draft LinkedIn posts for the GM, repurpose internal content into external thought leadership, and research competitor positioning.

•	Travel & Personal Admin — Book travel (domestic and international), manage personal appointments, coordinate household admin, handle remote errands, and manage subscriptions.

•	AI & Automation — Use Claude, ChatGPT, Zapier, and similar tools to accelerate workflows, automate repeatable processes, and continuously improve efficiency.



What We’re Looking For

•	3+ years as an EA or VA supporting a senior leader

•	Exceptional written and verbal English — you’ll be writing as the GM

•	Strong commercial awareness and ability to understand business context quickly

•	Highly organised with relentless follow-through and attention to detail

•	Proactive problem-solver who fixes things before anyone notices

•	Comfortable managing up — you’ll hold leadership accountable, diplomatically

•	Tech-fluent across Google Workspace, Slack, CRM, and project management tools

•	Available to work Australian business hours (AEST/AEDT)

•	Discreet and trustworthy with confidential information



You Are

•	Proactive — you anticipate needs and act before being asked

•	An owner — you treat leadership priorities as your own

•	Emotionally intelligent — you read situations and adapt with discretion

•	Relentless — zero dropped balls, ever

•	Resourceful — you find solutions before escalating

•	Premium — you take pride in polished, high-quality work



How We’ll Measure Success

•	GM’s inbox at zero unactioned items daily

•	All action items tracked and followed up within 24 hours

•	Zero missed deadlines across executive and Director priorities

•	Weekly reporting delivered on time, every time

•	Department follow-ups executed without prompting

•	GM operating in a full CEO capacity within 90 days



How to Apply

Submit your resume/CV and a brief cover letter or Loom video explaining why you’re the right fit. Please include two professional references from previous executive-level support roles.

title: Dental Dentrix Biller
description:
Dental Biller (Dentrix) — Part-time to Full-time (20–40 hrs/week)

Location: Remote (must have reliable internet and quiet work environment)

Schedule: Must work during our office business hours (Pacific Time).



About the Role

We’re looking for an experienced Dental Biller who knows their way around Dentrix (minimum requirement) and can own the full billing cycle—from verifying eligibility to clean claim submission, patient ledgers, and persistent A/R follow-up. If you thrive on accuracy, speed, and getting claims paid the first time, we want to meet you.



Key Responsibilities

Insurance & Patient Ledgers: Maintain accurate patient ledgers, apply payments/adjustments, manage refunds, and resolve discrepancies.

A/R Management: Work aging reports (30/60/90+), reduce outstanding balances, and document all follow-ups with payers and patients.

Eligibility & Benefits: Verify insurance eligibility and detailed plan benefits; enter benefits into Dentrix and update coverage tables/fee schedules.

Claims & Attachments: Create, scrub, and submit clean claims; attach required X-rays, perio charts, and narratives; track and resolve denials.

Posting & Reconciliation: Post EOBs/ERAs accurately, reconcile deposits, and balance daily/weekly reports.

Data Entry & Audits: Keep patient and insurance data current; run periodic audits for accuracy and compliance.

Patient Billing: Generate patient statements, manage payment plans, and communicate balances professionally and empathetically.



Must-Haves

2+ years dental billing experience in a U.S. dental practice or RCM service.

Dentrix proficiency (required).

Proven experience with insurance eligibility, entering benefits into software, full A/R, and patient ledger management.

Strong knowledge of CDT codes, PPO policies, secondary coordination of benefits, and common denial reasons.

HIPAA-compliant work practices and high attention to detail.

Excellent written and verbal communication.

Ability to work live during our office business hours (Pacific Time).



Nice-to-Haves

Experience with Eaglesoft or Open Dental in addition to Dentrix.

Familiarity with clearinghouses (e.g., Vyne, ClaimConnect, DentalXChange) and e-attachments.

Prior remote work experience with measurable A/R reduction results.



Tools You’ll Use

Dentrix (required)

Clearinghouse/e-attachments platform

Secure communications (HIPAA compliant)

Spreadsheet/reporting tools for A/R tracking



Hours & Compensation

20–40 hours per week, with potential to scale based on performance and practice needs.



How to Apply

Please send:

Your resume (PDF)

A brief note detailing your Dentrix experience and monthly A/R impact you’ve achieved

Two professional references

A 60–90 second introduction video: introduce yourself, summarize your Dentrix experience, and share a quick A/R win. Include a shareable link.



Quick Screening Questions (include with your application)

How many years have you worked in dental billing and with Dentrix specifically?

Describe your process for verifying eligibility and entering benefits into Dentrix—including downgrades and frequency limitations.

What KPIs do you track for A/R (e.g., % over 90 days)? Share a recent result you’re proud of.

Which clearinghouse and e-attachment tools have you used?

Are you available for 20–40 hrs/week and able to work during our office business hours (PT)?

Please include a link to your 60–90s introduction video.

title: Strategic Operations Leader – STR/LTR Portfolio (High-Performance Lead for Pooling)
description:
The Mission: Turn Potential into Performance

We have a solid team of remote guest support, but we are currently missing a results-driven leader to unify them. We don’t need a "boss" to watch the clock; we need a high-level operator who can walk into a workflow, identify bottlenecks, and execute solutions immediately.



If you are a high-achiever who gets frustrated by mediocrity and thrives when given the authority to make things happen, this is your seat.



Why Top Leaders Join LuxoStays

Performance-Driven Pay: Your income is tied to your impact. Hit your KPIs and eliminate attendance issues to trigger aggressive bonuses and/or base pay increase.



Full Operational Authority: You aren't just following SOPs; you are rewriting them. You have the green light to overhaul team culture and demand excellence.



AI-Powered Efficiency: We lead with tech. You will be expected to use ChatGPT, Claude, and AI automation to outpace the competition and streamline guest services.

mbers to take more initiative.

The Package

title: Agency GHL Automation & CRM Specialist
description:
WHO WE ARE

Candor Marketing is a nationally focused agency that builds predictable patient pipelines exclusively for aesthetic and wellness clinics. We don't sell marketing services — we sell outcomes. We guarantee results, we operate on documented systems, and we build everything on the Hormozi framework: make the offer so good that saying no feels stupid, deliver so much value that clients never want to leave, and build systems that scale without depending on any one person.



We hire specialists. Not generalists. If you're the best at what you do and you want to be part of building a nationally recognized brand, keep reading.



THE ROLE

You are the engine behind every client account. You build and manage the complete GoHighLevel infrastructure that turns ad clicks into booked appointments — automatically, reliably, and at a standard that makes our clients feel like they have a world-class tech team in their corner.



This is a builder role. You own the system.



WHAT YOU'LL DO

Build and manage all client GoHighLevel sub-accounts including pipelines, automations, SMS and
 follow-up sequences, reactivation campaigns, reputation management workflows, and live reporting dashboards.



Connect all client landing pages — built externally in Webflow, Lovable, or ClickFunnels — to GoHighLevel so every form submission triggers the correct pipeline stage, automation sequence, and contact record instantly and accurately.

Build automated follow-up sequences that convert leads into booked appointments without any manual effort from the clinic. Every sequence needs to feel human, move with urgency, and reflect the value-dense Hormozi style offer the client is running.

Run patient reactivation campaigns into existing client databases every 60 days — segmented, sequenced, and built to generate found revenue with zero ad spend.



Build and maintain real-time dashboards every client can check from their phone showing exactly what their investment is producing. No vanity metrics. Revenue, leads, booked appointments, cost per acquisition.

Document every workflow, automation, and system you build in our SOP library. If you get hit by a bus tomorrow, someone else can run your accounts by end of day. That's the standard.



WHAT YOU NEED

Minimum 2 years of hands-on GoHighLevel experience with complex multi-step automations and full sub-account builds. Proof of work required — no exceptions.



Experience integrating GoHighLevel with third party platforms via Zapier or Make.



Familiarity connecting external landing page platforms like Webflow, Lovable, or ClickFunnels to GHL form submissions and automation triggers.



Strong understanding of lead nurture logic, pipeline architecture, and conversion principles.

Experience with clinic or healthcare software like Jane App, Mindbody, or PatientNow is a strong plus.



WHO YOU ARE

You are obsessively organized, proactive, and you take ownership. You don't wait for things to break. You catch problems before clients do. You communicate clearly in writing, work independently without hand-holding, and you build systems you're proud of — clean architecture, properly named automations, documented workflows.



You understand that in the Hormozi framework every system we build needs to be so dialed in, so value-dense, and so results-oriented that our clients would feel crazy leaving. You build with that standard in mind every single time.



COMPENSATION

Strictly hourly. $25–$45/hour based on experience. Hours tracked and submitted weekly. Workload scales with our client roster. Strong performers move into retainer arrangements as the agency grows.



HOW TO APPLY

Apply with "Candor Marketing - GHL Specialist" as your subject line to be proof you have read the description. ALL applications that do not do this will be discarded immediately. We also require you include a brief description of the most complex GHL system you've ever built plus two or three examples of your work — screenshots, a Loom walkthrough. No proof of work, no consideration.

title: Copywriter
description:
About Us



We partner with individuals, teams, and organisations to build communication, leadership, sales, and performance capabilities through world-class training and professional development. Our work spans industries and career stages, from emerging leaders to executive teams, and our content needs to speak to both people and businesses with clarity, credibility, and warmth.



The Opportunity



We’re looking for an experienced B2B + B2C Copywriter who can turn insights, outcomes, and program value into compelling copy that drives action, without hype. You’ll write across the funnel: lead generation, nurture, conversion, and retention.



This is an ideal role for someone who understands the difference between writing for a buyer (HR/L&D, managers, executives) and writing for a participant (individual learners), and can adapt voice, structure, and persuasion techniques accordingly.



You’ll support a mix of projects including:



-
 sequences (lead nurture, event promotion, re-engagement, onboarding)

- Lead magnets (guides, checklists, short ebooks, landing-page assets)

- Website copy (program pages, landing pages, SEO-informed content)

- Video ad scripts 

- Social media content 

- Sales proposals 



What Success Looks Like



- Copy that is clear, structured, benefit-led, and aligned with a premium, trusted brand

- Strong conversion-focused writing that still feels human and credible

- Messaging that differentiates between B2B decision-maker needs (risk, ROI, outcomes, implementation) and B2C motivations (confidence, career growth, communication, leadership)

- Consistent quality and fast turnaround, with thoughtful questions when needed



About You



You’re likely a great fit if you have:

- Proven copywriting experience across B2B and B2C, ideally in services, education, training, coaching, or professional development

- Strong portfolio examples across
, landing pages, and conversion copy

- Ability to write in a confident, professional voice that feels modern, not “salesy”

- Excellent attention to detail and the ability to self-edit ruthlessly

- Comfort working with briefs, brand guidelines, and stakeholder feedback

- Bonus: familiarity with positioning outcomes, program benefits, and behaviour-change messaging



How to Apply



Please send:

- A short intro (2–4 paragraphs)

- 3–5 relevant portfolio samples (links or PDFs), ideally including
 + landing page or sales copy

- Your availability (hours per week or capacity)

title: Virtual Assistant - Simple Tutorial Video Creator (No Voiceover Required)
description:

Create hundreds of short tutorials focused on how to do one specific task, usually within the same tool or software, ultimately becoming an expert on that selected software.

Workload: Minimum expectation is 200 videos per month.



Training: Full, comprehensive training is provided.

title: Tax Preparer (Part-Time | Remote | Seasonal)
description:
Position: Tax Preparer (Part-Time | Remote | Seasonal)

Location: Remote

Hours: Part-time, seasonal (tax season)

Compensation: TBD

Type: 1099 Subcontractor



================================================



Looking for meaningful tax work with a firm that actually thinks strategically?



Join a small, focused remote team where your attention to detail and technical skills directly impact real clients building real wealth.



================================================

ABOUT US

================================================



At OpenPath Finance, we help business owners, Bitcoiners, and freedom-minded entrepreneurs take control of their finances, reduce their tax burden, and build lasting wealth.



We're not here just to file returns. We work closely with clients year-round to strategically plan their tax and financial operations and ensure those plans are reflected in their books and filings. We care about the details because they drive real results.



We're a small, focused team that values thoughtful action, steady progress, and full ownership of our work. We're not looking for perfection, but we do look for people who take initiative, ask smart questions, and follow through.



If you're someone who pursues purpose, embraces growth, and wants to contribute to meaningful work with real impact, you'll feel right at home here. Learn more at 
.



================================================

ROLE OVERVIEW

================================================



We're hiring a Tax Preparer to join our team during tax season. You'll be assigned a mix of personal and business returns to prepare, and you'll also serve as the first-level reviewer on your teammate's work before anything reaches the firm owner and tax advisor.



The goal is simple: by the time a return reaches the tax advisor for final sign-off, it has been prepared carefully and reviewed thoroughly. His role is a quick final check, not a detailed review. That standard is on you and your teammate to uphold together.



This is a technical, detail-oriented role with real accountability. You'll work independently, manage your own queue, and communicate clearly when something needs escalation.



================================================

RESPONSIBILITIES

================================================



- Prepare assigned U.S. tax returns accurately and on time, including complex 1040s, 1065s, and 1120-S returns

- Perform first-level peer review on teammate's prepared returns before submission to firm owner

- Document review notes clearly so the final reviewer can move quickly and confidently

- Meet turnaround standard: returns must be finalized within two weeks of receiving a completed organizer

- Communicate proactively when client information is missing, unclear, or when a return requires escalation

- Follow firm workflows in TaxDome and prepare returns in Drake



================================================

REQUIREMENTS

================================================



- 5+ years of hands-on U.S. tax preparation and review experience

- Strong technical knowledge of complex Forms 1040, 1065, and 1120-S, 1120

- Experience working remotely for a U.S.-based CPA firm or tax practice

- Proficient in Drake Tax software

- Communicates clearly and professionally in written English -- client-facing communication is a core part of this role, including status updates, document requests, and follow-up questions

- Works independently, meets deadlines, and follows through without being chased

- Available during U.S. business hours, with morning Central Time availability required for weekly tea
etings and working sessions with their team pod



================================================

PREFERRED

================================================



- Experience reviewing others' tax work, not just preparing

- Familiarity with TaxDome or similar tax workflow platforms

- Knowledge of Bitcoin, Bitcoin mining, and related tax and accounting considerations



================================================

GROWTH PATH

================================================



This starts as a seasonal, part-time engagement. For the right person, there is a clear path to increased hours, year-round work, and a more senior role within the firm as we grow. We invest in people who take ownership and grow with us.



================================================

HOW TO APPLY

================================================



To apply, click the Apply button and include the following in your message:



1. A link to your resume (Google Docs or Dropbox)

2. A short note -- no more than 2 paragraphs -- on why this role interests you and what kind of tax work you've handled most

3. Answer this question in 3-5 sentences: Describe a time you caught a significant error in a tax return, whether your own or someone else's. What was it and how did you handle it?



We review written responses first. Strong communicators who demonstrate real tax experience will move to the next stage.

title: Patient Support Representative (Medical Customer Service)
description:
About Us

We’re building a global talent pool of exceptional remote Patient Support professionals to support partner clinics across Australia, the US, the UK, New Zealand, and beyond. These clinics deliver modern healthcare, often combining general practice with wellness, integrative, and allied health support.



Our shared mission is simple: make healthcare more human—calm, clear, patient-first support that improves access, continuity of care, and measurable outcomes.



If you’re empathetic, detail-oriented, and thrive in structured remote work, we’d love to meet you.



Role Overview

As a Patient Support Representative (Medical Customer Service), you’ll be the friendly and professional bridge between patients, clinicians, and care teams—helping patients move smoothly from first contact, intake, booking, and follow-up.



This is a pooling/talent pipeline role. Successful candidates may be matched to open roles with clinics based on:

- Your experience (clinical/admin)

- Your preferred shift coverage (AU/UK/US)

- Tools you’ve used (EMR/CRM/VoIP)

- Compensation alignment and scope



What You’ll Do (Key Responsibilities)

- Provide patient support via phone,
, SMS, and chat with a calm, empathetic tone.

- Manage shared inboxes/queues and ensure timely updates (no one gets left waiting).

- Coordinate appointments: scheduling, confirmations, reminders, and troubleshooting.

- Assist patients with onboarding steps: intake forms, consent, health summaries, and identity checks (per clinic policy).

- Maintain accurate patient records and documentation in EMR/EHR/CRM systems.

- Support clinicians with administrative tasks that keep consults on track (handoffs, notes, follow-up tasks).

- Handle prescription-related requests only within clinic policy (e.g., routing refill requests, coordinating with pharmacies).

- Coordinate with pharmacies when required (scripts, transfers, stock checks) and flag urgent concerns.

- Support compliance-minded workflows (documentation completeness, required forms, audit-friendly notes).

- Handle complaints and sensitive situations professionally; use de-escalation skills and escalation pathways.

- Work closely with an international team across time zones using async updates and clear handoffs.

- Protect patient privacy and confidentiality at all times.



Must-Have Qualifications

- 2+ years in a patient-facing role in healthcare support, clinic admin, or medical customer service.

- Strong spoken and written English (confident with international patients).

- Excellent communication skills: warm, clear, patient, and non-judgmental.

- High attention to detail and comfort with structured documentation.

- Able to multitask across patient support + scheduling + admin without losing accuracy.

- Remote-ready: reliable attendance, self-management, and proactive communication.

- Comfortable learning new tools quickly (EHR/EMR, CRM, scheduling, VoIP).

- Reliable home setup: quiet private workspace, headset, stable internet, and backup plan.

- Willingness to work shifts that overlap with AU/UK/US/NZ clinic hours depending on assignment.

Note: Some matched roles may prefer a clinical background (e.g., Nursing graduate). Others prioritize healthcare admin + strong customer service. We’ll match based on fit.



Nice-to-Haves (Bonus Points)

- Clincal experience supporting AU/UK/US/NZ patients.

- Familiarity with any EHR/EMR (e.g., Best Practice, Halaxy, SimplePractice, Athena, DrChrono, Practice Better, Kareo, etc.).

- Experience with CRMs/ticketing tools (e.g., Podium, HubSpot, Zendesk, Freshdesk).

- VoIP/SMS tools experience (RingCentral, Dialpad, Twilio-based systems).

- Pharmacy coordination or medication follow-up experience (within policy).

- Training in de-escalation, complaint handling, or mental health first aid.

- Experience supporting wellness-focused services (pain, stress, sleep, integrative care, allied health).



Work Setup & Scheduling (PH-based)

- Location: Philippines (remote)

- Shift options: Vary by clinic assignment

AU/NZ-friendly (PH day shift)

UK-friendly (PH late afternoon/evening)

US-friendly (PH night shift)

- Strong preference for candidates who can commit to consistent overlap windows and provide clear handoffs.



Compensation (General Guidance)

Pay varies by clinic, scope, and shift coverage. When you apply, we’ll ask your expected rate and match you to roles accordingly.

Typical structures include hourly (USD/AUD/GBP) or fixed monthly rates, with a possible internet stipend and night differential for US shifts.



How to Apply (Required)

Please submit:

1. CV / Resume

2. A short video introduction (1–2 minutes) covering:

- Your background in healthcare support / medical customer service

- Tools you’ve used (EHR/EMR/CRM/VoIP)

- Your preferred shift overlap (AU/UK/US)

- A brief example of how you handle a stressed or upset patient



Our Screening Process (What to Expect)

- Initial communication screen (English + professionalism + remote readiness)

- Practical task: patient reply + scheduling + documentation sample

- Structured interview: scenarios on empathy, privacy, accuracy, and escalation judgment



Join the pool

If you’re patient-first, calm under pressure, and take pride in accurate documentation, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Product Management Virtual Assistant
description:
Hi, I’m hiring a Virtual Assistant to help me manage my
 inbox and support my job search.

I am looking for a smart, reliable, detail-oriented VA who can help me stay organized, manage communication, and support the job application process.



I am specifically looking for someone who is comfortable with repetitive tasks, can follow clear instructions, and communicates well in English.



Pay and Hours

Starting pay: $4/hour

Starting hours: 5 to 10 hours/week

If things go well, this can grow to 20 to 30+ hours/week over time

Pay can increase as trust, speed, and responsibility increase





What You’ll Be Doing

 Inbox Support

Review incoming
s (recruiters, job alerts, interview updates, networking messages, etc.)

Organize
s into folders/labels using a system I provide

Flag urgent
s and important deadlines

Archive spam or low-priority
s

Draft replies for my review (using templates and my preferred style)

Track follow-ups so nothing gets missed





Job Search / Job Application Support

Search for relevant Product Manager job openings based on my criteria

Save job links and details into a tracker (Google Sheets / Notion / etc.)

Help identify which jobs are a strong fit vs not a fit (I will train you)

Prepare application info for review (job link, notes, resume version, etc.)

Submit applications only after approval (or later, independently after training)

Track application status, dates, follow-ups, and responses

Monitor job boards,
, and application portals for updates





Admin / Organization Support

Keep trackers clean and up to date

Create simple summaries in Google Docs or Slides

Follow written instructions/SOPs carefully

Help me stay organized and consistent



Required Skills

Strong written English (clear and professional)

High attention to detail (very important)

Reliable and consistent

Organized and good at process-based tasks

Comfortable using Gmail / Google Workspace

Comfortable using Google Sheets and Google Docs

Good web research skills

Able to handle private/confidential information professionally

Comfortable using a VPN (required for some tasks)



Nice to Have (but not required)

Previous Virtual Assistant / Executive Assistant / Admin Assistant experience

Experience helping with job applications or recruiting/admin support

Familiarity with LinkedIn, Indeed, company career pages, etc.

Experience with Notion, Airtable, or Trello

Basic Canva or Google Slides formatting skills

Familiarity with Product Manager job titles/keywords (helpful only)





Security / Confidentiality (Important)

Because this role involves
 and job application support, confidentiality is very important.

You must be willing to:

Follow instructions carefully when accessing accounts

Use a VPN when required

Keep all information private and confidential

Never share account access, personal information, or screenshots

Ask questions if something is unclear instead of guessing





What I’m Looking For

Detail-oriented

Dependable

Good communicator

Fast learner

Honest and trustworthy

Comfortable with feedback

Able to follow a process consistently



If you do well, this role can grow into more hours, higher pay, and more responsibility over time.



How to Apply

If interested, please apply here: 



In your application, please include:

Your experience as a VA (or similar role)

Any experience with inbox management or job application support

Tools you have used (Gmail, Google Sheets, LinkedIn, Notion, etc.)

Your weekly availability and time zone

Your experience using a VPN (if any)

A short note on how you stay organized when handling repeated tasks





Bonus (helps you stand out)

 In your application, include the phrase:

 “Detail matters.”

 This helps me know you read the full post.

title: Full-Stack Systems Architect & UI/UX Designer
description:

title: Performance Marketing Manager
description:
PropZap — We’re Building a Dream Team to Shape the Future of Real Estate in North America.



We are not building just another brokerage.



We are building a scalable real estate platform designed to modernize how homes are bought and sold — through systems, technology, disciplined execution, and long-term vision.



Our ambition is not incremental growth.

It is structured, North American scale.



And we are intentionally building a high-caliber team aligned with that mission.



If you are driven by measurable impact.

If you believe performance marketing should compound over time.

If you want to build infrastructure, not just campaigns.



We want you to take the helm of our growth engine.



--------------------------------------------------------------



Role: Performance Marketing Manager

Location: Remote

Shift: Aligned with Canada MST

Role Type: Any

Compensation: 50,000 PHP+

Company: PropZap — Building the next-generation real estate platform for North America



This is a revenue-accountable growth leadership role.



You are directly responsible for building and scaling the paid acquisition engine that fuels expansion.



You will not simply execute instructions.



You will lead marketing performance strategy.



Your performance will be measured by qualified lead volume, conversion efficiency, disciplined optimization, and the strength of the systems you build.



You are expected to be the internal expert for marketing matters — the person leadership turns to for strategic insight, innovative ideas, and informed recommendations.



--------------------------------------------------------------



Your Core Responsibilities:



Meta Ads Leadership (Most Critical)

• Manage and scale large-budget Meta Ads campaigns

• Architect structured campaign systems designed for scale

• Plan ad angles, hooks, positioning, and creative strategy

• Write high-converting direct-response copy

• Produce graphic and video ad creatives (for ads)

• Execute disciplined A/B testing frameworks

• Optimize based on cost per qualified lead and full-funnel data



You must have proven, hands-on experience managing significant ad budgets.



Landing Page Optimization (Squarespace)

• Optimize and improve our existing landing page (
)

• Increase conversion rates through structured experimentation

• Refine messaging clarity and CTA effectiveness

• Improve user journey and reduce friction

• Ensure advanced tracking accuracy



Future scope may include additional landing pages and funnel expansion as we scale.



 Marketing & Lead Management (HubSpot)

• Build and optimize structured
 nurture systems

• Segment and organize both new and existing leads

• Implement disciplined tagging and CRM organization

• Improve engagement and conversion rates

• Maintain clean, scalable list architecture

• Ensure seamless handoff of qualified leads



Analytics, Tracking & Attribution

• Implement advanced tracking systems (Pixel, CAPI, UTM strategy)

• Maintain CRM attribution clarity from click to handoff

• Analyze full-funnel performance, not surface metrics

• Identify bottlenecks and propose structured improvements

• Document A/B tests and build repeatable optimization frameworks



Marketing Leadership & Innovation

• Proactively propose innovative growth strategies

• Stay current with emerging trends, tools, platforms, and advertising strategies

• Evaluate new opportunities and recommend adoption when appropriate

• Serve as the internal authority on paid growth and performance marketing

• Guide leadership decisions with data and informed insight



You are not just executing campaigns.



You are setting direction.



--------------------------------------------------------------



Who You Are:



You are driven by growth, ownership, and long-term impact.

• Proven, hands-on experience managing large Meta Ads budgets

• Deep understanding of direct-response marketing and buyer psychology

• Ability to independently plan creative angles and performance strategy

• Strong copywriting and positioning skills

• Comfortable producing ad creatives when required

• Strong analytical thinking and disciplined testing mindset

• Structured in documentation and optimization

• Accountable for measurable outcomes

• Continuously learning and staying ahead of platform changes and trends



Highly Ideal:

• Real estate marketing experience

• Experience promoting brokerages to attract agents

• Experience generating buyer and seller leads

• Understanding how to position real estate services competitively



Requirements:

• Demonstrated success managing large Meta Ads budgets

• Strong landing page optimization experience

• Advanced analytics and tracking knowledge

• Experience using HubSpot for segmentation and
 marketing

• Experience implementing structured A/B testing systems

• Reliable remote setup



Bonus If You Have:

• SEO experience

• Google Ads experience

• AI tools and automation knowledge

• Zapier or workflow automation experience

• Advanced CRM tagging and list organization skills



--------------------------------------------------------------



What We Offer:

• A long-term opportunity inside a scaling North American proptech platform

• Direct collaboration with founders

• Meaningful ownership of paid acquisition performance

• The opportunity to architect and refine the company’s growth engine

• Clear path toward future Head of Marketing

• Real influence on continental expansion



We are building a team designed to scale.



The platform is expanding.

The systems are strengthening.

The ambition is long-term.



We are looking for someone who sees themselves not just as a marketing manager — but as the growth leader who helps steer the direction of a North American real estate platform.



--------------------------------------------------------------



How to Apply



Send the following to: 



• Resume (required)

• Portfolio (required)

• Case studies or performance summaries of Meta campaigns (required)

• Summary of budgets managed (required)

• Intro video (preferred)

• Expected monthly compensation (required)

• Internet speed test link (required)

• Any DISC test result (if available)



Subject Line: Performance Marketing Manager – Your Name



NOTE: Failure to follow the application instructions exactly will result in disqualification. Attention to detail matters, and the application process reflects the level of discipline we value.



If you are ready to take the helm of our growth engine and help build the future of real estate in North America, we want to hear from you.

title: Part-Time Sales Development Specialist (GoHighLevel)
description:
Job Title: Part-Time Sales Development Specialist (SDR)

Location: Remote (Chicago Time Zone preferred)

Hours: Part-Time (9:00 AM – 5:00 PM CT) with potential to grow into Full-Time

Compensation: Base + Commission (performance-based incentives)



About the Role

This is not a general admin role. We are looking for a sales-focused, proactive virtual assistant who can:

- Generate leads and fill the sales pipeline

- Cold call and connect with potential clients (especially small law firms)

- Manage communication and onboarding of new clients

- Take ownership of results with minimal supervision

- You will play a critical role in helping the business grow by reaching more potential clients and increasing revenue.



Key Responsibilities

- Conduct outbound calls to potential clients to introduce services

- Generate qualified leads and maintain the sales pipeline in HighLevel CRM

- Assist with client onboarding (Zoom calls, account setup, and workflow guidance) as needed

- Create or adapt outreach scripts and messaging for cold calls and
 campaigns

- Track and report performance metrics: number of calls, qualified leads, and closed clients

- Work independently, creatively, and proactively to solve problems and generate results



Required Skills & Qualifications

- Strong verbal communication skills and confidence on the phone

- Sales-driven mindset with a focus on generating results

- Self-starter: able to work independently without micromanagement

- Creative thinking: able to craft outreach strategies and adapt messaging

- Comfortable with tools like HighLevel CRM and Zoom (experience is a plus)

- Organized and reliable with strong time-management skills

- Motivated by performance and commission-based incentives



Preferred Traits

- Previous experience in sales or business development

- Familiarity with small law firms or professional service industries

- Comfortable working part-time initially, with growth into full-time possible

- Goal-oriented: able to track KPIs and contribute to pipeline growth



Performance Expectations

- Generate at least 2 new clients in the first month (stretch goal: 5)

- Build a growing pipeline of qualified leads

- Take initiative and continuously improve outreach strategies



Why Join the Team?

- Work directly with a business owner in a growth-focused, flexible environment

- Opportunity to take ownership and shape your role

- Earn commission based on performance

- Grow with the business as responsibilities and opportunities expand



How to Apply

Please submit your application including:

1. A brief cover letter introducing yourself and your experience

2. Your resume or CV



Applications without a detailed description of how your skills match the role will not be considered.

title: Social Media Manager/Virtual Assistant
description:
Content • SEO • Lead Generation



Company: Home Codify

Location: Remote (Metro Manila preferred)

Position Type: Part-Time | Long-Term Growth Opportunity



About Home Codify:

Home Codify is a fast-growing professional organizing company serving North Dallas and the DFW Metroplex. We specialize in decluttering, packing & unpacking, and creating calm, functional homes for busy families.



We are not looking for a “content poster.”

We are hiring a strategic marketing partner who understands how to turn visibility into booked clients.



Who This Role Is For:

This role is for an experienced marketing professional who:

 • Understands local SEO deeply

title: We’re Hiring: Expert Video Ad Creator for Meta (Facebook & Instagram)
description:
About Us:

Our company is a Los Angeles–based design and build company with over 9 years of experience serving homeowners across Southern California. We specialize in ADU construction, home remodeling, additions, and full design-build projects — and we’re growing fast!



We’re looking for a creative and skilled Video Ad Creator who can produce scroll-stopping, high-converting Meta video ads that highlight our services and attract new clients.



Your Main Role:

You’ll be responsible for creating engaging video ads for Meta platforms —
 and Instagram.

Each video should tell a story, educate viewers, and motivate them to call or message us for our construction and ADU services.



What You’ll Do:

Create high-quality, engaging, and persuasive video ads optimized for Meta.

Edit and repurpose existing footage, photos, and renders into dynamic ad content.

Write or follow compelling ad scripts that drive viewer action (calls or form submissions).

Add text overlays, motion graphics, captions, and smooth transitions.

Stay updated with Meta ad trends and optimize creative formats for better CTR and conversions.

Collaborate with our marketing team to align visuals with campaigns and messaging.

Manage and organize project files for easy access and revisions.



Requirements:

Proven experience creating Meta 
 & Instagram) video ads — please provide examples or portfolio links.

Strong understanding of ad storytelling, pacing, and emotional triggers.

killed in tools like CapCut, Premiere Pro, After Effects, Canva, or similar AI video software (e.g., InVideo, Pictory, Vizard).

Ability to design videos in 9:16 and 1:1 formats, optimized for Reels and feeds.

Good English communication and script comprehension.

Able to work independently with minimal supervision and deliver on deadlines.



Nice to Have (Bonus):

Experience in the construction, home design, or real estate industry

Familiarity with AI tools for video generation and voiceover

Understanding of Meta Ads Manager performance metrics and creative testing



Work Hours & Compensation:

Flexible schedule (prefer availability during Pacific Time business hours for communication)

Competitive pay – depends on experience and portfolio quality

Long-term position for the right candidate



How to Apply:

Please send your portfolio or sample Meta ads you’ve created. 



Send your application with the subject line:

“Meta Video Ad Creator – [Your Name]”

title: URGENT HIRING: Virtual Assistant - Administrator, IT and Accounting Xero Certified and have Australian Accounting
description:
You only get one chance: carefully follow these instructions before applying or you will not hear from us. To apply you must visit our webpage 
/job-opportunities/undergraduate-to-senior-accountant/



Company: Health and Life



Location: Remote (with own internet and office facilities)



Job Type: Contract (may go long term depending on performance)



About Us:

Health and Life Access is a well-established healthcare consulting Chartered Accounting firm organisation specialising in the management of service entities and organizations throughout Australia and overseas. We are committed to creating a sustainable and socially responsible healthcare system.



Job Description:

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Virtual Assistant to provide administrative, IT, and accounting support to our organisation and clients. The successful candidate will report to the CEO and relevant supervisors, ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of our business.



Key Responsibilities:

Provide administrative, IT, and accounting support to the CEO and other consultants/managers.

Maintain accurate records, perform bookkeeping, and handle client billing.

Assist with financial reporting, budgeting, and petty cash management.

Manage calendars, appointments, and correspondence.

Develop and maintain effective working relationships with staff, clients, and suppliers.

Identify and resolve problems promptly, providing potential solutions.

Participate in special projects and additional duties as required.



Requirements:

Xero Certified and have Australian Accounting experience preferred.

Proven experience in administration, IT, and accounting.

Proficiency in using Google Suite, Xero, FileMaker Pro, and other software as specified.

Strong organisational and communication skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Commitment to maintaining confidentiality and adhering to ethical standards.

Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple tasks efficiently.



Working Conditions:

Standard 38-hour week, Monday to Friday, 8:30 am to 5:00 pm ACDT.

Flexible working hours may be required.

Must have own internet and office facilities.

No leave entitlement applies

All tasks are allocated by a Google calendar. The more you complete competently and within budget, the more work you generate.



Fees:

Task-based monthly fees up to $3,000 AUD or equivalent overseas currency. Long term contract positions available based on performance.



Fees reviewed based on performance; potential for multiple fee increases for good performance.



How to Apply:

If you are a motivated and detail-oriented individual with a passion for healthcare administration.



To apply visit our ”Undergraduate up to senior accountant jobs” web page 
/job-opportunities/undergraduate-to-senior-accountant/.



Attention to detail matters, so read the application process carefully. You only get one chance.
