title: Social Media Content Manager
description:
About Tom’s Waffles

Tom’s Waffles is a fast-growing catering and events company based in Denver, Colorado. We serve fresh Belgian waffles and coffee at schools, corporate offices, markets, and private events. We host around 20 events per week and are growing quickly.

We are looking for a reliable, disciplined Social Media Content Manager to help us consistently publish engaging content and grow our brand presence online.

This is not a strategy-only role. This is an execution-focused role.

What You Will Do

You will manage and execute our Instagram content using event photos and videos provided by our event team.

Each week, your responsibilities include:

Content Creation & Posting

Create and publish:

2 Instagram feed posts

1 Instagram Reel (video editing required)

1–2 Instagram Stories

Write clean, professional captions with clear calls-to-action

Include booking links, hiring information, and
 signup promotions when appropriate

Schedule posts using Meta Business Suite

Video Editing

Edit short vertical videos (10–30 seconds)

Add captions, music, and simple visual effects

Make videos engaging and energetic

Photo Editing

Light editing (brightness, cropping, formatting)

Maintain a consistent visual style

Content Organization

Pull photos and videos from our WhatsApp group (event leads upload content)

Select the best content for posts

Organize weekly content calendar

Engagement

Reply professionally to comments and direct messages

Escalate important inquiries to management

Reporting

Send a short monthly performance summary:

Followers gained

Website clicks

Engagement rate

Any event inquiries from Instagram

Content Focus Areas

You will create content around:

Event highlights (real people, real reactions)

Hiring announcements

Catering promotions

Waffle subscription promotions

 list “lottery” promotions

Behind-the-scenes content

What We’re Looking For

Strong English writing skills

Experience editing short-form videos (Reels/TikTok style)

Experience using Canva, CapCut, or similar tools

Organized and detail-oriented

Able to work independently with minimal supervision

Reliable internet connection

Comfortable following structured guidelines

What This Is NOT

This is not a “creative director” role.

This is not a marketing strategy position.

This is not a full-time job.

This is not a role where you invent random content ideas weekly.

We provide structure, direction, and content.

Your job is to execute consistently and professionally.

Growth & Bonus Opportunities

Performance bonuses may be offered for:

Events directly booked through Instagram

 subscribers generated

Qualified hires from Instagram posts

Strong follower growth

To Apply

Please submit:

Your resume

2–3 Instagram accounts you have managed

2 short videos you have edited

A short paragraph explaining why you are a good fit for this role

title: Attorney
description:
Remote Medical Malpractice/Civil Litigation Attorney (Offshore)



Job Type: Full-Time



Work Hours: Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM Pacific Time, with a 1-hour break



Salary: $1,600 per month



 



Job Overview: 



We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Offshore Medical Malpractice / Civil Litigation Attorney to support complex medical malpractice and civil litigation matters. This remote position is structured as a legal research and drafting role, working closely with U.S.-licensed attorneys to assist in case preparation, strategy development, and document drafting. The primary focus of this role is high-level legal writing, medical-legal analysis, and preparation of pleadings, motions, discovery documents, and memoranda in a fast-paced litigation environment.



 



Key Responsibilities



Draft pleadings, motions, discovery requests, responses, and legal memoranda for attorney review

Conduct detailed legal research and medical-legal analysis using LexisNexis, Westlaw, and related platforms

Review medical records and summarize key findings for litigation strategy

Prepare case summaries, chronologies, and litigation support documents

Assist in analyzing liability, damages, and procedural issues in civil litigation matters

Support trial preparation through document organization and research

Maintain organized case files and ensure deadlines are met

Collaborate effectively within a remote litigation team

Writing and analytical drafting are the primary deliverables of this role.







Required Skills & Qualifications:



Juris Doctor (JD) from an accredited law school with active bar membership in relevant jurisdictions.

3+ years of proven experience in medical malpractice or civil litigation.

Strong proficiency in legal research platforms (LexisNexis, Westlaw)

Exceptional legal writing and drafting skills (writing samples required)

Strong command of written English in U.S. legal format

Ability to analyze complex medical records and translate findings into clear legal arguments

Research-driven, detail-oriented, and highly analytical

Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple litigation deadlines

Comfortable in a drafting-heavy, writing-intensive role

Prior experience working remotely with U.S.-based legal teams is highly desirable

Strong communication skills when collaborating with supervising attorneys



Note: An NBI or police clearance will be required upon acceptance of the job offer.

title: Customer Support Specialist (VA)
description:
About AI Acquisition



An AI platform emerged as the global category leader in AI service provider enablement. Operating globally, with the US as its primary market, the unique hybrid of Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) and AI marketplace has achieved explosive growth by solving a critical pain point: connecting AI agencies with qualified enterprise opportunities at scale. AI Acquisition combines proprietary AI orchestration tools with proven enterprise SaaS infrastructure, delivers immediate value to the platform’s multiple agency customers and small and medium businesses worldwide.



We’re revolutionizing the way entrepreneurs build life-changing businesses by brokering AI tools to business owners eager to succeed. At the forefront of the $1.3 trillion AI revolution, we empower our members to earn $500+ per hour with just a few clicks. Whether through our AI Agency Incubator (Self-Guided), AI Accelerator (Done With You), or AI Agency Launchpad (Done For You), we provide the systems, training, and support to help our members achieve rapid success.



Why Join AI Acquisition?



Be part of a cutting-edge company leading the AI revolution, with a proven system that delivers results.

Work in a dynamic, remote environment with a team dedicated to transforming lives.

Opportunity to grow with a company experiencing rapid growth as we scale to support more members.

Make a direct impact on our members’ success, helping them achieve life-changing wins like $60K in 17 days.

Surround yourself with exceptionally talented, driven people who are in pursuit of excellence.

This isn’t just a job—it’s an opportunity to create a new and better life while working with visionary leaders who are shaping the future of AI-driven business growth.



The Role



We are seeking Customer Support Specialists (Virtual Assistants) to join our Heartbeat team and play a key role in supporting our community as part of our AI Incubator Team.



In this role, you’ll help keep our community engaged, respond to member inquiries, and manage communications across Slack and inbox channels. You’ll be on the front lines ensuring our users feel supported, informed, and excited — especially during beta testing periods.



This is a full-time, remote position (40 hours/week) with multiple shift options (see below). If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, love helping people, and enjoy building strong connections with a community, this role is perfect for you.



What You’ll Do



Support & Engage the Community



Respond promptly to community inquiries through the inbox with empathy and professionalism.

Monitor and guide conversations in Slack, supporting beta testers and sharing updates.

Keep the energy elevated by sparking community engagement and celebrating wins.

Solve Problems & Share Insights



Gather clear, helpful details fro
mbers to pass to the right internal teams.

Escalate issues when needed and follow up to ensure smooth resolution.

Spot trends and common questions to help us improve and make members’ lives easier.

Work as One Team



Work closely with your direct manager and head of department to stay aligned on goals.

Show up consistently for your assigned shift to give our community reliable support.



Requirements



What We’re Looking For



Excellent written communication skills and a warm, approachable tone.

Empathy and professionalism when helping members.

Proactive and resourceful — you enjoy solving problems and finding solutions fast.

Comfortable with Slack, inbox tools, and community platforms.

Previous customer support or community management experience is a plus



Shift Schedule: EST - PST (Can start ASAP)



Benefits



Training & Support





You’ll be set up for success with:



Group onboarding sessions for a fast, fun start.

Guidance on best practices for community engagement and support.

Full access to tools, templates, and FAQs so you always feel confident in your work.



What’s In It for You



Competitive Pay: $7–$8/hour (Full-Time – 40 hours/week)

Remote Flexibility: Work from anywhere — just bring your energy and a reliable internet connection.

Multiple Shift Options: Choose the schedule that works best for your life.

Be Part of Something Big: Join our AI Incubator Team and contribute to a fast-growing, innovative community.

Skill Growth: Build experience in customer support, community engagement, and communication — skills that can lead to future leadership opportunities.

Positive, Supportive Culture: Work with a team that celebrates wins, values your input, and helps you grow.



Ready to Join Us?



This isn’t just another support job — it’s your chance to be the heart of our community, create positive experiences every day, and grow with a team that’s building something amazing.



???? Apply now by submitting your CV and letting us know which shift you’d love to work. We can’t wait to welcome you to the AI Incubator team!

title: Social Media Content & Marketing Specialist for ecommerce B2C business in USA
description:
We’re a family-owned clothing brand based in the USA (our target audience = moms), looking for a Social Media Content Marketing Specialist to join our team! This is a part-time role (20 hours/week) with potential to transition to full-time based on performance. We’re looking for someone who’s excited to be an A-Player on our team -who shares our enthusiasm and drive to make great things happen together.



Compensation & Benefits:



- $480/month ($6/hr) | ~80 hrs/month (~20 hrs/week) with potential to transition to full-time based on performance.

- Annual bonus (one extra month’s salary after 1 full year of full-time work)

- Performance-based bonuses for successful campaigns

- Flexible hours & remote work

- Training & development opportunities





What We’re Looking For:



- 2+ years experience in social media marketing & content creation

- Time Management & Deadline Focused –- We thrive on organization and meeting deadlines

- Skilled in Reels creation, video editing, and Canva (or similar tools)

- Expert in Instagram &
 growth strategies

- Strong understanding of marketing principles, audience engagement, and analytics

- Ability to work independently, manage time efficiently, and meet performance KPIs

- Strong communication skills for brand partnerships and collaborations

- Availability to monitor social channels, including some evenings/weekends



What You’ll Do:



1. Social Media Brand Management & Content Creation:

We’re looking for someone with ideas and execution skills to ensure our social media presence is engaging and aligned with our brand goals. This role is heavily focused on creating high-performing content that increases engagement and sales.



- Create organic and paid Instagram content, stories, and Reels to drive engagement, following brand aesthetics and messaging.

- Develop and execute a content plan that aligns with monthly brand goals & KPIs while fostering a strong, engaged community. Storytelling skills are a plus!

- Design graphics and write compelling captions to encourage interaction and conversion

2. Social Media Growth & Analytics

mber

If you’re a creative, data-driven social media content marketer passionate about growing an engaged community, we’d love to hear from you!



How to respond:

2. In the subject line of your application, include the word “Dress” at the end. Why? This lets us see who is actually paying attention :).

3. Use 8 points to apply. Applications with fewer than 8 points will not be considered.

title: B2B Cold Calling Appointment Setter  $4–$5/hr Base + Performance Bonuses
description:
ROLE OVERVIEW

We are hiring a B2B Cold Calling Appointment Setter to book qualified appointments with business owners for our AI automation and digital marketing services. This is a performance-based, full-time role for experienced callers who can prospect leads, cold call, qualify decision-makers, and consistently book appointments.



IMPORTANT – PLEASE READ

• This role is not for candidates looking only for a fixed hourly job

• This role is for performance-driven individuals who want to earn more through bonuses and commissions

• Top performers can earn $10–$15+ per hour combining base pay and bonuses



WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

• Cold calling B2B business owners

• Qualifying prospects based on need, fit, and decision-maker status

• Booking qualified appointments directly into our calendar

• Following scripts while sounding confident and professional

• Logging call results and notes in our CRM



DAILY PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

• 150–200 cold calls per day

• 3–4 qualified appointments booked per day



A qualified appointment means a real business owner, real need, and genuine interest.



REQUIREMENTS

• Proven experience in cold calling or appointment setting

• Experience working with B2B SAAS

• Comfortable speaking with business owners

• Understanding of the following concepts:

  • AI automation

  • AI or smart websites

  • SEO and online presence

  • CRM systems (GoHighLevel experience is a plus)

• Well-spoken in English with clear pronunciation and professional tone

• Confident handling objections and business-level conversations

• Goal-driven, disciplined, and performance-focused



PAY AND EARNING POTENTIAL

• $4–$5 per hour base pay (based on experience and performance)

• Performance bonuses per qualified appointment

• Commission opportunities per closed deal

• High performers earn $10–$15+ per hour



GROWTH AND ADVANCEMENT

High-performing setters may advance into the following roles:

• Senior Appointment Setter

• Team Lead or Appointment Manager

• Training or Quality Control roles



Growth is based on performance, consistency, and leadership.



SCHEDULE

• Full-time only

• Monday through Friday

• U.S. business hours preferred



HOW TO APPLY

Please include the following in your application:

• Your cold calling or appointment-setting experience

• Industries you have worked in

• Tools you have used (dialers, CRM, GoHighLevel if applicable)

• Your average daily call volume in previous roles

• A voice sample (strongly preferred)



FINAL NOTE

This is a results-driven role with clear expectations, strong earning potential, and real career growth. If you can hit the numbers and communicate professionally, you will be rewarded.

title: Sales & Admin VA - Residential Cleaning & Commercial Cold Calling
description:
I am looking for a "Hunter" to help scale my residential and commercial cleaning business. You will not just be an assistant; you will be the engine of our growth.

The Role:

Commercial Cold Calling (Primary): You will be given a list of local offices, medical facilities, and property managers. Your goal is to get past the gatekeeper and book walkthrough appointments for me.

Social Media Management: Create "Before & After" content using Canva and manage our daily posting schedule on
/Instagram.

Software Operations: Manage our bookings, client communications, and scheduling inside our existing cleaning software.

title: Visual/Motion Graphics Editor ($1,100 - $1,600+ DOE)
description:
I have a pickleball coaching company called The Pickleball Lab: pickleballlab.co - and I am looking for a new editor, visual graphics editor and junior level graphic designer. My old editor had to resign due to personal reasons.



Our main revenue focus is on our coaching platform - 
 (look at it in desktop, mobile is a work in progress). It's a place where people who want to get better at pickleball can come and take our online courses, get direct coaching fro
, and participate in a community of other pickleball players all trying to get better.



This is where you pick up.



My editor has 4 main roles:



1) Edit instructional videos for the The Pickleball Lab platform

2) Edit videos for YouTube/Social (and create any graphic design elements needing to be animated) - things like instructional videos, our podcast, etc.

3) Odd and end editing work like - put together b roll segments so when we need b roll we can go through and pick out what we need, edit social video ads I create and shoot for you, put together b roll of pro film to help me get better as a pickleball player, etc. (basically all the skills needed for 1 and 2 above, just different use cases)

4) Odd and end graphic design like editing photos, creating basic thumbnails, creating different logo color schemes of our already existing logo, AI photo generation, etc. Basically any junior level graphic design work, any senior level graphic design work like logo creation, t shirt design creation, etc. I hire out to a senior level graphic designer. This work is relatively uncommon compared to the editing work but it does happen so you need to be prepared to be a team player on this.



And while the main revenue focus is the platform, editing videos is pretty easy. There's hardly any visual graphic work necessary. It's literally just simple video editing ie cutting the video together, and adding the intro.



YouTube is where you're really going to flex your editing skills, because our YT channel is where the main visual graphic work comes in. If you can't do visual graphic work in AE, this is not the job for you, as mentioned. Your base proficiency in editing should be the ability create this entire video on your own:







Our YT videos are heavy visual graphic editing as you can tell. If you can't do all of this visual graphic work, do not apply.



If you can, continue to read below:



I've been doing this for 2 years now and we've had to make some pivots long the way. Our first goal was to just get our youtube channel up and running. Then we deviated from that for me to start doing local coaching. That went well and we grew into the online platform. This online platform took a lot of time to get up and running. We have (if I remember correctly) over 40 videos in there now. The platform has essentially no paying members yet, which is to be expected. We've just started more or less. But we do have around 20 members, most are not active. We're a work in progress.



So, your job will be a mix of helping edit the content I shoot for the platform and then helping me build the brand via YT and social video marketing, with that heavy emphasis on visual graphic work.



If you play pickleball or even tennis or ping pong, that is an added bonus. It will make the edits that much better. You'll understand more and know what to do to make the video a high quality video. But if you don't, that's certainly not required. A good visual graphics editor is a good visual graphics editor.

 

Full time starting at $1,100 - $1,600 USD a month and can go up based on experience.

 

Again, I have to stress this, if you do not have extensive experience in adobe after effects or a similar motion graphic creator, please do not apply. I keep getting applications from people who can't do this high level of editing. I am looking for good visuals that will need to be done in AE or similar. Also, you will need great graphic design to create a lot of these assets. So, if you can't do this as well, please do not apply.

 

When you apply send me:



1. Monthly fee you require for full time



2. How many hours does "full time" mean to you? 40, 60, etc.?



3. At full time, how many YouTube videos (with heavy graphic work like the example I gave you) can you edit a month? (each video will be 5 - 12 minutes on average as well as a thumbnail created)



4. Are you open to doing a 1 minute test project so I can see your skills? You may watermark the video.

 

5. Do you play pickleball, tennis, ping pong or any other sports?

 

6. Look at our video again: 
 - can you do this type of visual graphic work?

 

7. Do you have extensive experience in Adobe After Effects or motion graphics software? If so, detail your experience here. If not, please do not apply.

 

8. Send me 1-2 videos with your best motion graphic work in AE or similar.

 

9. Why do you think you'd be a good fit for this project?

 

10. Any other information you think would be helpful

 

Looking forward to speaking with you!

title: Short-Term Rental Operations Specialist
description:
About Us

ERTE Properties is a growing short-term rental management company based in the UK, managing a portfolio of contractor accommodation and group-stay properties across Reading and the Thames Valley. We operate at a high standard and move fast — we need someone who can keep up.

The Role

We're looking for a highly experienced Short-Term Rental VA who has been around the block on all major OTAs and knows how to run operations without hand-holding. This is not an entry-level role. You will own the day-to-day and be expected to hit the ground running from week one.

What You'll Be Doing



Managing guest communications across all OTA platforms (Airbnb, 
, Expedia, and direct) with a focus on fast response times and high review scores

Handling all operations inside Guesty — reservations, calendar management, rate updates, inbox management, and reporting

Managing guest messaging and automated workflows via Enso Connect

Coordinating cleaners and maintenance teams, flagging issues proactively

Monitoring and adjusting pricing using Intellihost to stay competitive

Managing tasks, SOPs, and team workflows inside ClickUp

Making and receiving calls when necessary via Circle Loop

Creating graphics, property assets, and social content in Canva and Photoshop

Supporting marketing and CRM workflows inside GoHighLevel

Generating performance reports and flagging anomalies to management

Processing Airbnb reimbursement claims and basic financial tracking



What You Must Have

Working knowledge of Enso Connect for guest messaging automation

Experience using Intellihost or similar dynamic pricing tools

Comfortable managing tasks and documentation in ClickUp

Proficient in GoHighLevel for CRM and automation workflows

Confident making client or vendor calls via Circle Loop when needed

Strong design skills in Canva and Photoshop

Fluent written English with professional guest communication skills

Highly organised, proactive, and able to manage priorities independently



Nice to Have



Experience with direct booking website management

 marketing to past guests to drive repeat direct bookings

Landing page creation and basic copywriting

Social media scheduling and content creation



What We're NOT Looking For



Someone who needs to be trained on the basics of STR operations

Someone who lists tools on their CV but hasn't used them in a live environment

Someone who needs constant supervision to complete tasks

title: US Senior Accountant (Double/Keeper)
description:
Job Title: Junior Accountant

Location: 100% Work from Home

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule: Night Shift



If interested apply through this link: 
-(double-expert)



About Us:

Our mission is to deliver specialized bookkeeping for real estate investors, property managers, and senior living businesses. Using proven systems and a diagnostic-first approach, we bring clarity, accuracy, and confidence to messy books so our clients can focus on growth and strategic decisions.



We live by our values:

Excellence

We prioritize accuracy, proactive communication, and thorough preparation in everything we do.

Discipline

We operate with consistency, accountability, and respect for boundaries (no weekend work unless approved).

Alignment

We follow clear SOPs and shared goals to ensure consistency across clients and our team.

Ambition

We support our clients’ growth while building freedom and profitability within our own team.

Impact

We help businesses thrive by giving them clarity and confidence in their numbers.



What we do:

We go beyond balancing numbers. We empower our clients with reliable, actionable financial insight so they can confidently expand their portfolios, open new facilities, and scale operations in a sustainable and strategic way. Our goal is to turn financial data into clarity, giving business owners the visibility they need to make smart, forward-thinking decisions.



Job Summary:

Accounting professional specializing in full-cycle accounting for real estate portfolios, including property acquisitions and multi-entity operations. Experienced in accrual-basis accounting, financial reporting, reconciliations, intercompany transactions, and tax tracking. Skilled in managing day-to-day bookkeeping, accounts payable/receivable, payroll support, and sales tax compliance. Proficient in QuickBooks Online and related systems, with a strong focus on accurate reporting, organized chart of accounts management, client onboarding, and cross-functional collaboration to ensure timely and compliant financial operations.



What You’ll Do:



Manage full-cycle accounting for multiple real estate properties, including newly purchased assets.

Review and reconcile closing statements related to property acquisitions and transactions.

Maintain and oversee accrual-basis accounting, including monthly and year-end accruals.

Accrue and track tax payments and other property-related obligations.

Handle intercompany transactions and transfers across entities and properties.

Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports, reconciliations, and variance analysis.

Collaborate closely with property managers to gather financial data and ensure timely reporting.

Manage day-to-day bookkeeping for real estate investors, property managers, and senior living facilities.

Reconcile bank and credit card accounts regularly and accurately.

Handle accounts payable/receivable, payroll support, and sales tax filings as assigned.

Build and maintain a clean and organized chart of accounts.

Produce accurate monthly financial reports and ensure on-time delivery.

Support client onboarding, including connecting and setting up accounts in QuickBooks Online (QBO), Keeper, and related systems.



Collaborate with the account manager and team through Slack, Asana, and Notion.

Ensure compliance with deadlines and bookkeeping best practices.

Participate in financial cleanups and diagnostics when needed.



What We’re Looking For:

Has over 5 years of accounting work history.

At least 3 years of U.S.-based professional bookkeeping experience.

Experience working with real estate, property management, or service-based businesses (preferred).

Proficiency in QuickBooks Online and Google Workspace.

Background in using Double (formerly Keeper) is required.

Experience with Asana, and Slack is nice to have.

Strong knowledge of GAAP and best bookkeeping practices.

Preferred: QBO ProAdvisor certification.

Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.

Strong communication and client-facing ability.

Traits we value: proactive, solutions-oriented, team player, systems thinker.



Teck Stack:

QuickBooks Online (QBO) – Primary accounting and reporting platform

Asana – Task and workflow management

Slack – Internal and client communication

Notion – SOPs, documentation, and knowledge base

Double (formerly Keeper) – Month-end close and transaction review, receipt management and report package and client communication tool.

Google Drive – File storage and collaboration

Gusto – Payroll and payroll-related reporting

Hostaway & Hospitable – Short-term rental/property management platforms

Stripe – Payment processing and reconciliation

Airbnb, VRBO, 
 – OTA integrations and revenue tracking

AppFolio, Escapia, RentVine – Property management systems



Why You’ll Love Working Here:

Supportive Team: Join a team that values collaboration and celebrates achievements.

Career Growth: Opportunities for professional development and advancement.

Loyalty: Tea
mbers who worked with the founder in a prior company have followed.  Two have over 10 years with the founder.  Generous opportunities for personal and professional development without the corporate garbage that steals your soul. 

Health & Wellness Benefits: We care about your well-being and provide resources to keep you at your best.

Flexible Work Environment: Enjoy a balanced work-life with options for remote work.



Perks:

80-120 Hours of PTO

7- Paid Holidays

13th Month Payroll

Paid Philippine HMO plan

Paid Social Security System

Paid Philippine Health

title: Senior AWS DevOps Engineer – AWS Cost Optimization & Kubernetes
description:
Job Description:

About the Role

We're a blockchain/DeFi company running production infrastructure that's bleeding money unnecessarily. Our AWS bill is sitting at $4,500/month – and we know it shouldn't be anywhere near that. We need someone who can come in, audit the whole setup, and actually fix it. Not just give us a report that sits in a folder.



We've already been through a few candidates who talked a big game but couldn't execute. We're done with that. If you're the type who needs handholding or can't work independently, this isn't for you.





What You'll Actually Do

- Audit our entire AWS infrastructure and identify exactly where we're wasting money (we expect significant savings)

- Optimize our Kubernetes clusters – right-size nodes, fix resource requests/limits, implement autoscaling that actually works

- Implement cost controls: Reserved Instances, Savings Plans, spot instances where appropriate, and cleanup of orphaned resources

- Set up monitoring and alerts so costs don't creep back up without us knowing

- Document everything you do so the team can maintain it





Hard Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

- 3+ years hands-on Kubernetes experience in production environments – EKS specifically preferred

- Deep AWS knowledge: EC2, EKS, RDS, S3, CloudWatch, Cost Explorer, Trusted Advisor

- Proven track record of actually reducing AWS costs (be ready to share numbers/percentages)

- Strong scripting skills (Python, Bash) for automation

- Infrastructure as Code: Terraform or CloudFormation (Terraform preferred)

- Self-starter who can take ownership and execute without constant oversight





!!!!CRITICAL: This Role Requires Surgical Precision

This is production infrastructure running live systems. Think of this like surgery – one wrong move can take everything down.

- NO cowboy moves. You don't delete, modify, or remove anything without a clear plan first.

- Every change must be planned out, documented, and confirmed with the CEO before execution.

- Extreme attention to detail. You double-check and triple-check before touching anything.

- If you're not 100% sure what something does, you ask first. You don't assume.

- Methodical execution only. We value careful and correct over fast and reckless.





Strong Plus

- Experience with blockchain/Web3 infrastructure

- Karpenter, Cluster Autoscaler, or KEDA experience

-  AWS certifications (Solutions Architect, DevOps Engineer)

- Experience with FinOps tools (Kubecost, CloudHealth, 
)





What We Need In Your Application

Don't send a generic application. We will ignore it. Include:

- Specific examples of AWS cost optimization you've done – what was the setup, what did you change, what % did you save?

- Your Kubernetes experience – cluster sizes you've managed, scaling strategies you've implemented

- Your availability and timezone (we need someone who can overlap with US business hours for some calls)





Compensation & Structure

- $20-25/hour based on experience and proven results

- 20 hours/week to start – potential for more hours for the right person

- Fully remote

- Initial project: Comprehensive audit + implementation plan with clear cost reduction targets





If you're someone who can actually deliver results and not just talk about them – we want to hear from you. Show us what you've done.

title: Creative Website Designer (Squarespace + GoHighLevel)
description:
I am looking for an experience (3+ Years) visually-driven Designer to join my team and work across both custom Squarespace builds and our dedicated marketing platform, Alvéya (built on GoHighLevel).



My agency works exclusively with natural and allied health practitioners. Our mission is to take the "clinical" out of health and replace it with a brand experience that feels grounded, earthy, and trustworthy.



Why This Role is Different

I have found that many designers can learn the technical "how-to" of a platform, but they lack a true creative design eye. I am looking for someone who:



Masters the Muted Aesthetic: Our industry rarely uses bright, neon, or high-contrast "tech" colors. You must demonstrate a talent for working with neutrals, earthy tones (sage, terracotta, sand), and sophisticated palettes.



Curates with Intention: You can tell the difference between a "cheesy" wellness stock photo and an image that feels soulful, organic, and premium.



Prioritizes Whitespace: You understand that for a health practitioner, a website needs to "breathe" to create a sense of calm for the patient.



What You’ll Be Doing

Squarespace Design: Building bespoke, high-conversion sites using Fluid Engine.



Alvéya (GHL) Layouts: Bringing that same high-end Squarespace "feel" into the GHL ecosystem (funnels, sites, and snapshots).



Visual Problem Solving: Ensuring that even "technical" pages like booking checkouts or patient forms look beautiful and brand-aligned.



A Note on Applications (Read Carefully)

I value human creativity and genuine connection. AI-generated applications that simply "parrot" back the requirements of this ad will be immediately disregarded. I want to hear your actual voice and see your unique perspective on design.



How to Apply

Please send through your portfolio. I am specifically looking for:



Examples of work that demonstrate a soft, organic, or minimal aesthetic.



A brief note telling me about a brand (in any industry) whose visual aesthetic you absolutely love and why it works.

title: SEO Link Building Manager (Client Campaigns & Strategy)
description:
SEO Link Building Manager (Client Campaigns & Strategy)



We are seeking a highly organized, strategic Link Building Manager to oversee our monthly client link-building campaigns. In this role, you will do more than just build links—you will be tasked with innovating our processes, leveraging AI, reducing costs, and improving departmental margins without sacrificing quality.



If you are a results-driven SEO professional who excels at vendor negotiation, strategy, and quality assurance, we want you to lead our link-building department.



What You Will Do:



Client Roster Management: Oversee the monthly link-building quotas and deliverables for our entire client roster.



Strategic Planning: Develop and execute precise anchor text and keyword mapping strategies for optimal SEO impact.



Quality Assurance & Uptime: Regularly scan and monitor previously built links to ensure they remain active, stepping in immediately if links go down.



Vendor Management: Negotiate and secure premium placements through our existing network of link builders.



Cost & Margin Optimization: Continuously research and implement innovative strategies to find new link opportunities, save costs, and improve profit margins.



AI Innovation: Leverage the latest AI tools and workflows to streamline outreach, scale operations, and innovate within the department.



What You Bring to the Table:



Proven experience managing high-volume link-building campaigns, preferably in an agency setting.



Strong understanding of SEO metrics, anchor text ratios, and backlink profiles.



Familiarity with industry-standard SEO tools (e.g., Ahrefs, Semrush, Pitchbox, or similar).



Excellent negotiation skills and an analytical mindset focused on efficiency and cost-saving.



A forward-thinking approach to using AI in digital marketing.



Benefits:



Competitive Salary $1000 with opportunity to move to $1250-$1500 with savings on links

Basic Client Support: Assist clients with standard inquiries such as taking payments, providing basic policy information, or taking detailed messages for the agents.



Data Entry & Tracking: Log all calls and service requests accurately into our CRM (AgencyZoom) so the team knows exactly what the client needs.

Bilingual Fluency: Must read, write, and speak fluent English and Spanish.

Tech-Savvy: Comfortable using softphones (VoIP) and agency management systems/CRMs (experience with AgencyZoom or QQ Catalyst is a massive plus).



Environment: A quiet, professional home office setup with high-speed internet and a noise-canceling headset.

Introduce yourself, explain your past insurance experience, and tell us why you are a great fit for this role. You must speak in BOTH English and Spanish during this recording.

- Editing raw footage into UGC ads, ensuring seamless transitions, proper pacing, and compelling storytelling

- Designing high-converting static creatives for paid social or internal, including but not limited to product-focused, promotional, and AI-generated graphics

- Collaborating with the creative team to conceptualize and design visually stunning videos that convert into sales

- Managing and organizing video and graphic assets, ensuring a smooth workflow and efficient file management

- Selecting appropriate B-Rolls that fit the script and voiceovers

- Selecting and incorporating appropriate music, sound effects, and voiceovers to enhance the overall video production

- Managing multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery without compromising quality



Performance Creative Strategy



- Staying up-to-date with design trends, techniques, and tools to bring fresh ideas to the table consistently

- Help verify/review content submitted by creators/talents, ensuring quality and accuracy

- Translating complex ideas into simple, compelling visuals that resonate with our target audience

- Developing unique and engaging visual content for marketing campaigns, social media, websites, presentations, landing pages, and more

- Support organization of content, deliverables, and project files

Help generate new creative concepts for videos and statics



Requirements:



- Proven work experience as a Video Editor and Graphics Designer or a similar role.

- Proficiency in video editing software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro) and graphic design tools (e.g., Adobe - Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects).

- Strong understanding of video editing principles, including pacing, storytelling, and visual aesthetics.

- Excellent attention to detail and ability to work under tight deadlines.

- Strong communication and collaboration skills to effectively work with cross-functional teams.

- A portfolio demonstrating your video editing and graphic design skills is required.

- Willingness to work from 9:00 am - 6:00 pm Pacific Time



Preferred Qualifications:



- Experience in creating videos and graphics for paid social ads/marketing campaigns.

- Familiarity with social media platforms and their video requirements.

- Ability to work independently and take creative initiative.

- Direct response experience



What’s In It For You:



- Opportunities for salary increase with individual, team, and business performance

- Learn how to make ads that drive sales and become direct response marketers.

- Opportunity to work with a dynamic team in a fast-paced environment.

- Opportunity to learn from a former elite marketing agency director (Mutesix)

- Exposure to work with a variety of verticals across various industries.

- Professional development opportunities to expand skill sets and get trained on how to make videos that go viral.

title: Admin Assistant with JobTread Experience
description:
Virtual Admin Assistant

Type: Part-Time (Remote) 



Position Overview 



Position Title: Virtual Office Assistant 

Location: Remote (International - Different Time Zone PST) 

Employment Type: Part-time Virtual Assistant to start

Reporting To: Managing Director/ Site Manager





 Core Responsibilities 

1. PROJECT ADMINISTRATION & DOCUMENTATION 

- Owner Estimate Packet Creation 

   - Compile and organize comprehensive estimate packets for property owners 

   - Ensure all required documentation, permits, and specifications are included 

   - Format and brand all materials according to company standards 

   - Coordinate with estimating team to ensure accuracy and completeness 



- Contract Management & Welcome Packets 

   - Create and distribute welcome packets immediately upon contract signing 

   - Include all necessary project information, timelines, and contact details 

   - Set up client onboarding process and initial communication schedule 

   - Maintain contract database and ensure all signed documents are properly filed 



- Integrated Checklist Management 

   - Develop and maintain project checklists that integrate with takeoff software 

   - Create phase-specific checklists for different trades and project stages 

   - Monitor checklist completion and flag any delays or issues 

   - Generate progress reports based on checklist status 



 2. FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT & REPORTING 

- Insurance Tracking & Monthly Reports 

   - Maintain comprehensive insurance database for all projects and vendors 

   - Generate monthly insurance compliance reports 

   - Track policy expiration dates and coordinate renewals 

   - Ensure all subcontractors and vendors have current insurance certificates 

   - Flag any insurance gaps or compliance issues immediately 



- Accounts Management 

   - Process creditor invoices and obtain payment authorizations 

   - Run creditor direct credit schedules and ensure timely payments 

   - Follow up on outstanding debtor invoices and payment collection 

   - Maintain accurate financial records and filing systems 

   - Assist with budget reporting and cost center analysis 



3. ESTIMATING & TAKEOFF SUPPORT 

- Estimating Assistance 

   - Support estimating process by organizing and preparing takeoff materials 

   - Input standardized pricing and labor costs into estimating templates 

   - Create cost breakdowns that executives can review and finalize 

   - Maintain pricing databases and vendor cost information 

   - Generate preliminary estimates for executive review and adjustment 



- Takeoff Coordination 

   - Organize project plans and specifications for takeoff process 

   - Coordinate with takeoff software systems and input basic measurements 

   - Prepare takeoff summaries and material lists 

   - Track takeoff progress and ensure timely completion 



4. CLIENT COMMUNICATION & RELATIONSHIP MANAGEMENT 

- Weekly Client Updates 

   - Prepare and send weekly progress reports to all active clients 

   - Coordinate project photos and visual updates 

   - Manage client inquiries and route to appropriate tea
mbers 

   - Maintain client database with updated contact information and preferences 



- Customer Service 

   - Handle incoming calls and
s during overlapping business hours 

   - Take detailed messages and ensure timely follow-up 

   - Manage appointment scheduling and calendar coordination 

   - Process change orders and client requests 



5. PROJECT COORDINATION & QUALITY CONTROL 

- Quality Control Documentation 

   - Maintain and update quality control forms for each trade 

   - Create inspection checklists and documentation templates 

   - Track quality issues and coordinate resolution 

   - Generate quality reports and trend analysis 



- Vendor & Shipping Coordination 

   - Obtain shipping quotes and coordinate delivery schedules 

   - Confirm orders and delivery addresses 

   - Track shipments and manage delivery logistics 

   - Maintain vendor performance records 



Time Zone Considerations & Communication Protocols 

Working Hours Coordination 

- Overlap Hours: Establish 2-3 hours of overlapping business hours for urgent communications 

- Daily Check-ins: Morning briefing (your evening) and end-of-day summary (your morning) 

- Emergency Contact: Provide emergency contact protocol for urgent project issues 



Communication Tools & Systems 

- Primary Communication: Video conferencing for daily check-ins 

- Project Management: Shared project management software with real-time updates 

- File Sharing: Cloud-based systems for document access and collaboration 

- Instant Messaging: For quick questions and status updates during overlap hours 



Required Skills & Qualifications 

Technical Skills 

- Proficiency in Job Tread construction/project management software 

 (Essential- minimum 1 yr experience)

- Advanced Microsoft Office Suite and Google Workspace 

- Experience with CRM systems and database management 

- Basic understanding of construction processes and terminology 

- Google Sheets / Excel (Essential- 2 yrs experience) 

- Drive/Dropbox File Management 

- Clear written and verbal English 

- Strong attention to detail and accuracy 



Professional Skills 

- Excellent written and verbal English communication 

- Strong organizational and time management abilities 

- Attention to detail and quality control mindset 

- Customer service excellence 

- Financial record keeping and basic accounting principles 



Personal Attributes 

- Self-motivated and able to work independently 

- Reliable internet connection and professional home office setup 

- Flexible with time zones and urgent project needs 

- Professional demeanor for client interactions 

- Trustworthy with confidential company and client information 



Performance Metrics & Expectations 

Quality Standards 

- 99?curacy in documentation and reporting 

- 24-hour response time to non-urgent communications 

- 2-hour response time during overlapping business hours 

- Monthly insurance compliance reports with zero gaps 

- Weekly client communication completion rate of 100% 



Growth Objectives 

- Develop expertise in company-specific software and processes within 90 days 

- Establish efficient workflows that reduce executive administrative burden 

- Build strong vendor and client relationships that support business growth 

- Continuously improve processes and identify efficiency opportunities 



READY TO APPLY?

Don't just send a resume—tell us why you’re the organized "Super-star" we’re looking for!



Message your application with the subject line “Meet [First and Last Name], Your New Admin Assistant”. Include why you’re the best candidate, years using JobTread, years in construction office, and the code word “Super-Star” in the body of the message. Attach a video with you telling us all this. Can’t wait to virtually e-meet you!

title: Web Development Manager (Hands-On / Player-Coach)
description:
We are seeking an experienced, hands-on Web Development Manager to oversee the planning, execution, and ongoing management of our client website builds. This role is a "player-coach" position—ideal for a leader who excels at managing multiple projects and developers, while remaining highly capable of jumping into the code to develop features and perform rigorous Quality Control (QC).



You will work closely with developers, designers, project managers, and stakeholders to ensure high-quality website builds, strict adherence to coding standards, and smooth collaboration across teams.



Key Responsibilities:



Hands-on Development: Actively participate in coding, taking on complex custom builds, feature integrations, and urgent bug fixes.



Rigorous Quality Control (QC): Act as the final gatekeeper for quality. Perform deep reviews of code, site functionality, mobile responsiveness, and overall build quality before any site goes live.



Project Oversight: Manage and oversee website development projects from kickoff through launch, ensuring tasks are completed accurately, on budget, and on schedule.



Team Leadership: Enforce development standards, best practices, and workflows. Provide technical guidance, mentorship, and troubleshooting support to the development team.



Cross-Team Coordination: Collaborate with designers, SEO specialists, and project managers to align project goals and deliverables.



Resource Management: Monitor project timelines, priorities, and workloads, conducting regular check-ins and progress updates with your developers.



Performance & Maintenance: Ensure all websites are optimized for PageSpeed, security, and scalability. Assist with ongoing site maintenance and post-launch improvements.



Required Qualifications:



3–5+ years of professional, hands-on web development experience.



1–2+ years of experience leading, managing, or mentoring developers.



Active, expert-level knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern frameworks.



Deep experience with CMS platforms (WordPress preferred) and custom theme/plugin development.



A strict eye for detail with a proven track record of QA/QC, responsive design, and cross-browser troubleshooting.



Proficiency with Git/version control workflows.



Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to balance management duties with individual development tasks.



Excellent communication and leadership abilities.



Preferred Qualifications:



Experience working in a fast-paced digital marketing or web agency.



Strong knowledge of SEO best practices, Core Web Vitals, and site performance optimization.



Familiarity with hosting environments, DNS management, and deployment processes.



Experience managing multiple client projects simultaneously.

title: Go High Level CRM & Automation Specialist
description:
Overview:

We’re seeking a highly technical, systems-driven, and detail-oriented Go High Level Expert to join our growing team. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in building backend infrastructure that powers marketing performance.

This role reports directly to the Director of Growth and will play a critical role in building and optimizing the backend infrastructure that powers both internal operations and client performance.

At Lumore, we believe growth is driven by the intersection of brand, performance, and systems. Strategy is only as strong as the infrastructure behind it — and that’s where you come in.

You will be responsible for architecting, building, and managing automations within Go High Level for both our internal operations and our clients. From lead capture and nurturing sequences to pipeline automations and reporting workflows, you will ensure every touchpoint is intentional, optimized, and measurable.

If you love clean systems, smart automation, performance data, and building scalable CRM environments that actually convert — we’d love to meet you.



Reporting Structure

Reports directly to: Director of Growth

Works cross-functionally with media buying, creative, and strategy teams

Collaborates on performance reviews and system optimization initiatives



Work Schedule & Collaboration Expectations

Our team operates flexibly across time zones, with collaboration spanning the U.S. and internationally. While general work hours are flexible, there must be consistent daily overlap for communication and project alignment.

You will:

Participate in tea
etings every week (Wednesdays 4-5 PM EST, additional as necessary)

Attend weekly one-on-one meetings with the Director of Growth

Communicate proactively regarding builds, timelines, and testing updates







Key Responsibilities

CRM & Automation Architecture (Primary Focus)

Build, manage, and optimize workflows within Go High Level

Create automated lead nurture sequences (SMS,
, pipeline movement)

Develop tagging systems and segmentation logic

Build and manage sales pipelines with automated stage triggers

Set up appointment booking systems and automated reminders

Ensure integrations are properly connected (Zapier, ad platforms, forms, etc.)

Conduct QA testing on all workflows before launch

Continuously optimize automations for conversion performance

AI & Automation Innovation

Implement conversational AI systems (SMS, chat, chatbot logic) for lead capture and qualification

Build AI-assisted booking and follow-up workflows

Deploy Voice AI systems for inbound and outbound lead handling

Continuously test emerging automation tools to improve speed-to-lead and conversion performance

Identify opportunities to replace manual processes with intelligent automation





Lead Management & Funnel Optimization

Map customer journeys from first touch to conversion

Build landing pages and funnels within GHL

Optimize form flows and tracking infrastructure

Implement attribution tracking and reporting dashboards (Looker Studio) 

Identify drop-off points and improve system performance 





Analytics & Reporting (Plus)

Track CRM-based KPIs (lead flow, cost per lead, conversion rates, pipeline velocity)

Build dashboards for internal and client-facing reporting

Analyze automation performance and suggest improvements

Ensure accurate tracking between ad platforms and CRM





Paid Media Buying (Highly Preferred)

Manage and optimize Meta 
/Instagram) campaigns

Manage and optimize Google Ads campaigns

Align ad strategy with CRM workflows and nurture sequences

Improve lead quality through audience targeting and campaign optimization

Understand full-funnel performance from click to close







Qualifications

Proven experience building and managing automations inside Go High Level

Deep understanding of CRM logic, triggers, workflows, and segmentation

Experience setting up pipelines, lead scoring, and multi-step nurture sequences

Strong troubleshooting skills for integrations and tracking issues

Ability to think strategically about customer journeys and conversion paths

Comfortable working in a fast-paced agency environment

Strong working knowledge of Google Workspace (Sheets, Drive, Docs) for reporting, tracking, and documentation







Preferred Skills

Media buying experience (Meta & Google Ads)

Strong understanding of paid acquisition funnels 

Experience with analytics tools (Google Analytics, Looker Studio, Supermetrics, etc.)

Basic understanding of API connections and webhook logic

Experience working with multiple client accounts simultaneously







Desired Traits

Systems thinker — you naturally see how all pieces connect

Detail-obsessed and process-driven

Proactive problem-solver who identifies gaps before they become issues

Comfortable taking ownership of backend infrastructure

Performance-minded — you care about results, not just builds







Compensation

Full or Part-time salaried position

Pay range for full time (Monthly) : $870 to $1,213

Pay cadence: weekly 

Pay through Wise 

Compensation based on experience and technical depth 

Growth opportunities aligned with performance and leadership capacity

title: Trade Data Research Analyst — Part-Time / Contract
description:
About the Role:



We help Asian manufacturers evaluate and enter the US market. We're looking for a research analyst to support a produce export project — pulling US import data, building visualizations, and helping us turn raw trade data into professional client-facing reports.



What You'll Do:



Pull and organize US import/export data by HS/HTS code (shipment volumes, pricing trends, importer names, competitor activity)

Build clean data visualizations — tariff breakdowns, import trend charts, competitive landscape maps

Help compile findings into polished report sections with executive summary narratives alongside the visuals

Research regulatory requirements (FDA, USDA) for specific product categories

Collaborate async via Loom/Slack with the founder



What We're Looking For:



Experience working with trade data, import/export research, or market research

Strong data visualization skills (Excel, Google Sheets, Tableau, or similar)

Comfortable learning new platforms quickly — we're currently evaluating tools like Import Yeti, Volza, Descartes Datamyne, and others, so adaptability matters more than knowing one specific tool

Detail-oriented with strong written English



Bonus: familiarity with US customs/tariff data, HS codes, or FDA import requirements



Hours: 20-30 hours/week to start (flexible, async)

To Apply: Send a brief note on your relevant experience and one example of a report, dashboard, or data visualization you've built. Doesn't need to be trade-related — we want to see how you organize and present data.

etings (Tuesdays & Thursdays at 8:30 AM EST)

title: Customer Support Specialist
description:
Role Summary



The Customer Support Specialist is the primary point of contact for members, leaders, nonprofits, partners, and

clients. This role combines deep technical troubleshooting within our proprietary admin panel with high-empathy

community engagement. You will ensure that donation cycles are accurate, leadership transitions are seamless, and every

user experience reflects our core values of trust and transparency. You will work within a highly collaborative environment,

sharing execution and strategic responsibilities with the Community Team, with the support of Growth, Accounts, and

Product teams to ensure seamless platform operations.



Operations & Technical Support

? Technical Ticket Resolution: Manage
 inquiries and voi
s in Hubspot, prioritizing tickets based on

urgency and user type (e.g., Client vs. Partner vs. Leader vs. Member).

? Database & Records Management: Utilize Admin Panel to manage Users, Memberships, Donations,

Subscriptions, Post Submissions, Funds, and other backend data to resolve account adjustments and discrepancies.

? Financial Operations Support: Execute refunds via Stripe, cancel duplicate subscriptions, and move donations

between "Pools" to ensure accurate fund allocation.

? Integrity & Compliance: Review all newly created Giving Circles daily to determine legitimacy and ensure proper

internal tagging.

? Security & Mitigation: Proactively identify and deactivate "spammy" groups and user accounts.

? Content Moderation: Inspect posts and submissions, including text and video content for profanity and brand

compliance before they are shared with donors.













Community & Leader Success

? Leader Onboarding: Review new leader applications, manage the "Leader Buddy Matching" program, and monitor

peer learning cohorts to ensure new leaders are supported.

? Community Engagement: Monitor and respond to community posts and social media comments

(LinkedIn/Facebook/Instagram) to maintain an active, welcoming environment.

? At-Risk Intervention: Regularly update the "Circle At-Risk" tracker and provide hands-on support to groups where

leaders have resigned or have become non-responsive.

? Churn Mitigation: Identify "churned" groups (those that have stopped donating) and execute weekly outreach to

encourage reactivation.

? High-Touch Support: Host personalized Google Meet support sessions for active and potential Giving Circle

leaders, partners, and clients to assist in onboarding and troubleshooting needs.

Resource & Events Coordination

? Data Management: Demonstrate proficiency in Google Sheets, data scraping, data cleaning, and other technical

tools to fulfill data requests from the CEO, internal teams, and customers.

? Creative AI Integration: Leverage AI tools creatively to draft community communications, summarize feedback, and

automate routine administrative workflows to increase operational efficiency.

? Knowledge Management: Maintain both internal and external knowledge bases (including
 templates),

ensuring documentation reflects current platform features and workflows.

? Digital Ecosystem: Maintain and update key resource hubs including the website, LinkTree, the

Community Resource Library, YouTube, and Notion pages.

? Leader Training: Manage and update leader training modules and educational materials to ensure leaders are

equipped to host successful kickoff events.

? Event Logistics: Set up LinkedIn Events, provide Zoom links for meetings, review circle event submissions, and

provide administrative support for Member Mixer events



**To apply, please send an
 to 
 with the subject line "Re: Customer Support Specialist"**

title: GHL Automation Specialist & Technical VA
description:
Reports To: Head of Operations and Marketing Lead

Role Type: Enabler / System Builder 

Location: Remote, Part Time 



Role Overview

At Gifted Gabber, we are building a foundation that protects, supports, and enables growth. We are seeking a System Enabler, a hybrid professional who combines high-level automation logic with precise technical execution. You will be responsible for the "plumbing" of our business, ensuring that our leads flow seamlessly through GoHighLevel (GHL) and that our student content is delivered flawlessly. Your goal is to remove friction, create stability, and support scale.



Key Responsibilities

1. Automation & Workflow Architecture 

Must be proficient in the following Automation tools

Zapier

GHL

Google Studio


 (Optional)

GHL Mastery: Design, build, and maintain complex workflows in GoHighLevel to support our marketing efficiency and lower CAC goals. This includes automated follow-ups, pipeline movements, and attribution tracking.

Error Reduction: proactively identify "leaky buckets" in our automations to reduce manual rework and operational errors by 20%.

Cross-Platform Integration: Ensure GHL talks perfectly to our other tools (ClickUp, Slack, etc.). You will act as the bridge between "Growth" (Marketing) and "Delivery" (Student Success).

Dashboard Support: Assist in gathering data for our unified operations dashboard to track CCP, costs, and sales pipelines.

2. Technical Assistance & Content Management 

Session Management: Own the technical delivery of our core programs (CCP/Research). This includes processing and uploading Zoom recording sessions to GHL portals immediately after sessions conclude to ensure a premium student experience.

Asset Management: Organize and tag assets within GHL to ensure our "Third Parent" trademark and brand materials are used consistently.

Tech Troubleshooting: Serve as the first line of defense for any technical glitches within the GHL student portal.

3. Operational Excellence 

Documentation: Create clear SOPs for every automation built. If you build it, you must document how it works so the team is never left in the dark.



Requirements

Expert-Level GoHighLevel (GHL): You don't just know how to send an
; you understand triggers, smart lists, custom values, and snapshots.

Automation Mindset: Experience with tools like Make (formerly Integromat) or Zapier is highly preferred. You see manual tasks as problems to be solved.

High Attention to Detail: We are dealing with student education and parent investments. A broken link or a missing recording is not an option.

Zapier and GHL Proficiency: Familiarity with Zapier and GHL and any other project management  and automations tool (Spaces, Folders, Lists) and using it for task management. You don’t have to have EXPERT or INTERMEDIATE level, as long as you comprehend the properties fluently. 

Proactive Communicator: You don't hide problems; you flag them and suggest solutions.

Collaborative: We are not looking for a silent task-taker; we need a proactive System Builder. Because Gifted Gabber operates a diverse portfolio of programs (CCP, Research, Passion Projects), we require a critical thinker who can navigate complexity with a solution-first mindset. You must be able to interpret data analytics and translate them into logical, friction-free workflows that ensure our decisions are based on facts, not guesses. You will work closely with the Operations Lead to turn raw data into a "Unified Operations Dashboard" that drives our growth.





Success Metrics (KPIs & OKRs)

Your performance will be measured by your contribution to our 2026 OKRs:

System Uptime: 100?curacy on GHL workflow triggers (Zero "false positives" on lead automations).

Turnaround Time: Student session recordings uploaded and accessible within 4 hours of session end.

Efficiency: Contribution to reducing non-essential expenditure (by automating manual paid tasks).

Documentation: 100% of workflows created have a corresponding SOP in our Process Library.



Submit your application on this form:

title: Senior SEO and Marketing Specialist
description:
Job Summary

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior SEO Specialist to join our dynamic CNSS marketing team. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of search engine optimization strategies and techniques, with a proven track record of driving organic traffic and improving search rankings. This role requires a blend of technical expertise and creative problem-solving skills to enhance our online presence and maximize the effectiveness of our digital marketing efforts.



TRACKING SOFTWARE IS MANDATORY FOR ALL OUR EMPLOYEES. WE USE TERAMIND



Duties

Minimum 3 years of experience

Develop and implement comprehensive SEO strategies to increase organic search visibility and traffic.

Conduct keyword research to identify high-value opportunities for content creation and optimization.

Analyze website performance using tools such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, and Google Tag Manager to monitor traffic trends and user behavior.

Optimize website content, structure, and on-page elements (including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript) for improved search engine rankings.

Collaborate with the content team to create SEO-friendly content that aligns with business goals and audience needs.

Perform technical SEO audits to identify issues affecting site performance and provide actionable recommendations for improvement.

Stay updated on industry trends, algorithm changes, and best practices in SEO to ensure ongoing optimization efforts are effective.

Manage E-commerce SEO initiatives to enhance product visibility and drive sales through organic search channels.

Utilize Adobe tools for design enhancements that support SEO strategies.

Build high-quality backlinks and improve domain authority

Plan, launch, and manage Google Ads campaigns

Requirements



Proven experience as an SEO Specialist or similar role, with a strong portfolio demonstrating successful projects.

Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and WordPress; familiarity with website development is a plus.

Experience with E-commerce platforms and optimizing product listings for search engines.

In-depth knowledge of Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Google Tag Manager, and other relevant SEO tools.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions.

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams.

A proactive approach to problem-solving with attention to detail.

If you are passionate about SEO and eager to make a significant impact in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
**About The Laundry Brothers**



We’re a fast-growing laundry & dry cleaning pickup and delivery company serving busy families and businesses in Vancouver, Canada. Our promise is simple: we remove “laundry” from our customers’ lives with reliable pickup, professional cleaning, and on-time delivery, every week.



We’re looking for a **Remote Customer Service** who will treat our customers like their own and help us keep every client feeling informed, cared for, and taken seriously.



This is a **long-term role** with real growth for the right person.



---



### Role Overview



Your main job:

Keep our customers happy, informed, and staying with us for a long time.



You will:



- Be the main point of contact for a group of residential and/or commercial customers

- Respond to questions via
, SMS, and calls (no cold calling)

- Proactively check in with key accounts and solve small issues before they become big problems

- Coordinate with our internal team (drivers, laundry facility, CSRs) to make sure promises are kept

- **Occasionally respond to urgent client issues outside of strict 9–5 hours when something time-sensitive comes up (missed pickup, delivery issue, etc.)**

- Track issues, requests, and follow-ups in our systems (CleanCloud, Google Sheets, Slack, etc.)



This is **not** a “read a script and disappear” job. We want someone who takes ownership, communicates clearly, and thinks ahead for the customer.



---



### Responsibilities



- Manage day-to-day communication with assigned customers

- Follow up on missed pickups, special requests, and service issues

- Log notes and updates in our systems so the team always knows what’s happening

- Monitor customer satisfaction and flag at-risk accounts early

- Help onboard new subscription or commercial customers so they have a smooth first month

- Suggest simple process improvements when you see recurring problems

- **Be reachable and willing to handle occasional urgent issues when time-sensitive problems arise**



---



### Requirements



- 2+ years experience in **Account Management, Client Success, or Customer Support** (B2C or B2B)

- Excellent written and spoken English

- Strong internet connection, reliable computer, and quiet place to work

- High attention to detail and follow-through (you close the loop, every time)

- Comfortable using tools like: Google Workspace (Gmail, Docs, Sheets), CRMs, or support tools

- Able to work **full-time** with at least 4–8 hours overlap with **Pacific Time (Vancouver)**

- **Comfortable occasionally responding to urgent client messages outside of strict schedule when necessary**



Bonus if you have:



- Experience working with North American / Canadian clients

- Experience with service businesses, logistics, delivery, or similar



---



### Work Schedule & Compensation



- Full-time, 40 hours per week

- Schedule: must overlap with Vancouver daytime hours (we will discuss exact hours)

- Competitive salary in CAD (based on experience), paid monthly

- Commission for managing accounts + growing the book

- Long-term role with growth opportunities



---



### How To Apply



Fill out this application form:




Only applicants who **complete the form and video** will be considered.

title: Vendor Management Agent
description:

We are a growing ecommerce company working with global production and fulfillment vendors. Our operations depend on reliable systems, smart investigation, and people who enjoy figuring things out.

You will investigate operational issues such as:

orders that fail in automation

tracking that stops updating

vendor fulfillment problems

system mismatches between platforms

Your job is to figure out why something happened and help fix the root cause.



You will often receive incomplete information and must d
:

where to look first

what system to check

who to contact

how to confirm the solution worked

Daily Responsibilities

Investigate delayed or failed orders

Track issues across OrderDesk and shipping systems

Communicate with vendors to diagnose problems

Identify patterns causing repeated issues

Test fixes and confirm resolutions

Maintain accurate operational data

Tools You May Use

OrderDesk, EasyPost, Google Sheets, ecommerce platforms, and support/CRM tools.



Experience is not required if you learn quickly. We value fast learners more than specific experience.

Who Will Do Well Here

Like figuring out why problems happen

Try solving things before asking for instructions

Enjoy learning new software on your own

Pay attention to small details others miss

Prefer thinking work over repetitive tasks

Want to grow into operations or automation roles

This role is NOT ideal if you prefer fully scripted workflows.

Requirements

Strong written and spoken English

Reliable internet and workspace

Logical thinking and attention to detail

Comfortable learning new systems independently

Experience troubleshooting problems (any industry)

Ecommerce experience is helpful but not required.

Compensation & Schedule

Full-time remote

Long-term position

Stable workload

High performers may receive increased responsibility and growth opportunities

title: PM / Scrum Master (Execution-Driven Delivery Lead)
description:
About EduTrack

EduTrack is a growing EdTech platform building smart, intuitive systems for schools and therapy-based organizations. Our mission: create tools that actually make life easier for administrators, educators, and clinicians.

We’re looking for a PM / Scrum Master who will fully own team execution, sprint process, and delivery clarity.



Role Overview

As the PM / Scrum Master, you will run the execution engine for EduTrack. You will take high-level product intent and transform it into clean, structured, sprint-ready work.

You’ll own sprint ceremonies, ticket quality, dependencies, delivery tracking, and day-to-day developer coordination.



Important:

You own execution.

The Tech Lead retains architecture, code reviews, code structure, and final acceptance approval.



Key Responsibilities

- Own all sprint ceremonies (planning, standups, review, retro)

- Convert product intent into clear user stories and task breakdowns

- Maintain a clean, organized, groomed backlog

- Ensure all tickets meet “sprint-ready” definition

- Track burndown, velocity, risks, and delivery progress

- Manage dependencies and escalate blockers early

- Coordinate developer workload, sequencing, and commitments

- Review ticket completeness before “Dev Done”

- Keep documentation organized (Confluence)

ntum

Requirements

Steadiness-Compliance-oriented

>120 IQ

Strong ability to organize messy information into actionable systems

Experience creating SOPs, documentation, or process libraries

Comfortable screening candidates and evaluating communication quality

Highly proactive — you anticipate needs and close loops

Strong time management and follow-through

Familiar with Google Workspace and project management tools



Nice to Have

Experience supporting a founder or startup

Familiarity with AI tools and prompt engineering

Experience managing contractors or remote teams
