title: Senior Executive Assistant to Founder
description:
Senior Executive Assistant to Founder | High Trust Strategic and Creative Role



THIS IS NOT A STANDARD EA ROLE! 

WE ARE LOOKING FOR A DIAMOND NOT A TASK DOER!

IMMEDIATE ASAP START!



OVERVIEW



We are searching for a rare kind of Executive Assistant. Someone who can operate at a high cognitive level, balance logic with creativity, think ahead, and genuinely reduce mental load for a busy Founder running a fast paced, multi brand business.



This is a new role for our business. We have never hired for this position before and we are hiring one person only.



If you thrive on ticking off a static task list and waiting for instructions, this role is not for you.



If you are intelligent, intuitive, proactive, detail obsessed, and capable of holding many moving parts in your head at once while still delivering polished and accurate work, keep reading.



This role is best described as Right Hand to the Founder.



You will be deeply trusted, deeply involved, and expected to think, not just execute.



ABOUT THE ROLE



You will support the Founder across business and personal administration, creative projects, planning, prioritisation, and execution.



This role requires someone who can take a brain dump and turn it into a clear and logical action plan, anticipate needs before they are verbalised, prepare everything in advance, and build context and clarity instead of simply completing tasks.



You will work across admin, CRM, calendar and inbox management, Canva design, document preparation, social media content, training assets, scheduling, and execution support.



Some days you may be creating digital assets. Other days you may be restructuring calendars, rescheduling meetings, or supporting operational work. This is a true all rounder role at a high level.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



Act as Executive Assistant and right hand to the Founder, supporting both business and personal administration.



Manage calendars, inboxes, scheduling, rescheduling, and priority alignment with precision and foresight.



Process brain dumps, voice notes, and written ideas and translate them into structured and actionable task lists and timelines.



Prepare documents, PDFs, presentations, training modules, and digital assets in advance.



Create and manage content using Canva, including social media posts and internal assets.



Maintain clarity and logic across tasks, projects, and priorities, flagging conflicts before they become issues.



Manage drives, file sharing, naming conventions, and document structure.



Use CRM systems accurately and intelligently.



Assist with social media content creation and posting when required.



Occasionally assist with client calls, internal coordination, or operational support.



Reduce mental load for the Founder by owning tasks end to end and thinking proactively.



Operate with extreme reliability, discretion, and follow through.



WHO YOU ARE



Highly intelligent, intuitive, and fast thinking.



Exceptionally organised but not rigid. You can adapt when priorities shift.



Proactive not passive. You do not wait to be told what to do next.



Comfortable balancing detail and big picture thinking at the same time.



A creative problem solver who enjoys figuring things out, not being spoon fed.



Calm under pressure and capable of juggling multiple priorities simultaneously.



Deeply reliable and consistent. When you say something will be done, it is done properly.



Emotionally intelligent and able to read context, tone, and nuance.



A natural all rounder who is happy to jump in wherever needed.



YOU MUST HAVE



Excellent spoken and written English. You must be able to communicate clearly, confidently, and naturally in English without using GPT or any AI tool as a translator, writer, or thinking crutch. Spell check is fine. Thinking and communication must be your own.



Strong experience with Canva.



Strong experience with Outlook and advanced calendar management.



Experience with Google Drive or OneDrive, file sharing, and document organisation.



Confidence working with PDFs, document preparation, and digital assets.



Experience using CRM systems.



The ability to manage multiple tasks without dropping accuracy.



Experience supporting a Founder, Director, or senior leader is highly regarded.



A quiet home office, fast wired internet, and a Windows PC.



Previous offshore experience with an Australian, UK, or US based company is an advantage.



THIS ROLE IS NOT FOR YOU IF



You need step by step instructions for everything.



You wait to be told what to do rather than anticipating needs.



You struggle with changing priorities or ambiguity.



You rely on GPT or other AI tools to translate your thoughts, write messages, structure your communication, or compensate for gaps in English fluency.



You prefer repetitive and clearly defined tasks only.



WORK HOURS



Please only apply if you can commit to these hours consistently and long term.



Brisbane Time UTC plus 10

Monday to Friday

8:00am to 6:00pm



Breaks included each day:

2 x 10 minute paid breaks

1 hour unpaid break



SALARY AND BENEFITS



55,000 PHP per month starting salary.



13th month pay.



Salary increases thereafter based on performance, capability, reliability, and long term commitment.



All Filipino public holidays fully paid.



15 days PTO.



Long term, stable, full time role with growth built in.



Direct access to leadership, meaningful responsibility, and real trust.



ABOUT US



My Ultimate Events is an Australian owned company with over 15 years of experience.



We operate across multiple brands and have a highly experienced onshore and offshore team who have worked together long term.



We invest deeply in our people and prioritise trust, clarity, accountability, and growth.



This is not a high turnover business. This role exists because the company has grown to a point where the Founder requires a true right hand, not because of churn or replacement.



We are hiring for one person only.



HOW TO APPLY



 your application directly to 
 via the OnlineJobs inbox will not be reviewed.



To be considered, you must include all of the following:



A short personalised video introducing yourself and explaining why you are uniquely suited to this role.



A cover letter written entirely by you explaining your experience supporting senior leaders and how you actively reduce mental load.



Your CV.



Confirmation of your PC specs, internet speed, and home office setup.



This role is rare. We are looking for someone exceptional.



If you know you are that person, we cannot wait to meet you.



THIS COULD BE YOUR ULTIMATE CAREER MOVE

title: Medical Biller
description:
We’re Hiring: Medical Biller

Remote | EST Time Zone



We are currently seeking an experienced Medical Biller to join our growing team. This position will start at 25–30 hours per week, with the potential to grow into a full-time role. Candidates must be available to work during Eastern Standard Time (EST) business hours. Hands-on experience with CentralReach is required.



The Medical Biller will be responsible for submitting and following up on insurance claims, managing billing and payment posting, verifying patient insurance eligibility and benefits, and handling claim denials and appeals. The role also includes maintaining accurate billing records and documentation, communicating with insurance providers and patients regarding billing concerns, and ensuring compliance with HIPAA and healthcare regulations.



We strongly prefer candidates with experience in pre-billing audits and billing support, ensuring claims accuracy prior to submission. Knowledge of ABA operations, including clinical data review to support accurate billing, is highly preferred. The ideal candidate understands how to review session notes, authorizations, and service documentation to ensure compliance and proper reimbursement.



Qualified applicants must have proven experience as a Medical Biller, preferably within ABA or behavioral health settings, and direct hands-on experience using CentralReach. A solid understanding of insurance claims, explanation of benefits (EOBs), denial management, CPT and ICD-10 coding is essential. Candidates must be detail-oriented, organized, and capable of working independently in a remote environment, with strong written and verbal communication skills.



If you meet the qualifications and are interested in this opportunity, please submit your updated CV and Intro Video along with your active Whatsapp Number

title: Marketing and Automation (Real Estate Growth Engine)
description:
About the Role



I am a Florida-based Real Estate Advisor building a modern, lifestyle-driven real estate brand focused on relocation buyers, new construction, and long-term homeownership.



My business is growing, and I am looking for a smart, reliable, systems-minded Marketing & Content Operations Manager to help build a consistent, organized, and automated marketing engine.



This role is not just about posting content.

It is about helping create a simple, repeatable system that turns:



Content >Leads >CRM >Nurture >Appointments >Clients



If you are organized, proactive, detail-oriented, and think in systems — this role is for you.



Responsibilities

Content & Marketing



• Edit raw video into engaging short-form content (Reels / Shorts / TikTok) — approx. 10 per month

• Repurpose content across Instagram,
, and

• Create a simple monthly content calendar aligned with target audience

• Write captions that educate, build trust, and generate engagement

• Maintain consistent brand voice (professional, warm, expert, lifestyle-driven)



Marketing Systems & Automation



• Help connect lead magnets to simple funnels

• Support light automation (Lead capture >CRM >nurture > appointment booking)

• Assist with
 and ManyChat nurture setup

• Organize and tag contacts inside CRM (KW Command)



 & Nurture



• Create 1 Monthly Newsletter

• Create 1 Weekly Nurture

• Support simple campaign organization



Operations & Tracking



• Track basic metrics (leads, engagement, conversations, booked appointments)

• Help improve workflow and consistency

• Identify gaps and suggest improvements



Requirements



• Strong English communication (written and verbal)

• Experience with short-form video editing (CapCut, Premiere, or similar)

• Organized, detail-oriented, and reliable

• Ability to follow systems and improve processes

• Comfortable learning CRM and automation tools

• Able to work independently once trained



Preferred / Bonus Skills



(Not required but a strong advantage)



• Real Estate marketing experience

• ManyChat, Mailchimp, or CRM experience

• Funnel / lead magnet experience

• Copywriting / conversion writing

• Social media growth strategy



What Success Looks Like (First 90 Days)



• Consistent content production each month

• Organized CRM and simple tagging system

• Newsletter and nurture
s running smoothly

• Clear, repeatable marketing workflow established

• Improved consistency and lead flow



How to Apply



Please send a message including:



A short personal introduction (not generic)



Why you are a strong fit for this role



Examples of your work (video, content, systems, or automation)



Your experience with video editing, content, and marketing systems



Your expected monthly salary



Start your message with the word “GROWTH” to show attention to detail



Applications without effort or detail will not be reviewed.



Final Note



This is a long-term opportunity for someone reliable, intelligent, and growth-minded.

I am looking for someone who wants to build systems, create impact, and grow with the business.

title: Operations Director
description:
OPERATIONS DIRECTOR / INTEGRATOR

Functional Medicine Startup | Remote | Full-Time



We are not just looking for another Virtual Assistant. We are looking for an Integrator.



Someone who operates like a business partner to the CEO. Someone who can take vision and turn it into execution. Someone who does not wait to be managed — but manages.



If you are a proactive operator who thrives on building systems, driving accountability, and making sure projects actually get done, keep reading.



ABOUT US



We are building a Functional Medicine practice in the U.S. with a long-term vision of becoming a highly structured, system-driven, mission-oriented healthcare organization.



The CEO is a visionary healthcare entrepreneur with big ideas, strong standards, and high expectations. Your role is to translate ideas into plans, plans into projects, and projects into results.



You will function as:

-A COO

-A strategic executor

-A team coordinator

-A culture carrier

-A force that keeps the organization aligned and moving forward



WHAT THIS ROLE REALLY IS



You will:

-Own execution across the business

-Turn discussions into clear action plans

-Ensure projects move forward without constant supervision

-Proactively provide updates and surface issues early

-Delegate tasks to tea
mbers and ensure completion

-Optimize workflows and eliminate inefficiencies

-Build systems that reduce chaos and dependency

-Hold the team accountable with professionalism and clarity



You will not be micromanaged. But you are expected to communicate actively and clearly.



We are looking for someone who naturally thinks:

“What’s the next step?”

“How do we systemize this?”

“What bottleneck can I remove?”



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

-Break down big goals into weekly priorities

-Ensure deadlines are met



2. Team Coordination & Delegation

-Assign tasks appropriately

-Follow up without being pushy

-Ensure quality control of outputs

-Optimize team strengths



3. Operations & Systems

-Build SOPs and workflows

-Improve automation and efficiency

-Implement and manage project management systems

-Identify operational gaps before they become problems



4. Proactive Communication

-Provide structured updates

-Surface risks early

-Recommend solutions, not just report problems



5. Leadership Support

-Help the CEO stay in visionary mode

-Protect the CEO’s time and focus

-Push back respectfully when needed

-Be a thinking partner



WHO YOU ARE



You are:

-Extremely organized

-Calm under pressure

-Comfortable making decisions

-Confident but not arrogant

-Direct, clear, and honest

-Naturally proactive

-Not dependent on constant instruction

-Able to manage up and manage across



You have likely:

-Worked closely with founders, CEOs, or high-level executives

-Managed projects across multiple teams

-Built systems in startups or growing companies

-Delegated tasks and ensured follow-through

Bonus if you:

THIS ROLES IS NOT FOR YOU IF:

WORK SETUP

title: Bookkeeper with QBO experience
description:
POSITION SUMMARY

We are looking for a detail-oriented Bookkeeper to oversee the organization's financial record-keeping to ensure the business can make sound financial decisions. This position will be responsible for producing monthly financial reports, maintaining an adequate accounting record system, and managing a comprehensive set of controls, budgets, and forecasting to mitigate risks. The Bookkeeper will play a key role in enhancing the accuracy of the company’s reported financial results and ensuring those results comply with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) and bookkeeping principles and procedures. This position will report directly to the Finance Manager.





This position is 100% remote.





ABOUT CARDONE VENTURES

Our mission is to help business owners achieve their personal, professional, and financial goals through the growth of their businesses. We work in dozens of verticals and provide strategic business guidance through courses, live events, partnerships, and investments. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are inspirational, disciplined, accountable, transparent, aligned, and results-oriented. This company operates nationally and is growing by the day.

Wondering what it's like to work here? Come check this:


/watch?v=PIIv7sYj1Ns





SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE

- Timely and accurate delivery of monthly financial reports, reconciliations, and compliance filings

- Organized and auditable accounting systems with well-maintained digital records and controls

- Budgets and forecasts are submitted on time with clear variance analysis and actionable insights

- All payables, debt obligations, and tax filings are completed without delays or errors

- Trusted financial insights that support business decisions and reflect a strong understanding of GAAP principles





OBJECTIVES

- Maintain an accurate and timely record of all financial transactions and issue timely and complete financial statements

- Perform account reconciliation to assert the accuracy of transactions and entries in the accounting system

- Develop a documented system of accounting policies and procedures

- Monitor the accounting operations of subsidiary entities, transaction-processing operations, and policies and procedures

- Develop professionally by remaining aware of new state and federal regulations, participating in educational opportunities, and reading professional publications

- Ensure that all accounts payable are paid timely manner and all reasonable discounts are taken on invoices

- Ensure that monthly bank and credit card reconciliations are completed

- Ensure that required debt payments (company credit cards, loans, or lines of credit) are paid on a timely basis

- Develop and maintain an orderly accounting filing system (digital)

- Maintain a system of controls over accounting transactions

- Manage the production of the annual budget and forecasts

- Calculate variances from the budget and report significant issues to ownership

- Calculate and issue financial and operating metrics

- Coordinate the preparation and compilation of year-end reporting and financial statements

- Report and file state sales and use tax

- Reconcile all balance sheet accounts monthly

- Perform other duties as assigned



COMPETENCIES

- Demonstrates solid GAAP and financial reporting, technical skills

- Demonstrates proficiency with QuickBooks, XERO or other accounting software, MS Office Suite, Adobe, Windows, DocuSign, Google Suite

- Proactive approach to problem-solving and process improvement

- Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment of change and growth

- Demonstrates knowledge of auditing, accounting, and corporate financing

- Possesses strong written and verbal communication skills, clearly communicating by phone or in person with tea
mbers

- Ability to prioritize multiple tasks and responsibilities

- Demonstrates a working knowledge of taxation and corporate structures

- Ability to successfully maintain a positive attitude while working in a team environment with competing priorities

- Possesses outstanding organizational and administrative skills



EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

- Bachelor’s degree in accounting and finance, or equivalent business experience

- Minimum 3 years of progressive experience in bookkeeping

- Experience working with multiple legal entities under a legal umbrella

- Experience with financial reporting requirements



PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer





COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce, Highland Park Lapidary recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates, and partners.





If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, please complete the online application form:


/

In this role, you'll own the end-to-end design experience — from concept to pixel-perfect delivery — across our iOS app and brand touchpoints. You think in systems, design with intention, and care deeply about the humans on the other side of the screen. If you love solving complex problems with elegant, intuitive design and thrive in a collaborative environment where your work actually ships, we'd love to meet you.

title: LinkedIn Relationship Builder & Executive Outreach Specialist
description:
I am a U.S.-based health and longevity coach who works specifically with female executives (VP, SVP, C-suite level, 40+). My positioning is professional, evidence-informed, and high-trust. My audience is senior corporate leaders not general consumers.

This role is NOT about cold pitching or sending spa
ssages.

This is about strategic relationship building on LinkedIn in a respectful, intelligent, and professional way.What I Need



I am looking for someone who deeply understands how LinkedIn works. Especially in a B2B, executive-level environment.



Your job will be to:

• Identify ideal client profiles (VP, SVP, CFO, CHRO, Women 40+ in tech/finance/healthcare)

• Review their content and activity

• Thoughtfully engage with their posts (likes + meaningful comments)

• Send professional, personalized connection requests (no sales pitch)

• Track outreach and engagement in a simple spreadsheet

• Follow clear brand tone guidelines



This is NOT mass automation. This is manual, intentional engagement.



What This Is NOT

• Not cold selling

• Not copy/paste messaging

• Not aggressive follow-ups

• Not commenting “Great post!”

We are building authority and trust not chasing leads.



The Tone Required

• Executive-level professionalism

• Intelligent, thoughtful comments

• No emojis unless contextually appropriate

• No hype language

• No sales language

• No desperation tone

Everything must feel natural, high-trust, and aligned with a premium brand.



Requirements

You MUST:

• Have prior experience managing LinkedIn engagement

• Understand LinkedIn algorithm basics (engagement timing, visibility, etc.)

• Know how to write intelligent, context-aware comments

• Have excellent written English

• Be able to research industries and understand corporate titles

• Understand discretion and brand protection



Bonus if you:

• Have worked with coaches or consultants

• Understand B2B positioning

• Understand executive audiences



Deliverables

Weekly:

• 30 new targeted connections

• 20 meaningful executive-level comments

• 10–15 strategic post likes (supporting visibility)

• 5 strategic follow-up touches per week (Example: engage with someone again within 10–14 days)

• Spreadsheet tracking: name, title, company, date connected, notes



Hours & Structure

Part-time to start (5–10 hours/week)

Potential to increase hours and pay after 30 days based on performance



To Apply

Please include:

A short paragraph explaining your LinkedIn experience

A sample 
ment you would leave on a post from a CFO discussing leadership burnout

The word “EXECUTIVE” in your subject line so I know you read this fully

And please answer this question: “What is the difference between LinkedIn engagement for executive audiences vs. small business owners?”

title: Do you love making people feel cared for? Support our CEOs as an Executive Personal Assistant!
description:
Do you love making people feel cared for? Are you the one who remembers everyone’s birthdays, plans amazing gatherings, makes fun plans, and brings warmth into the lives of those around you?



This is NOT your typical assistant job. It’s deeply personal. You’ll work with a kind but intense U.S.-based pair of brothers (proven entrepreneurs working as Co-CEOs of the same business) to support their lives, not the company they are building. From keeping friendships alive and planning meaningful experiences to sending thoughtful gifts and helping them stay on track with personal goals, you’ll be part organizer, part cheerleader, part coach. If you’ve ever been called the “mom” of your group and you’re looking for a decades-long position, this might be your dream job.



Your Role

- Build trust by executing on tasks and communicating clearly, which will lead to taking on more responsibility, which will then lead to increases in pay.

- Keep relationships thriving by managing a personal CRM and helping stay in touch with friends and family.

- Use technology to help automate certain tasks that are repetitive.

- Track habits, support routines, and act as an accountability partner for personal goals.

- Pick out thoughtful, creative gifts for birthdays and other special 
nts.

- Research products, tools, and ideas to make life easier, better, or more fun.

- Plan and book unforgettable travel, great hotels, and the perfect dinner spots.

- Jump in on special personal projects wherever a helping hand is needed.



What’s In It for You

- A Long-Term Role: This is meant to last. The entrepreneurs who you'd be an assistant to are looking for a lifetime assistant.

- Great Place to Work: These entrepreneurs are known to have a super high retention rate of employees and create a great work environment.

- Creative Work: From planning memorable trips to picking out the perfect gift, this role lets you flex your creative muscles and thoughtful side every day.

- Variety: No two days will feel the same. You’ll get to research, plan, coach, organize, and more.

- Paid Leave: You'll get at least 10 days of paid leave plus major holidays.

- Remote Flexibility: Work from the comfort of your home and gain flexibility with hours once trust is built.



Desired Attributes

- Extremely caring, social people-person who will excel in personal tasks

- High attention to detail and organizational skills

- Very strong written and oral English skills

- Minimum 50 Mbps Internet Speed

- Designated office space in your home



To apply and ensure your application is considered, do all of the following two steps:

1. DM with a quick introduction to yourself if you're interested. Include the word "cupcake" *in your subject line*, and Include your resume. ++Bonus points for a video introduction, though it's not strictly required

title: Coyote Promotions - Sales Account Coordinator
description:
Hey there! Coyote Promotions is growing — and we’re looking for a Sales Account Coordinator who understands the promotional products world and thrives in the details that make great client experiences possible.

Prior promotional product sourcing and account management experience is required

Compensation is fixed

We may contact references to confirm previous experience and performance



If that aligns — let’s talk.



- 



The Sales Account Coordinator works closely with Account Managers to support merchandise strategy, sourcing, quoting, and execution. While primarily non-client-facing, this role offers visibility into client interactions to understand brand expectations, cadence, and service standards — building a foundation for growth within the organization. You are the operational backbone of every successful program.



Core Responsibilities



Partner with assigned Account Managers to support client goals and drive Coyote value

Source merchandise aligned with client needs and differentiation strategy

Create professional product presentations and sales documentation

Manage proposals, correspondence, and internal reporting

Update and maintain orders within internal systems

Own project and order management from concept through delivery

Build and maintain strong vendor relationships

Negotiate pricing to maximize profitability

Track timelines, shipments, and deliverables to ensure deadlines are met

Collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, Production, Creative, Garment Services, Accounting, Warehouse, and other teams

Communicate proactively when challenges arise

Maintain high standards of professionalism, organization, and punctuality

Manage multiple projects while prioritizing effectively

Support additional projects as assigned



Qualifications



1–2 years of experience in sales or sales support within the promotional products / ad specialty industry

Proficiency in Microsoft Office; experience with Commonsku, HubSpot, and 

Strong customer service mindset and communication skills

Ability to communicate clearly and professionally with vendors, internal teams, and clients

Strong document creation and presentation skills

Ability to operate within structured processes in a fast-paced environment

Excellent organizational, negotiation, and interpersonal skills



You’ll succeed in this role if you are:



C — Committed to Structure

You thrive on organization, timelines, and accountability. Details matter — and you never let them slip.



O — Outcome-Driven

You think strategically about profitability, margins, and differentiation. Every decision has purpose.

title: Senior SEO and Marketing Specialist
description:
Job Summary

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior SEO Specialist to join our dynamic CNSS marketing team. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of search engine optimization strategies and techniques, with a proven track record of driving organic traffic and improving search rankings. This role requires a blend of technical expertise and creative problem-solving skills to enhance our online presence and maximize the effectiveness of our digital marketing efforts.



We USE tracking for all of our employees 



Duties



Develop and implement comprehensive SEO strategies to increase organic search visibility and traffic.

Conduct keyword research to identify high-value opportunities for content creation and optimization.

Analyze website performance using tools such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, and Google Tag Manager to monitor traffic trends and user behavior.

Optimize website content, structure, and on-page elements (including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript) for improved search engine rankings.

Collaborate with the content team to create SEO-friendly content that aligns with business goals and audience needs.

Perform technical SEO audits to identify issues affecting site performance and provide actionable recommendations for improvement.

Stay updated on industry trends, algorithm changes, and best practices in SEO to ensure ongoing optimization efforts are effective.

Manage E-commerce SEO initiatives to enhance product visibility and drive sales through organic search channels.

Utilize Adobe tools for design enhancements that support SEO strategies.

Build high-quality backlinks and improve domain authority

Plan, launch, and manage Google Ads campaigns

Requirements



Proven experience as an SEO Specialist or similar role, with a strong portfolio demonstrating successful projects.

Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and WordPress; familiarity with website development is a plus.

Experience with E-commerce platforms and optimizing product listings for search engines.

In-depth knowledge of Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Google Tag Manager, and other relevant SEO tools.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions.

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams.

A proactive approach to problem-solving with attention to detail.

If you are passionate about SEO and eager to make a significant impact in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

About ProfitWorks USA



For the Skilled. The Driven. The Remote.



At ProfitWorks USA, we believe great talent deserves more than just a gig — it deserves a career path, a community, and a company that truly sees your value. That’s why we don’t work with just any clients, and we don’t accept just any resumes.

Remote-first, global opportunities

Long-term roles with real career paths

Fair pay for serious professionals

A team that has your back

You’re not just hired — you’re handpicked.



About the Role: Senior Accountant



We’re looking for a tech-savvy, detail-obsessed Senior Accountant to support our U.S.-based clients — mainly in the trades and construction industries. You will be the right-hand person for business owners who rely on clean books and meaningful financial reports to drive smart decisions.



This role is ideal for someone with a strong U.S. accounting background, a QBO ProAdvisor certification, and experience managing multiple client accounts. If you love spreadsheets, job costing, and solving problems before they become issues — this is for you.



Key Responsibilities



Client Communication: Manage client relationships via Zoom, chat, and
 — you’ll be the go-to for all things financial.

Full Cycle Accounting: Handle AP/AR, payroll, bank reconciliations, journal entries, sales tax, and advanced month-end close processes.



Reporting & Analysis: Prepare timely and accurate financials, clean balance sheets, and provide actionable insights.

System Optimization: Maintain and improve cloud-based systems like QBO, and propose process improvements.

Construction Accounting (Preferred): Job costing, WIP, deferred revenue, and margin tracking.



You’ll Succeed If You Have:



5+ years of accounting experience

1+ year of US Accounting background

1+ year of QBO experience

QBO ProAdvisor certification (preferred)

Strong understanding of GAAP

Experience working remotely with U.S. clients

Confidence juggling multiple client accounts

Great communication and client service skills

Advanced Excel / Google Sheets skills

Excel / Google Sheets

HubStaff for time tracking (Required)

Other cloud-based accounting tools (as needed)

10–11 Paid Holidays

13th Month Pay (PH)

Paid HMO Plan (PH)

SSS & PhilHealth Contributions (PH)

Paid Training

Career Advancement After Mastery

Performance-based Compensation Opportunities

Why You’ll Love This Role:



100% remote work — from wherever you thrive

Join a client with an incredible team culture and national recognition

Grow your technical skills while making real operational impact

Be a core part of long-term business transformation

Work with a team that values integrity, accountability, and excellence

Job Type: Full-time



Benefits:





Health insurance

Work from home

Work Location: Remote

title: Google Ads Manager
description:
Location: Remote (USA Based Accounts)



Requirements:

Fluent English Speaking

Platform Mastery: 2+ years of hands-on experience in the Google Ads interface (Search, Shopping, and Display).



Status: Full-Time



The Role: Google Ads Account manager

OxBow USA is seeking a critical-thinking, data-driven Google Ads Specialist to own the technical management of 10–15 client accounts.



Unlike traditional agency roles, this is NOT a client-facing position. You will not be on client calls or managing
s with business owners. Instead, you will work directly with our internal Account Managers and Founders to execute high-level strategies, manage budgets, and optimize for results on the Google Ad accounts that OxBow manages for other business'



What You’ll Be Doing:

Full Account Management: Take 100% ownership of the Google Ads interface for 10–15 diverse business accounts. All companies/accounts are part of the Outdoor industry.



Execution & Iteration: Build, launch, and relentlessly optimize Search, Display, and Video campaigns based on internal strategy briefs.



Budget Stewardship: Manage client budgets with extreme precision, ensuring we hit spend targets while maximizing ROI.



Critical Problem Solving: Don't just follow a checklist. Analyze "why" an account is fluctuating and propose technical solutions to fix it.



Internal Collaboration: Participate in weekly internal strategy syncs with OxBow managers to report on performance and plan upcoming technical moves.



Why This Role is Different:

Deep Work Environment: No client interruptions. No frantic "where is my ad?" phone calls. You are here to focus on the numbers and the creative.



Collaborative Support: Our Account Managers handle the "people stuff" and provide you with clear tasks and information from the client.



Training & Onboarding: We provide a 1-month paid training period to get you up to speed on the "OxBow Way" of managing accounts.



Critical Thinker: You look at a high CPC and don't just see a number; you see a landing page friction point or a keyword match-type error.



Budget Conscious: You treat the client's money as your own—maximizing efficiency and preventing waste.



Team-First Communicator: Ability to explain technical ad concepts clearly to internal tea
mbers during weekly calls.



Accountability: You are self-motivated and take pride in "owning" the performance of your assigned cohort of accounts.

description:
We are Electro — a functional electrolyte brand built for athletes. 8,000+ college athlete ambassadors, and we're expanding our product line. We're launching Electro Shots — a large-format electrolyte shot bottle with multiple servings per container — and we need a designer to build the packaging from the ground up. You will have access to some ai generation tools as well for brainstorming.



This isn't a generic supplement bottle. We want something that feels like it belongs next to the most premium sports and wellness brands on the market. Bold. Clean. Built for athletes. Include the word PINK PEACH in your subject line so we can see you read this fully.



What You'll Be Designing:



Full packaging design for a large multi-serving electrolyte shot bottle



Front and back label concepts with multiple variations



Typography, color, and layout that matches the Electro Gum brand identity



The Vibe:



Sports. Tech. Wellness. Think Dose, AG1, Liquid I.V. — premium, modern, and performance-driven. Our brand runs electric blue and black. We want packaging that hits.



Requirements:



Portfolio showing product packaging or label design — this is non-negotiable



Ability to design from scratch based on brand guidelines and reference examples we provide



Clean, modern aesthetic with strong attention to typography and layout



Experience with Illustrator, Photoshop, or similar tools

title: Head of Delivery – Web & Marketing (Remote, Leadership Role)
description:
Immediate Start | Remote | 30–40 Hours per Week



We are hiring a Head of Delivery to take full ownership of our web and multi-channel marketing delivery operations in the fast-moving legal industry.



This is a senior leadership role. You will be responsible for protecting delivery quality, client satisfaction, timelines, and team performance — while freeing the founder from day-to-day operational oversight.



This is not a task management role.

This is an ownership role.



Mission of the Role

Own all client delivery across the organisation and ensure projects are delivered on time, on budget, and at the highest quality — while leading and developing our remote delivery team. You will act as the operational shield between clients and the founder.



Key Responsibilities



1. Delivery Ownership

• Full accountability for all web builds and marketing delivery projects

• Ensure timelines, budgets, and quality standards are consistently met

• Proactively identify risks and resolve them before they escalate

• Protect margin by controlling scope and resourcing



2. Client Leadership

• Primary delivery point of contact for clients

• Lead client calls and provide strategic delivery updates

• Manage expectations and handle difficult conversations professionally

• De-escalate issues independently without founder involvement



3. Team Leadership

• Lead and manage:

 • Delivery Manager

 • Project Coordinators

 • Designers, Developers, Media Buyers, Writers

• Run weekly sprint planning and delivery meetings

• Enforce accountability across the team

• Improve delivery standards and processes



4. Operational Systems

• Oversee Agile sprint management and backlog prioritisation

• Forecast team capacity 30–60 days in advance

• Improve onboarding, QA, and reporting processes

• Build documentation and delivery playbooks



5. Reporting & Performance

• Provide weekly delivery dashboard including:

 • Client health

 • Timeline adherence

 • Capacity utilisation

 • Margin visibility

 • Risks & escalations



You own delivery performance.



Required Experience

• 6+ years managing complex web and digital marketing delivery

• Proven experience leading remote, multi-disciplinary teams

• Experience being the primary client-facing delivery lead

• Strong commercial awareness — understands margin, scope control, and resource allocation

• Comfortable pushing back on clients when required



Technical Literacy (Essential)

You must understand how digital systems work under the hood, including:

• Website architecture, CMS, hosting, APIs, integrations

• QA processes, staging vs production environments

• Deployment workflows and troubleshooting

• Paid ads funnels, tracking pixels, CRM workflows

• Multi-channel marketing systems



You do not need to code — but you must understand the mechanics.



Tools

• Asana / Jira / Trello / similar PM systems

• Slack / Zoom

• CRM & marketing automation platforms

• Reporting dashboards



Remote Leadership Requirements

• Excellent written and spoken English

• Confident leading calls with senior stakeholders

• Proven track record leading distributed teams across time zones



Ideal Candidate Profile



You are:

• Calm under pressure

• Highly accountable

• Decisive

• Commercially aware

• Process-driven

• Not afraid to have difficult conversations

• Comfortable taking ownership



You are someone who thrives in responsibility.



Why Join Us

• High-impact, fast-growth environment

• Opportunity to build and lead a delivery division

• Work at the intersection of marketing, technology, and legal sectors.

• Long-term growth and leadership progression



Compensation

• Competitive hourly rate based on experience

• 30–40 hours per week

• Long-term opportunity for leadership expansion



How to Apply



Please send:

• Your CV (PDF format)

• A short note explaining why you are suited for a Head of Delivery role

• (Optional) 1-minute Loom video introducing yourself



Applications that do not follow instructions will not progress.



References

We conduct reference checks for all tea
mbers prior to hiring.

ad check-ins + notes



task completion + deadlines

title: Vector Graphic Designer - Position 5
description:
About Us

HouseSensationsArt specializes in creating high-quality, custo
tal signs for homes, businesses, and special events. With over 30 years of experience in sign manufacturing and metal fabrication, we pride ourselves on craftsmanship, attention to detail, and exceptional customer service. We sell across multiple e-commerce platforms and require multiple graphic designers for product development, social media, customer service- providing mockups and fulfillment of orders, and website product development.



We are seeking a versatile Graphic Designer with proven experience in custom laser-cut metal sign design and Amazon A+ content creation to join our Philippines-based design team on a project-based or ongoing basis.  You will join our team of 10+ in-house designers 

You must be able to design and create an original design that is ready for laser cutting, and then create the product images for Etsy, Shopify, and Amazon. All mockups and product images must be life-like and realistic.



MUST be able to create joined VECTOR LINE ART

Convert raster to vector images, understand color theory, create lifestyle scenes, photo-real product images to a lifestyle background, create A+ content, and social posts. -



Please send examples of your work. EXAMPLES are required for the interview.



Key Responsibilities

• Create to-scale, life-like product listing images for custom indoor and outdoor metal signs.

• Design vector-ready artwork for laser cutting, ensuring precision and manufacturability.

• Completing customer orders using a templated vectorized dxf file.

• Develop Amazon A+ content layouts that effectively showcase product features, benefits, and lifestyle applications.

• Work with product dimensions, color swatches, and textures to produce accurate, visually appealing mockups.

• Collaborate with marketing and production teams to maintain brand consistency.

• Optimize product listing images for Etsy, Amazon, Shopify, and other e-commerce platforms.





Qualifications

• Proven experience designing custom laser-cut metal signs or similar vector-based manufacturing products.

• Proficiency in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, and vector graphic creation.

• Knowledge of Amazon A+ Content guidelines and best practices.

• Ability to create realistic product renderings with correct scale, proportion, and color representation.

• Strong attention to detail and excellent time management skills.

• Experience with e-commerce product photography/mockups (preferred).





Preferred Skills

• Experience in visualizing powder-coated finishes, textures, and multiple color variations.

• Familiarity with Etsy, Shopify, and Amazon Seller Central image requirements.

• Understanding of manufacturing tolerances for laser cutting and metal fabrication.





Contract Details

title: Accounts Receivable
description:
The Legal Services Billing & Accounts Receivable (A/R) Specialist plays a critical role in ensuring the financial integrity and operational efficiency of the law firm. This position is responsible for managing the full billing cycle, including time-entry quality control, monthly invoicing, payment processing, collections, trust-account compliance, and financial reporting.

The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, highly organized, comfortable speaking with clients about billing matters, and accustomed to working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven legal environment. They must maintain strict confidentiality, demonstrate impeccable professionalism, and uphold the firm’s core values of accuracy, accountability, and client-focused service.

Key Responsibilities

Billing & Invoicing

• Prepare, review, and finalize bi-weekly invoices for all practice areas in compliance with firm policies.

• Verify time entries for accuracy, completeness, and compliance with billing guidelines.

• Track flat-fee, hourly, contingency, subscription, and hybrid retainer billing structures.

• Monitor evergreen retainers and initiate replenishment requests as required.

• Coordinate invoice revisions, adjustments, and write-offs with attorneys and the Firm Administrator.

• Generate and distribute invoices and billing documentation to the firm’s case-management system.

Accounts Receivable Management

• Monitor outstanding balances and manage the firm’s A/R aging report.

• Document and organize clients’ past-due balances in a spreadsheet for efficient out reach for payment.

• Monitor payment plans, subscription retainers, and automated payment arrangements.

• Post payments accurately and timely across all payment platforms (credit card, e-checks, wire, cash, etc.).

• Maintain accurate client financial records and document all communication in the case-management system.

Trust Account & Compliance

• Process and track retainers and advance fee deposits in accordance with State Bar trust accounting requirements.

• Reconcile trust accounts monthly in collaboration with the Firm Administrator.

• Ensure proper application of funds to invoices and avoid overdrafts, commingling, or misapplication of funds.

• Maintain meticulous audit-ready account documentation.

Client Communication & Support

• Respond promptly and professionally to client billing inquiries.

• Assist clients in understanding invoices, charges, and firm financial policies.

• Coordinate with attorneys to resolve disputes or billing discrepancies.

Reporting & Internal Collaboration

• Generate weekly, monthly, and quarterly billing and A/R performance reports.

• Track KPIs related to billable hours, collections, write-offs, and revenue targets.

• Work collaboratively with intake, paralegals, and attorneys to ensure timekeeping accuracy and billing efficiency.

• Recommend improvements to billing workflow, technology, and policy updates.

Qualifications

Required

• 2+ years of experience in law-firm billing, legal accounting, or legal operations.

• Strong understanding of law-firm billing concepts, including retainer structures and trust-accounting rules.

• Proficiency in legal billing or practice-management platforms (e.g., MyCase, Clio, PracticePanther, CosmoLex, etc.).

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

• High level of accuracy, organization, and attention to detail.

• Ability to maintain confidentiality of sensitive financial and client information.

Preferred

• Experience with Georgia State Bar trust-accounting rules and legal-industry billing standards.

• Familiarity with family-law billing structures, litigation cost tracking, and expert/witness billing.

• Prior experience handling high-volume billing in a fast-paced legal office.

• Intermediate to advanced skills in Microsoft Excel or financial reporting tools.

Key Competencies

• Accuracy & Attention to Detail – Maintains error-free financial records.

• Professionalism – Communicates with clients clearly and respectfully.

• Problem Solving – Quickly resolves billing discrepancies and identifies workflow improvements.

• Confidentiality – Maintains strict compliance with ethical standards.

• Time Management – Meets all billing and financial reporting deadlines.

• Team Collaboration – Works effectively with attorneys, intake staff, paralegals, and admin staff.

Physical & Schedule Requirements

• Ability to work during standard business hours, with some flexibility during billing cycles.

• Extended periods of computer use and data entry.

title: Legal Assistant
description:
Seeking a Legal Assistant

We are an entrepreneurial family law and property litigation firm that is on track for aggressive growth and we need an experienced legal assistant to join our team and work directly with the owner, attorneys and other staff members to support the team and help our clients.

We want to be known for helping our clients come out of an extremely emotional process feeling as though they are a better person, in a better position, and that they had a team behind them that really cared and fought for them. We are growing fast, and we need an attorney who can hit the ground running.

This position will be responsible for important work, including:



· Maintain Attorneys’ calendars;

· Calendar court, discovery and filing deadlines;

· Draft
s and correspondences to clients, court personnel and 3rd parties;

· Review, file and respond to
s and facsimiles daily;

· Maintain electronic client files in MyCase;

· Monitor and assist with workflows;

· Assist in drafting and filing of routine pleadings such as Notices of Appearance, Notices

of Leaves of Absence;

Conduct electronic filing of Court documents;

· Assist with Motion assembly

· Document management

· Small tasks on an as-needed basis



If these statements appeal to you, then you may be our Legal Assistant:

- You smile when you answer the phone

- You are an amazing scheduler with a sickening degree of attention to detail

- You are very good with calendars, e-mail, spreadsheets, word processing, and the internet

- Your middle name is “No Drama”

- You are an awesome juggler of tasks and can change gears quickly

- You are a problem solver and a solution seeker

- You care about making am impactful and positive difference in the lives of others



 The ideal candidate will be able to take initiative on work that needs to be done and complete tasks with minimal hand-holding.



Prepare a cover letter with no more than TWO paragraphs and a closing sentence. In the first paragraph explain what you believe are the 3 most important qualities needed in someone who works with family law clients and why you believe they are the most important qualities. In the second paragraph, explain why you applied to this particular employment opportunity.



Do not send your resume through this website.
 your resume and cover letter in PDF format to

[For example: SMITH paralegal AWESOME] We look forward to reviewing your application. ad. As a closing sentence please write, “I have read the instructions contained in the job posting and have followed the instructions.”

title: AI & Technology Implementation Specialist
description:
We are seeking a highly capable AI and Technology Implementation Specialist to support the buildout and optimization of our internal technology stack across capital raising and investor relations initiatives.



This role is responsible for evaluating, implementing, integrating, and maintaining modern tools across CRM, marketing automation, investor management platforms, AI-driven workflows, and data enrichment systems used in real estate private equity fundraising environments.



You will work closely with leadership to operationalize investor acquisition, nurture, and conversion strategies through scalable technology infrastructure. The ideal candidate has both strategic awareness and hands-on execution ability within platforms commonly used by investment sponsors, fund managers, and capital raising teams.



This role will begin on a part-time basis with the opportunity to transition into full-time as responsibilities scale.



Key Responsibilities

Implement and maintain CRM infrastructure across platforms such as HubSpot

Build automation workflows for investor nurture and deal launch campaigns

Integrate tools across marketing, investor portals, and communication platforms

Evaluate and deploy AI tools to improve operational efficiency and lead qualification

Support data enrichment initiatives across investor databases



Manage integrations across systems such as:

HubSpot

InvestNext or Juniper Square

Zapier or Make

Clay or enrichment platforms

 and SMS marketing tools

Calendar and scheduling systems

Create reporting dashboards for capital raise performance and funnel metrics

Optimize campaign tracking across outbound and inbound investor channels

Troubleshoot system errors and maintain documentation of workflows

Recommend and implement new tools aligned with capital raising objectives



Required Qualifications

5+ years of experience in CRM, marketing automation, or technology implementation

Experience working with AI tools or automation platforms in business workflows

Strong familiarity with HubSpot or comparable CRM systems

Experience integrating APIs and managing workflow automation

Background in financial services, private equity, real estate, or capital raising environments preferred

Proficiency in data enrichment tools and database hygiene practices

Ability to translate strategic marketing and fundraising needs into technical solutions



Preferred Qualifications

Experience supporting investor relations or fundraising teams

Familiarity with syndication or fund management software

Experience building dashboards tied to KPIs such as Cost per Accredited Lead or conversion metrics

Working knowledge of outbound call or appointment-setting infrastructure

Growth Opportunity



This role is expected to expand into full-time as our capital raising operations scale across multiple funds and client engagements throughout 2026.

About Us

Our Remote Team & Culture

If you deliver on time with the quality we expect, this leads directly to:



Weekly recurring work — 1 video/week, every week

Multiple videos/week as we scale

Long-term contract with rate increases

We are not looking for a one-time editor. We are looking for a long-term production partner.

If you anticipate any issue, you must notify us in writing at least 24 hours before the deadline with a specific reason. This is non-negotiable.

Your current weekly availability (hours per week)

title: After-Hours Dispatcher
description:
The After-Hours Dispatcher is a full-time operations role responsible for managing all emergency and urgent service requests outside of standard business hours. This position serves as the primary point of contact during evenings, nights, weekends, and holidays, ensuring rapid response, accurate triage, and seamless coordination between clients, technicians, vendors, and internal leadership. This role is critical to service continuity, client satisfaction, and risk mitigation. The ideal candidates are calm under pressure, highly organized, and capable of making sound decisions in time-sensitive and high-impact situations.



Key Responsibilities:

After-Hours Call Intake & Triage

- Answer and manage all after-hours incoming calls,
s, and service alerts.

- Evaluate and classify service requests using established emergency and escalation protocols.

- Determine appropriate response level based on safety, property damage risk, and service urgency.



Dispatch & Operations Coordination

- Dispatch on-call technicians, vendors, and emergency services as required.

- Coordinate response efforts across multiple regions and service lines.

- Track response progress and confirm arrival, completion, and resolution status.



Client & Resident Communication

- Communicate professionally, calmly, and empathetically with clients, residents, and property managers.

- Provide clear expectations regarding response timelines and next steps.

- De-escalate tense situations and maintain a professional company image at all times.



Escalation & I
 Management

- Escalate critical i
 to Operations Management per company guidelines.

- Notify leadership of safety concerns, major property damage, repeat issues, or liability risks.

- Support emergency response coordination and documentation for insurance or compliance needs.



Documentation & Handoff

- Accurately document all calls, dispatch actions, and outcomes in the company’s work order or dispatch system.

- Prepare detailed shift notes and handoff reports for daytime operations teams.

- Ensure continuity of service by flagging follow-up actions and unresolved items.



Policy & Process Compliance

- Adhere to company policies, escalation procedures, and after-hours protocols.

- Maintain confidentiality of sensitive client, employee, and operational information.

- Identify process gaps and provide feedback to improve after-hours operations.



Required Qualifications

- High school diploma or equivalent (Associate’s degree or higher preferred).

- 2+ years of experience in dispatch, operations coordination, customer service, or emergency response.

- Strong verbal and written communication skills.

- Ability to remain calm, decisive, and professional under pressure.

- High attention to detail and strong organizational skills.

- Proficiency with dispatch software, CRM/work order systems, and basic office technology.



Preferred Qualifications

- Experience in maintenance, construction, restoration, utilities, or property management.

- Familiarity with HOA, multifamily, or commercial environments.

- Experience working overnight or after-hours operational shifts.

- Understanding of emergency response and escalation protocols.



Schedule & Availability

- Full-time after-hours schedule, including evenings, overnight shifts, weekends, and holidays.

- Schedule may be fixed or rotating based on operational needs.

- Reliable attendance and punctuality are essential for this role.



Key Competencies

- Crisis management and decision-making

- Clear, empathetic communication

- Multitasking and prioritization

- Professional judgment

- Accountability and reliability



Performance Metrics

- Call response time and resolution accuracy

- Proper dispatch and escalation compliance

- Documentation accuracy and completeness

- Client satisfaction and professionalism

- Effective shift handoff and follow-up tracking



Physical & Technical Requirements

- Ability to sit and work at a computer for extended periods.

- Reliable access to phone, computer, and internet.

- Ability to operate dispatch systems and company software efficiently.



Working Conditions:

- This is a fully remote position — work from anywhere.

- Must be available to work at any US time zone during business hours, Monday – Friday.

- Use of Hubstaff time-tracking software is required during working hours.



How to apply:

1. Send an
 attachment with your updated resume in PDF format.

2. Please send a link to your video recording introducing yourself and your relevant experience based on the job description.

3. Kindly send your application to 
 the subject line, kindly indicate the position Sales Development Representative - your name.



Shortlisted applicants will be contacted by
 for interview scheduling.

Looking forward to working with you!

title: E-Commerce Growth Executor (Shopify / Klaviyo)
description:
We're an e-commerce consulting agency that helps online brands grow their revenue. 



We need someone who can execute marketing and conversion optimization tasks across our client accounts. You won't be building strategy. Our team handles that. You also won't be starting from scratch on most tasks. We use AI tools to draft copy, generate code snippets, and create step-by-step implementation plans. 



Your job is to take those plans, execute them in the platform (Shopify or Klaviyo), QA the work, and make sure everything is correct before it goes live.



Think of it this way: you'll get a detailed set of instructions that says "here's exactly what to change, here's the code, here's where it goes." You follow those instructions, verify everything looks right on desktop and mobile, and flag anything that seems off.



The work spans two main platforms:



Shopify (about 60% of the work):



Editing product pages: updating headlines, images, benefit copy, and section ordering in the theme editor

Homepage layout changes: reordering sections, updating hero banners, simplifying navigation

Setting up bundles, quantity breaks, and discount codes

Configuring apps like post-purchase upsell tools, lead capture popups, and heatmap tracking

Checkout optimizations: enabling express pay options, adjusting form fields, adding trust badges

Building landing pages using page builder tools or theme sections

Making small Liquid/HTML edits in the theme editor when given the exact code to paste

Price and shipping threshold updates

QA-ing all changes on mobile and desktop before anything goes live



Klaviyo (about 40% of the work):



Reviewing and QA-ing
 templates that our AI tools have drafted (checking links, images, mobile rendering, copy accuracy)

Wiring
 flows in Klaviyo (abandoned checkout, welcome series, post-purchase, winback): connecting templates to triggers and setting timing

Setting up campaigns and scheduling sends

Entering weekly performance metrics into our tracking system

Basic list hygiene and segment management



What we're looking for:



Real experience working inside Shopify admin and the theme editor. You know where things are and you're not afraid to make changes.



Hands-on experience with Klaviyo (building flows, creating campaigns, working with templates)

Comfortable following detailed written instructions to make changes you haven't done before

Strong attention to detail. 



You're the last check before changes go live to real customers paying real money.

Comfortable with basic HTML/CSS. You don't need to write code from scratch, but you should be able to paste a code snippet into the right place and understand what it's doing.



Reliable communication and follow-through. We work async and need to trust that tasks get done on schedule.



Nice to have but not required:



Experience with Shopify apps (Rebuy, Privy, 
, 
, 
, Intelligems, Zipify)

Experience with Google Analytics or Meta Ads Manager

Experience with page builders (Shogun, GemPages, or similar)



This is a full-time role, approximately 40 hours per week. You'll work directly with the founder and have real ownership over quality control across all client accounts. This role grows with us: more responsibility, more autonomy, and the opportunity to lead a small QA team.



We use Slack for communication and have a custom project tracker where you'll manage your task queue. Every task comes with clear context and step-by-step instructions. Training will be provided on our specific workflows.

title: Inbound Phone Virtual Assistant (Night Shift) – Call Screening & Lead Preparation
description:
About Us

We are a California-based drywall contractor specializing in small repairs and remodels, and we are looking for a reliable Virtual Assistant to manage inbound calls and prepare clean, organized leads for our team.



You will be the first point of contact for callers. Your role is to protect our operations from constant phone interruptions and ensure leads are clean and complete before we step in.



This is a long-term position for the right person.



Schedule

- Monday–Friday

- 8:00 AM – 4:00 PM Pacific Time (USA)

- Night shift in the Philippines

- Peak call volume is typically between 9:00 AM – 2:00 PM Pacific Time.



Some hours may be slower. That is expected.

You must remain:

- Logged in

- Available

- Attentive

- Ready to answer calls immediately

- We care about availability and responsiveness during scheduled hours.



Responsibilities

- Answer inbound phone calls professionally

- Manage calls using Quo (formerly OpenPhone)

- Identify caller type (spam, telemarketer, vendor, existing customer, new lead)

- Politely end telemarketing calls quickly

- Send intake form link via text when needed



Collect required information:

- Full name

- Phone number

- Property address

- Type of drywall work

- Timeline / urgency

- How they found us



Follow up with leads who promise to send photos but do not

- Use a three-follow-up system before closing inactive leads

- Escalate urgent or demanding callers to owner/project manager

- Provide a structured daily summary report via Slack

- Your job is to “gift wrap” leads so the owner or project manager can take the next step efficiently.



Required Skills

- Clear, neutral, and easily understandable spoken English suitable for U.S. customers

- Confident and professional phone presence

- Prior experience in call center, receptionist, or phone-based customer service

- Comfortable using Slack for daily communication

- Comfortable learning and using call software (Quo)

- Reliable internet connection and quiet workspace

- Detail-oriented and able to follow structured processes

- Comfortable ending spam/telemarketing calls quickly

- A large portion of calls will not be real customers. You must be comfortable identifying and ending non-legitimate calls efficiently.



Tools You Will Use

- Quo (formerly OpenPhone) – shared team access

- Slack – required for all communication

- Google Workspace / Google Drive

- Access will be provided after hiring.



What This Role Is NOT

- No pricing

- No scheduling

- No sales

- No job estimates

- No financial access

- No decision-making authority

- You are responsible for intake, follow-up, and preparation only.



Compensation

- $5–$6 USD per hour depending on phone experience

- Paid weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly (applicant preference)

- First 7–10 working days are a paid trial period

- Long-term opportunity for strong performance



To Apply (Required)

Please include:

- A short introduction

- Description of your phone or call-center experience

- Confirmation that you can work 8:00 AM – 4:00 PM Pacific Time

- Your internet speed

- A 1–2 minute voice recording introducing yourself



** Applications without a voice recording will not be reviewed. **

title: Virtual Assistant - Content/AI/GoHighLevel/Canva
description:
Virtual Assistant (VA) – Operations, Content & Client Support



Company: Think Lean

Type: Full Time

Reports to: Founder / Lead Strategist



About Think Lean



Think Lean is a consulting and implementation business that helps solopreneurs, coaches, and small teams turn chaos into clarity using strategy, content systems, and AI-powered automation. We focus on audits, growth systems, LinkedIn visibility, funnels, and backend operations using tools like Go High Level, ClickUp, LinkedIn, Loom, and Google Workspace.



This role supports execution, organization, and follow-through so strategy can move faster.



Role Overview



The Virtual Assistant will support day-to-day operations, client delivery support, content coordination, and systems organization. This role is not about strategy or decision-making. It is about keeping things organized, moving, documented, and executed cleanly.



You will work closely with the founder to help manage clients, content workflows, and internal systems.



Core Responsibilities

1. Client Support & Delivery Assistance



Set up and organize new clients in ClickUp and Go High Level



Prepare client folders, documents, and internal checklists



Track client deliverables across offers (Audit, Growth Sprint, Growth Engine, Partnership)



Upload Looms, PDFs, reports, and content into the correct client folders



Maintain clear status updates on client projects



Help prepare onboarding materials and questionnaires



Monitor client request tickets or messages and flag priorities



2. Content & Marketing Support



Schedule LinkedIn posts and other content as directed



Format and upload content (posts, carousels, newsletters, blogs)



Organize content calendars in ClickUp



Repurpose content using provided instructions (post ? carousel ?
)



Upload assets to Canva, Google Drive, or Go High Level



Track content performance basics if requested (posting consistency, links live)



3. Systems & Tools Management



Keep ClickUp organized (tasks, due dates, folders, templates)



Support Go High Level workflows (pipelines, tags, notes, basic automations)



Update CRM records and pipeline stages



Maintain internal SOPs and documentation as processes evolve



Help test automations and forms before client delivery



Organize templates, assets, and files so everything is easy to find



4. Admin & Founder Support



Manage inbox organization and flag important messages



Schedule calls and manage calendars if needed



Prepare documents, proposals, and internal summaries



Follow up on tasks, deadlines, and open loops



Assist with light research when requested



Tools You Will Use



ClickUp



Go High Level



Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive)



Canva



Loom



LinkedIn (and scheduling tools)



HeyReach or LinkedIn automation tools (support only, no strategy)



Ideal Candidate



Highly organized and detail-oriented



Comfortable with tech and learning new tools quickly



Clear communicator and proactive with updates



Able to follow systems and instructions precisely



Understands content workflows and online business basics



Not afraid to ask questions but does not need constant supervision



Enjoys structure, checklists, and clean systems



Bonus if you have experience with:



Go High Level



ClickUp



Content scheduling



Online coaching or consulting businesses



What This Role Is Not



Not a strategist or decision-maker



Not client-facing sales

Python handler



Container setup

Ensure reliable base model loading

Worker stability



Startup time

Setup guide



Maintenance runbook

Serverless endpoints



Network Volumes



Async jobs / webhooks

title: Administrative & Project Support
description:
We are seeking a highly capable Administrative & Project Support Virtual Assistant to take ownership of execution-heavy, detail-oriented tasks so leadership can stay focused on high-value work. The top priority of this role is administrative excellence — someone who thrives on organization, polish, deadlines, and follow-through. This VA will manage post-meeting action items, prepare and format documents, coordinate agreements, and ensure projects move forward without bottlenecks. Secondary responsibilities include grant proposal support, WordPress updates, and light social media execution, including LinkedIn and Canva-based assets. If you love turning messy notes into clean deliverables and making sure nothing falls through the cracks, this role is for you.



Primary Responsibilities:



1. Administrative & Executive Support (Top Priority)



* Draft, format, and finalize consulting agreements

* Send agreements to consultants and track signatures

* Write and refine scopes of work based on client conversations

* Update and polish documents (formatting, fonts, layout, consistency)

* Prepare professional, client-ready deliverables

* Handle scheduling, follow-ups, and
 coordination

* Take ownership of post-meeting task lists and execution



2. Project & Task Management



* Track action items coming out of meetings

* Manage deadlines and ensure deliverables are completed on time

* Coordinate tasks across multiple projects

* Maintain clarity on “what’s next” and “who owns what”

* Follow up persistently and professionally until tasks are complete



3. Grant Proposal Support



* Assist with assembling grant proposals

* Organize supporting documents and attachments

* Ensure formatting, details, and compliance requirements are met

* Maintain accuracy, consistency, and attention to detail throughout



4. Website & Content Support



* Post blog content to LinkedIn

* Upload and format blog posts in WordPress

* Ensure content formatting, spacing, and visuals are clean and aligned

* Coordinate basic content updates as needed



5. Light Social Media & Design Support



* Assist with social media posting and scheduling

* Support basic content formatting and organization

* Create or update simple graphics using Canva

* Maintain brand consistency across visuals and posts





Required Skills & Experience:

* Strong administrative and executive support experience

* Excellent document creation, formatting, and polishing skills

* Experience drafting or managing agreements and scopes of work

* Project and task management experience

* Highly detail-oriented with strong follow-through

* Excellent written English communication

* Comfortable managing multiple deadlines at once

* WordPress experience

* Canva experience

* Organized, proactive, and dependable



Preferred (Nice-to-Have) Skills:

* Experience supporting consulting or advisory firms

* Grant proposal experience

* Social media scheduling tools experience

* Familiarity with LinkedIn content workflows



Communication & Work Style Expectations:

* Clear, professional written communication

* Proactive updates on task status and deadlines

* Ability to work independently once expectations are clear

* Comfortable asking clarifying questions early

* Strong sense of ownership and accountability



To fast track your application, please submit the following information:

Resume: A link to your Google Drive. Please ensure the sharing setting is set to "Anyone with the link."



IMPORTANT REMINDER: To advance in the screening process, you must submit the Podio Form. Timely completion is essential to guarantee your application receives prompt attention.

/webforms/
