title: Dispatcher for HVAC and Plumbing company
description:
Company: Addario’s Services



Location: Remote (Must work EST hours)



Position Type: Full-Time (1st or 2nd Shift Available)



Role Overview



Addario’s Services is seeking a second high-level Remote Dispatcher to act as the primary "Air Traffic Controller" for our field operations. This role goes beyond answering phones; you are responsible for the strategic management of our technician board to maximize revenue and minimize waste. You will be expected to own the schedule and make real-time decisions that impact the company's bottom line.



Key Responsibilities (Scope of Services)



Strategic Schedule Management: Optimize the daily dispatch board to ensure zero downtime for field technicians and maximum productivity.



Route Optimization: Strategically assign jobs based on technician location to minimize "windshield time" and fuel costs.



Technician Coordination: Serve as the primary point of contact for field crews regarding job details, arrival times, and operational roadblocks.



Capacity Planning: Proactively monitor the upcoming week’s schedule to identify gaps and work with the team to fill them.



Emergency Dispatch: Re-prioritize the board in real-time to handle urgent "no-water/no-heat" emergencies effectively.



Data Integrity & CRM Management: Ensure all job statuses, notes, and timestamps are accurately reflected in ServiceTitan and GoHighLevel.



Fee Enforcement: Ensure Emergency Fees are correctly applied and enforced according to company policy.



Emergency Activation: Manage the activation of emergency and back-up technicians when demand spikes.



Requirements & Qualifications

ServiceTitan Mastery (Required): You must have advanced, hands-on experience navigating the ServiceTitan dispatch board, alerts, and job flows.



HVAC/Plumbing Knowledge: Prior experience in the trades is highly sought after. You must understand the urgency and technical requirements of service calls.



High-Speed Decision Making: Ability to re-route a dozen trucks on the fly when an emergency call comes in.



EST Schedule: Ability to work shifts aligned with New England business hours (First or Second shift).



Communication: Exceptional English verbal and written communication skills to maintain high technician morale and client experience.



How Success is Measured (KPIs)

Your performance will be directly tied to the following metrics:



Revenue Capture: Maximizing the daily billing potential of the board.



Time and Truck Efficiency: Reducing idle time and unnecessary travel.



Client Experience: Ensuring promised arrival windows are met.



Technician Morale: Efficiently managing tech workloads to prevent burnout.



Job Process Accuracy: Ensuring every job is closed and documented correctly.



Emergency Fee Enforcement: Maintaining consistency in emergency pricing.

title: Virtual Purchasing Assistant – HVAC & Plumbing (Remote/Philippines Based)
description:
Virtual Purchasing Assistant – HVAC & Plumbing (Remote/Philippines Based)

Company: Addario's Services Location: Remote (Eastern Massachusetts, USA Focus) Hours: Full-time, 7:00 AM – 5:00 PM EST, Monday – Friday



Addario's Services, a leading plumbing, heating, and cooling company serving Eastern Massachusetts, is seeking a highly organized and proactive Virtual Purchasing Assistant to join our team. This critical role will directly support our Shop Manager and Vice President by managing and executing all necessary procurement activities, freeing up our leadership to focus on strategic growth.



The ideal candidate possesses a strong background in HVAC and/or plumbing systems, excellent English communication skills, and proven experience in vendor relations and price negotiation.



Key Responsibilities

Purchase Order Management: Execute daily purchase orders for HVAC systems, plumbing parts, components, and miscellaneous equipment as directed by the Shop Manager and VP.



Supplier Relations & Execution: Place orders with specified, established supply houses and heating suppliers based on pre-approved forms and instructions.



Price Negotiation & Sourcing: Proactively contact local Massachusetts-based supply houses, heating suppliers, and distributors to research, compare prices, and negotiate favorable terms for commonly used materials, parts, and tools.



Vendor Vetting: Identify, contact, and vet potential reputable vendors to ensure competitive pricing and reliable supply chains.



Administrative Support: Maintain meticulous records of all transactions, orders, quotes, and delivery statuses to ensure accurate inventory and job costing.



Coordination: Act as the primary communication link between our management team and various suppliers to resolve discrepancies, track orders, and confirm delivery timelines.



Qualifications and Experience

Industry Knowledge (Required): Prior professional knowledge or experience within the HVAC and/or Plumbing industry is highly preferred.



Language Proficiency (Required): Must be fluent in both written and spoken English.



Purchasing Experience: Proven experience in purchasing, procurement, or vendor management, ideally within a technical trade or construction setting.



Negotiation Skills: Demonstrated ability to negotiate pricing, terms, and delivery schedules to secure cost savings for the company.



Availability: Must be able to work the full-time schedule of 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM Eastern Standard Time (EST).



Work Ethic: Highly organized, results-oriented, and capable of managing multiple priorities under minimal supervision.



Communication: Exceptional verbal and telephone communication skills for daily interaction with US-based suppliers.



How to Apply

Interested and qualified candidates are invited to submit their resume and/or a brief summary of their relevant work experience for immediate consideration.

title: PHONE EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT (Sales Focused) [REMOTE]
description:
YOU (THE CANDIDATE):

You are the kind of woman who treats your work like it's your business. You thrive in a role where communication, intelligence, and quick thinking matter every single day. You excel at verbal communication in English, think quickly under pressure (including in an interview), and you have a natural sales mentality — you feel confident encouraging tenants to sign or renew a lease without needing scripts or hand-holding, even if you are new to property management. You are thrilled by the idea of a lifetime job opportunity instead of applying for 100 new jobs every 6 months. 



Read these carefully - if this sounds like you, you’re who we want:



• You love speaking with people - idea of encouraging tenants to renew their lease or confidently talking with new applicants about why they should choose our homes actually energizes you.

• You’re calm, patient, and solution-focused under pressure - when you receive calls about issues, your natural instinct is to resolve, not get flustered.

• You speak exceptional English with a clear voice and minimal accent - the kind that U.S.-based callers can easily understand on the phone.

• You are resourceful and skilled at problem solving, able to think on your feet, and naturally good at handling unexpected or challenging situations.

• You consider yourself highly intelligent - the type of person others rely on when something tricky needs solving.

• You have prior work-from-home experience and know how to manage yourself independently.

• You have a proven history of staying with past employers (ideally 2 years or more).

• You want stable, long-term, full-time employment and value security over chasing short-term high pay that disappears.

If this is you authentically - not aspirationally - we want to meet you (even if you haven’t worked in Property Management before).

_____________________________



US (THE COMPANY):

• We are a U.S. based long-term rental property company - not Airbnb, not short-term rentals.

• We currently manage 100+ houses and are growing quickly.

• We expect to reach another 100–200 homes in the next two years.

• We value ladies who want long-term stability with us - 10 years, not 10 months.

_____________________________



COMMITMENT FROM YOU:

 • Full-time (40 hours/week)

 • Availability: Monday–Friday, 7 AM–7 PM Pacific Time | Active working hours occur within that window

title: Cold Calling Sales Closer
description:
We are growing our dog accessories division by bringing handcrafted Maasai leather beaded collars to pet lovers and retailers around the world. These collars are made by skilled Maasai artisans in Kenya, combining cultural heritage, premium leather and durable, water-resistant construction. The result is a unique, story-driven product that helps stores stand out and delight their customers.



As a Cold Calling Sales Closer, you own the entire sales cycle on the phone: from first contact with qualified leads to closing initial orders and repeat purchases. You will speak directly with pet retailers, groomers, boarding facilities and importers, present our product, handle objections and secure sales. Your income grows with your results through a monthly salary plus a commission-based structure.



What you will do

- Filter & Call qualified leads from our database and introduce our products.

- Identify quickly if the prospect is a retailer, groomer, boarding facility, vet clinic or importer, and adapt your pitch.

- Present the product clearly: benefits, premium look and in-store positioning.

- Ask targeted questions to understand their business.

- Handle objections and turn them into opportunities.

- Close sales directly on the call.

- Follow up with warm prospects and turn interest into paid orders.

- Keep accurate notes in the CRM so nothing falls through the cracks.

- Share patterns and feedback with the team to improve scripts, offers and targeting.



We’re not looking for someone who

- Only books meetings and avoids asking for the order.

- Is uncomfortable discussing price or negotiating on the phone.

- Needs a large fixed salary and dislikes performance-based pay.

- Reads scripts word-for-word without listening or adapting.

- Avoids high outbound activity or takes rejection personally.



What’s in it for you

High earning potential through a commission-based model with uncapped upside.

A differentiated, easy-to-love product with a real story behind it.

Direct, visible impact on company growth with clear revenue attribution.

Remote-friendly setup and flexibility to organize your calling blocks.

Growth opportunities into Senior Closer, Key Account or Sales Team Lead.

Preferred experience



Must have

1–3+ years of experience in phone-based sales (telesales, outbound closing, SDR/BDR with closing responsibilities, etc.).

Proven track record of selling directly on calls, not just setting appointments.

Strong bias for action and comfort with daily activity and revenue targets.

Excellent spoken English and a clear, confident phone presence.

Strong listening and objection-handling skills; you are comfortable asking for the sale.

Comfortable with a fixed salary plus commission-based or commission-heavy pay structures.

Resilience, persistence and a genuine growth mindset.

Experience selling to small businesses in the pet industry (retailers, groomers, vet clinics, distributors).

High tech literacy with sales tools and AI assistants.

Background in sales, customer service or operations where you owned a target.

Reference check.

Offer.

title: Real Estate Assistant
description:
Who We Need



Are you an ethical, reliable, and committed person who shows up on time every day with a positive attitude and a real willingness to learn? If you can be fully present from 9:30am to 6:00pm EST, Monday to Saturday, with a proper 30 minute break each day, I can teach you everything you need to succeed in this role.



You will be taking over from a long term assistant, so you must be comfortable learning existing systems and working closely with my real estate partners, vendors, and technology tools. You must have your own reliable laptop and fast, stable internet, and you cannot have other jobs, classes, or commitments during our working hours so you can stay fully focused on this role.



I am a real estate broker in Canada looking for a long term Real Estate & Marketing Assistant to support transactions, listings, clients, and social media. I’m a respectful, polite boss who values honesty and communication, and I genuinely enjoy helping my team grow their skills and confidence over time.





What You’ll Do



- Prepare, review, and organize contracts, agreements, and disclosures, and track all condition deadlines (financing, inspection, status certificates, etc.).  

- Assist with offers, amendments, and notices of fulfillment, and ensure all documents are properly signed and stored.  

- Coordinate with clients, lawyers, lenders, and agents to help ensure smooth closings, and run market analyses and comparables when needed.  

- Schedule showings and inspections, answer client inquiries, provide updates, and keep the CRM and databases organized and up to date.  

- Set up MLS property searches, help qualify tenants for landlords, and qualify listings for buyer clients.  

- List properties for lease and sale on MLS and other platforms, prepare and post property details and descriptions, and coordinate photography, staging, and virtual tours.  

- Create and manage social media posts, flyers, newsletters, and promotional materials, and help manage campaigns across
, Instagram, LinkedIn, and YouTube.  

- Maintain client engagement through digital channels and help update website content and listing campaigns.  

- Manage
s and correspondence, organize files, contracts, and records, and track expenses and invoices related to transactions when requested.  

- Support post closing tasks such as ensuring paperwork is archived, utility transfer
s, key handover coordination, and occasional follow ups, newsletters, and welcome
s.  

- Attend regular Teams/Zoom/Whatsapp video calls and meetings and training with clients, partners, vendors, as needed.





Tools We Use



- TRREB MLS (Matrix)  

- Follow Up Boss CRM  

- Microsoft 365 (Outlook, OneDrive, Word, Excel)  

- Canva (for graphics and presentations)  

- ChatGPT and Perplexity (for research and drafting)  

- Social media:
, Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube  





What You’ll Get



- Stable, long term full, time role with a growing real estate business  

- Clear schedule: 9:30am to 6:00pm EST, Monday to Saturday  

- Starting salary: PHP 25,000 per month during a 3 month probationary period, increasing to PHP 30,000 per month after successful completion  

- 13th month / Christmas bonus, with potential additional performance based bonuses over time  





How to Apply



Send a brief non AI message with:  

   - A short introduction about yourself  

   - Your relevant work experience  

   - Why this role interests you and why you’re a good fit  

   - Your current internet speed and computer specs

title: Shopify Web Developer - CRO Specialist - Ecommerce Advertising Agency - Full Time 3b
description:

CRO Shopify Web Developer – Job Overview

I am looking for an experienced shopify web developer to help me upgrade client’s checkout processes and execute CRO tests for various ecommerce brands.

In this role you will update Shopify theme templates, develop landing pages using various page builders and html/CSS frameworks, research/install various checkout/bundle applications, and implement A/B tests using testing tools like intelligems.

You will also report on test performance, and provide suggestions for next steps.

This is a full-time opportunity. Training will be provided and you will work directly with me.



About Zack Miller

My name is Zack Miller, and I’ve been a DTC Ecommerce Growth Marketer since 2019. I’ve done everything fro
dia buying and client strategy, to agency internal operations.

I’ve contributed to the growth of over 200 ecommerce brands in my agency experience. Now, as an independent growth marketing partner, I work closely with a small number of brands on their new customer acquisition strategy.

Monday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Tuesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Wednesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Thursday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Friday: 9am – 5:30pm EST



Roles & Responsibilities

- Develop landing pages using Figma and various WYSYWIG editors including but not limited to Replo and Pagefly.

- Edit product, collection and other page templates using Shopify Liquid template engine, and various HTML/CSS frameworks.

- Install various checkout/tracking applications (aftersell, Zipify OCU, Upstack, etc)

- Install various applications for product bundling when needed, and create product bundles. 

- Install tracking pixels on client’s websites

- Implement A/B tests in intelligems for product price tests, shipping price tests, theme tests, landing page tests, and more. 

- Research new ideas for direct response content marketing strategies.

- Work in my project management system, ClickUp.

- Apply a process-first mentality and provide feedback to help further develop our operating systems.



Required Experience & Education

- Strong verbal and written English language skills (American Dialect)

- 1+ years of web development (Shopify) experience required

title: Dental Insurance Collections Specialist- Posiiton NO-2601
description:
LSI Medical Billing & Financial Consultants LLC is seeking a detail-oriented Dental Billing Insurance Collector Specialist to support end-to-end dental revenue cycle and insurance collection operations. The specialist will be responsible for submitting and monitoring insurance claims through dental practice management systems such as Dentrix, Open Dental, EagleSoft, and other platforms, ensuring accurate coding, timely filing, and proper follow-up on unpaid or underpaid claims.



This role includes managing aging reports, resolving claim discrepancies with insurance carriers, initiating appeals when necessary, uploading explanation of benefits (EOBs), and maintaining clear, auditable documentation of all account activities. The specialist will communicate regularly with client offices and LSI management regarding claim status, respond promptly to insurance-related inquiries, and escalate operational issues as needed.



The position also involves participating in monthly performance meetings to review production results and provide recommendations to improve insurance collection processes and overall revenue cycle performance.

description:
Job Description:



We are seeking a strategic and creative Video Editor and Graphics Designer to join our team. As a Video Editor/Graphics Designer Hybrid, you will be responsible for producing engaging video content and creating visually stunning graphics that align with our client’s image. You will collaborate closely with our marketing and creative teams to bring our ideas to life through compelling videos and eye-catching designs.



Responsibilities:

Help generate new creative concepts for videos and statics

- Strong communication and collaboration skills to effectively work with cross-functional teams.

Preferred Qualifications:

What’s In It For You:

title: IMAGE EDITORS (LIGHTROOM/PHOTOSHOP)
description:
About MediaFuture

Creative AI studio delivering hyper-realistic images & short video for international clients. Every detail must read as real.





Role

• Lightroom: ingest ? cull ? grade ? QC ? export; build repeatable looks; natural skin tones; set-to-set consistency.

• create presets + color profiles/LUTs (via Lightroom/ACR/PS) matched to references/LUTs.

• Photoshop: targeted retouch to support grades (Camera Raw, Liquify, Dodge & Burn, Frequency Separation, content-aware fixes).





Responsibilities

• Catalog & Culling: fast selects, smart previews, keywords/metadata hygiene, versions/virtual copies

• Color & Tone: WB/exposure, Tone/Point Curves, HSL, Calibration; mixed-light balancing; match total exposure

• Lens & Detail: camera/lens profiles, transform/perspective, noise reduction, sharpening (detail mask), grain matched to reference

• Local Adjustments: subject/sky masks, range masks, radial/linear gradients; subtle dodge/burn for depth

• Look Dev & Consistency: build/maintain presets + XMP profiles/LUTs; Reference View; align to prior projects

• Batch & Delivery: safe sync, renaming, color-space/export presets (sRGB/Adobe RGB), contact sheets

• QC: histogram/clip checks, banding/halo/moire fixes; multi-device check; final pass for naturalism





Must-Have

• Lightroom Classic expert: grids/compare/survey, masks & range masks, Calibration, batch workflows, preset/profile creation

• Photoshop proficiency: Camera Raw, Liquify, Dodge & Burn, Frequency Separation for support retouch

• Solid color management (profiles, spaces, export), understanding of lens behavior, noise/grain

• Organized file hygiene (folders, keywords, collections, backups)

• Portfolio with: before/after set grades, difficult lighting fixes, consistent skin tones across sets



Pay + Schedule:

1. Full-time

2. Competitive pay based on skill + experience

3. Long-term role (after passing training and trails)

title: Performance Marketing Strategist (Research + Creative Direction + Ad Management)
description:
Marketing Strategist – HelloAi

Location: [Remote/Hybrid/On-site]

Employment Type: Full-Time

Compensation: Base Salary + Commission

About HelloAi

HelloAi is a forward-thinking company helping businesses grow through smart, AI-driven solutions. We're looking for a data-savvy Marketing Strategist who knows how to turn ad spend into real results — not just clicks, but booked appointments and closed pipelines.

About the Role

The Marketing Strategist at HelloAi is responsible for researching, planning, and executing paid and organic advertising strategies for HelloAi and its clients. Your north star metric is booked appointments — every campaign you build should move the needle toward a filled calendar and a growing client base. You won't just be launching ads. You'll be studying what works, why it works, and how to replicate it across different industries and audiences. You'll be a key voice in how HelloAi and its clients show up in the market.

What You'll Do



Research target audiences, competitors, and industry trends before recommending any ad strategy

Build and manage paid ad campaigns across platforms such as Meta, Google, LinkedIn, and others relevant to the client's audience

Develop clear and detailed creative briefs for our in-house design team to bring your ad concepts to life

Collaborate closely with our designers to ensure the final creative aligns with the strategy and is optimized for conversions

Set up and monitor tracking, analytics, and reporting to evaluate campaign performance

Continuously test, optimize, and iterate on campaigns based on real data

Present strategy recommendations to internal stakeholders and clients with clear reasoning

Manage ad budgets responsibly and report on ROI regularly

Coordinate with sales and operations teams to ensure booked appointments are being followed up on effectively



What This Role Is NOT

This position is not a graphic design role, a social media management role, or a content creation role. You will not be responsible for designing ads, posting organic social content, managing brand voice day-to-day, or building websites. HelloAi has a dedicated in-house design team that handles all creative production — your job is strategy, research, and results.

What We're Looking For



Proven experience running paid ad campaigns with measurable outcomes (appointment setting experience is a strong plus)

Strong analytical mindset — you make decisions based on data, not gut feelings alone

Experience writing creative briefs and directing creative teams toward a performance goal

Familiarity with CRM and lead tracking tools

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

Ability to manage multiple client campaigns simultaneously without dropping the ball

Self-motivated and comfortable working toward performance-based goals



Compensation

We offer a competitive base salary plus commission. The commission is tied directly to qualified appointments booked as a result of your campaigns, with bonus potential for hitting monthly and quarterly volume targets. This structure is designed to reward performance while giving you the stability to build campaigns the right way.

HelloAi is an equal opportunity employer. We believe diverse teams build better strategies.



The key changes are that the "What This Role Is NOT" section now clearly calls out that design is handled in-house, and the responsibilities now include writing creative briefs and collaborating with the design team rather than producing creative themselves.

title: Web Developer - Part Time
description:
Job Title: Web Developer



Job Summary:

We are seeking a talented and motivated Web Developer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, coding, and modifying websites, from layout to functionality, according to the company's needs. The Web Developer will collaborate closely with the design and marketing teams to create visually appealing and user-friendly web experiences that enhance our online presence.



Key Responsibilities:

1.Collaborate with the design team to translate mockups and wireframes into fully functional web pages, ensuring a seamless user experience and responsive design across different devices and browsers.

2.Write clean, well-documented, and efficient code using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to implement design concepts and achieve desired functionality.

3.Develop custom web applications, interactive features, and dynamic content to enhance user engagement and improve overall website performance.

4.Integrate third-party APIs and tools to extend website functionality, such as payment gateways, social media platforms, and analytics tools.

5.Optimize websites for maximum speed and scalability, considering factors such as image optimization, caching, and server-side performance.

6.Troubleshoot and debug issues that arise during the development process, and collaborate with the team to implement effective solutions.

7.Stay up-to-date with the latest web development trends, tools, and technologies, and recommend improvements to enhance the company's web presence.

8.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and understand business requirements, ensuring that web development aligns with overall company goals.

9.Implement and maintain effective SEO practices to improve website visibility and search engine rankings.



Qualifications and Skills:

1.Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Web Development, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).

2.Willing to work US hours (PST).

3.Proven experience as a Web Developer, with a strong portfolio showcasing previous web projects and coding skills.

4.Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, with a deep understanding of responsive design principles and modern web standards.

5.Knowledge of version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaborative development workflows.

6.Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

7.Experience with web performance optimization and SEO best practices.

8.Excellent time management and multitasking abilities, with the flexibility to adapt to changing priorities in a fast-paced environment.

9.Strong teamwork and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.



If you are passionate about creating exceptional web experiences, staying at the forefront of web development trends, and contributing to a dynamic team, we invite you to apply for the Web Developer position. Send in your resume and two sample websites you've developed.

title: Phone-First Customer Experience VA (US Company | Pacific Time)
description:

This role is for someone who thrives in live conversations, builds instant trust, and can guide customers with clarity and warmth while managing systems at the same time.



If you take pride in excellent communication and love helping customers feel taken care of, you will do very well here.



Your performance directly impacts customer experience, booked appointments, and company growth.



Primary Responsibility: Phone Excellence

Your #1 priority is handling incoming customer calls exceptionally well — every time. You will:

- Answer all inbound calls within 30 seconds using approved greeting scripts

- Handle calls via Dialpad with professionalism, clarity, and urgency

- Confidently guide callers through conversations

- Gather critical customer information accurately (Full name, Service address, Phone number, Service need)

- Determine whether the caller is a new customer, a previous or an existing customer, or a new owner of a serviced property

- Book the first sales or service appointment during the call whenever possible

- Clearly explain next steps, expectations, and service policies (including drive-time billing when applicable)

- Handle missed calls by returning them within 30 minutes

- Leave clear, complete, and accurate call notes to ensure seamless handoff to sales or service teams

- Uphold Service Beyond Expectation on every single interaction



This role is accountable for call quality, lead accuracy, and appointment success — not just answering the phone.



Secondary Tasks (When Phones Are Quiet)

When call volume is low, you may assist with:

- Light CRM or QuickBooks data updates

- Appointment confirmations

- Calendar updates

- Follow-ups on missed calls or leads

- Administrative support from the Office Manager



Phone coverage always comes first.



Must-Have Qualifications

- Strong phone confidence and professional speaking voice

- Near-native English fluency (verbal and written)

- Reliable availability: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM US Pacific Time

- Ability to multitask systems while speaking with customers

- Calm, solutions-focused customer service mindset

- Strong attention to detail and documentation habits

- Comfortable explaining policies clearly and confidently

- Willingness to follow structured SOPs

Bonus (Not Required, But Valuable)

- Aspire CRM familiarity

- Appointment setting or scheduling experience

- Escalation handling experience

- SOP documentation experience



Compensation & Growth

- PHP 40,000/month base salary

- Pay increase opportunities based on performance and tenure

- Long-term stability with a growing company

- Opportunity to grow into expanded administrative or coordination roles



We value reliability, initiative, and accountability.



This Role Is NOT a Fit If

- You dislike live phone conversations

- You prefer quiet, independent back-office work

- You struggle with multitasking while speaking

- You are uncomfortable following structured processes

- You are not available in Pacific Time consistently



How to Apply (Follow Exactly):

Send one
 only to 



Subject: Phone VA – Your Full Name



Include:

1. Resume

2. 2-Minute Video (Google Drive link)

    * We use a short video so we can hear your communication style — since this is a phone-first role.

       - Introduce yourself

       - Explain why you are excellent on the phone

    * File name: FirstName_LastName_Video

       - Incomplete or misformatted applications will not be reviewed.



Why Join Us

- Direct impact on revenue and customer experience

- Stable long-term role

- Opportunity to grow as responsibilities expand



If you take pride in professional communication and want to be part of a company that values excellence, we’d love to meet you.

title: Web Builder and Automation Specialist
description:
Role Summary

You build and maintain websites, landing pages, funnels, and basic automations for multiple brands. Your core tools are GoHighLevel and WordPress. You also set up and troubleshoot integrations using 
, Zapier, and related tools.

You work fast, keep builds tidy, document what you do, and communicate clearly.



Work Arrangement

•Contractor role, not employment

•20-30 hours per week, flexible schedule

•Remote, Philippines only

•Paid hourly or on a weekly retainer, based on experience and capability



Key Responsibilities

GoHighLevel

•Build landing pages, funnels, forms, surveys, calendars, and basic membership pages

•Set up domains, DNS records, and SSL where required

•Apply mobile responsive design and consistent styling

•Create and maintain reusable page templates and section blocks

•Troubleshoot page, form, tracking, and publishing issues

WordPress

•Build and maintain WordPress sites using modern page builders and themes

•Implement basic on-page SEO and performance improvements

•Install, configure, and maintain plugins with a security-first approach

•Troubleshoot site issues including layout breaks, caching, and plugin conflicts

•Manage backups, updates, and staging where required

Automations and Integrations

•Build workflows in GoHighLevel including triggers, campaigns, pipelines, tasks, and notifications

•Create integrations using 
 and Zapier

•Connect forms, calendars, payment links, CRM fields, Google Sheets, Slack,
 providers, and webhooks

•Debug automation failures using logs, test data, and structured checks

•Document automations so they're easy to maintain and hand over

Quality and Delivery

•Work from briefs and checklists, then fill gaps without being chased

•Maintain clean naming conventions and folder structure

•Provide handover notes, short Loom videos, or step-by-step documentation

•Track time and tasks accurately

•Flag risks early and propose practical fixes



Skills and Experience

Must Have

•Strong GoHighLevel experience with pages and core CRM features

•Strong WordPress experience building and maintaining client sites

•Comfortable with 
 or Zapier, including multi-step scenarios

•Solid understanding of domains, DNS, SSL, and basic hosting concepts

•Good design judgement and attention to detail

•Clear written English and reliable communication

•Able to work independently and hit deadlines

Nice to Have

•Basic HTML and CSS for quick fixes and styling control

•Experience with tracking and analytics: GA4, Meta Pixel, UTM structure

??
 deliverability basics: SPF, DKIM, DMARC

•Experience building SOPs or internal documentation



Tools You'll Use

GoHighLevel, WordPress, 
, Zapier, Google Workspace, Loom or similar screen recording tool, and a project management tool such as Airtable, ClickUp, Trello, or Asana.



What Good Looks Like

•Pages and sites launched on time with minimal revisions

•Automations run reliably with clear logs and documentation

•Reduced rework through consistent naming, structure, and templates

•Fast turnaround on fixes and improvements

•Clean handovers so others can maintain the work



What to Include in Your Application

•A short summary of your automation experience, including 
 or Zapier examples

Contract Notes

This is a contractor role. You manage your own taxes and government contributions. You supply your own equipment and a stable internet connection. Work is assigned and paid based on agreed scope and tracked hours.

title: Virtual Assistant - Cold Email Campaign Expert
description:
Description

About AI Acquisition

An AI platform emerged as the global category leader in AI service provider enablement. Operating globally, with the US as its primary market, the unique hybrid of Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) and AI marketplace has achieved explosive growth by solving a critical pain point: connecting AI agencies with qualified enterprise opportunities at scale. AI Acquisition combines proprietary AI orchestration tools with proven enterprise SaaS infrastructure, delivers immediate value to the platform’s multiple agency customers and small and medium businesses worldwide.



We’re revolutionizing the way entrepreneurs build life-changing businesses by brokering AI tools to business owners eager to succeed. At the forefront of the $1.3 trillion AI revolution, we empower our members to earn $500+ per hour with just a few clicks. Whether through our AI Agency Incubator, AI Accelerator or AI Agency Launchpad, we provide the systems, training, and support to help our members achieve rapid success.



Hear from our leaders:



Jordan Lee, Co-Founder & Chairman, shares insights about the business: 



Why Join AI Acquisition?



We’re hiring a Cold
 Campaign Expert to build, launch, and optimize large volumes of cold
 campaigns while developing new messaging frameworks and methods that scale across our client base.

You’ll be working across multiple niches, managing dozens of active campaigns, and constantly iterating on what works - from copy to deliverability.

This is a fast-paced, performance-driven role ideal for someone who thrives under pressure and knows how to make campaigns win.

This isn’t just a job—it’s an opportunity to create a new and better life while working with visionary leaders who are shaping the future of AI-driven business growth.



The Role



We are seeking a highly skilled Virtual Assistant with proven expertise in cold
 campaigns and technical infrastructure. You’ll be responsible for setting up and managing campaigns, monitoring performance, ensuring deliverability, and optimizing copy and systems for maximum impact.



This is a full-time, remote position (40 hours/week).



What You’ll Do



Campaign Creation & Optimization

Write, build, and launch new cold
 campaigns for clients across diverse industries.

Diagnose and revive underperforming campaigns through better messaging, targeting, or structure.

Develop and test new outreach frameworks (AI audit, growth plan, podcast, referral, etc.) to expand our library of proven methods.

Collaborate closely with the Head of Delivery and senior strategists to scale top-performing ideas.

Deliverability & Infrastructure Innovation

Monitor campaign health, deliverability, inbox placement, and domain performance inside Instantly.

Identify patterns and flag issues to the infrastructure team for deeper investigation or resolution.

Work with the team to test and roll out new infrastructure methods, sending setups, and domain management improvements.

Stay up-to-date with best practices in cold
 sending and share insights with the wider team.

Lead Data & Enrichment

Use Clay, Apollo, and internal enrichment tools to manage and validate lead lists.

Ensure high targeting accuracy, segmenting by niche, persona, and offer type.

Analysis & Reporting

Track campaign performance (reply rates, positive responses, booked calls).

Summarize insights and propose improvements to enhance future launches.

Contribute to our growing internal library of templates, angles, and proven frameworks.

Requirements

What We’re Looking For

Extensive experience using Instantly AI - daily use managing high volumes of campaigns (100+ inboxes preferred).

Proven track record managing multiple cold
 campaigns simultaneously (agency or B2B experience ideal).

Strong cold
 copywriting ability - you know how to write short, sharp, conversational
s that get replies.

Deep understanding of deliverability, sequencing, and domain management best practices.

Proficient with Clay, Apollo, and enrichment workflows.

Highly analytical, proactive, and self-sufficient - you spot issues and act fast.

Strong written English and ability to communicate clearly with both technical and creative teams.

Benefits

What’s In It for You



Competitive Pay: Full-time contract role with a competitive hourly rate.



Remote Flexibility: Work from anywhere with a reliable internet connection.



Skill Growth: Gain rare experience with large-scale outbound systems.



Impactful Work: Help clients achieve measurable growth through optimized campaigns.



Supportive Team: Work alongside experts in campaign operations and AI automation.



Assessment & Requirements



You’ll be assessed on:



Cold
 copywriting – clarity, tone, and conversion potential.

Campaign execution – examples of sequences you’ve built and optimized.

Technical awareness – how you diagnose and prevent performance issues.

Please include:



Examples of campaigns you’ve managed or written (sequences, results, context).



Your experience level with Instantly (number of inboxes/campaigns handled).



Ready to Join Us?



This is your chance to be part of an ambitious company shaping the future of outbound client acquisition. If you’re ready to manage high-performing cold
 systems, optimize deliverability, and work with a fast-scaling team, we want to hear from you.



Apply now by submitting your CV and examples of past cold
 campaigns you’ve successfully managed.

title: Video Editor (Premiere Pro) — YouTube Shorts, Reels & Long-Form Content
description:
About the Role



I run a video production business creating content for YouTube creators and brands. I need a reliable, detail-oriented video editor to handle short-form content (YouTube Shorts, Instagram Reels) and straightforward long-form YouTube edits on an ongoing, long-term basis — not a one-off project.



You will primarily be editing for one client to start, with additional editing work from other clients as the relationship grows. This is a role with room to expand in both scope and compensation as my business scales.



Important Note About Content: The primary client you'll be editing for produces right-leaning American political commentary. The content includes strong opinions, humor, and topics that some may find controversial or offensive. You must be comfortable working with this type of material professionally, regardless of your personal views. If political content would make you uncomfortable or affect the quality of your work, this is not the right fit — no hard feelings.



What You'll Be Editing

Short-form videos (YouTube Shorts / Instagram Reels):



30–90 second clips cut from longer livestreams and recorded content

Talking head commentary with b-roll, text overlays, and music

Full styled captions/subtitles (you will handle transcription and captioning — style specs provided)

Comedy and timing are a big part of what makes these work — you need to recognize what's funny and how to land a punchline through editing



Long-form YouTube videos (8–20 minutes):



Edited from streams and recorded content

Cuts, pacing, basic color correction, basic transitions, and light graphics

No heavy motion graphics required



B-Roll Sourcing (Both Short-Form and Long-Form):

This is a key part of the role. You will be responsible for finding and incorporating appropriate b-roll into your edits. This includes:



Researching and downloading relevant news clips from YouTube — if the video covers a recent event, you need to find footage of that event to edit into the video

Finding images of specific people, places, or i
 referenced in the content

Using stock footage where appropriate — you must have access to a stock footage platform (Storyblocks, Artlist, Canva Pro, or similar)

General awareness of American politics and current events is important, OR you must have excellent research skills to quickly find relevant visuals for topics you may not be familiar with



As the role grows, you may also edit similar content for other clients — short-form clips, reels, and simple long-form edits across different niches.



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)



Adobe Premiere Pro — You must own or have reliable access to Premiere Pro. You will deliver both finished exports AND the Premiere Pro project file (.prproj) with all assets organized so I can go back in and make revisions if needed. Access to the broader Adobe Suite (After Effects, Photoshop, etc.) is a plus but not required.



Descript — You must have a Descript subscription for transcription and caption/subtitle work. If you don't currently have one, you must be willing to get one. I will provide the exact caption style specifications.

Stock footage access — You must have a subscription to a stock footage/media platform (Storyblocks, Artlist, Canva Pro, or equivalent) for sourcing b-roll where news clips or specific footage aren't available.



Excellent English comprehension — this is absolutely critical. The primary creator you'll be editing has a very thick Southern American accent. Even native English speakers sometimes need to replay sections to catch what he's saying. You need to be confident in your ability to accurately transcribe and caption heavily accented, fast-paced American English. If English comprehension is not one of your strongest skills, this role will be extremely difficult and frustrating for both of us. Please be honest with yourself about this.



Research skills — You need to be resourceful. If the creator references a news story, a political figure, or a past i
, you must be able to quickly research it and find relevant images, clips, or footage to include as b-roll in the edit.



Familiarity with American pop culture, internet humor, 
s, and current events is a strong plus. The content includes references to trending topics, political figures, and internet culture. You don't need to be an expert, but awareness helps you make better editing choices and find better b-roll.



Reliable internet connection and ability to download/upload large video files regularly.



Available to start within 1 week.



Nice to Have (Not Required)



AI image/video generation skills — Some edits benefit from AI-generated visuals, especially for comedy segments where traditional b-roll doesn't exist. If you have experience with AI tools (Midjourney, Runway, Kling, etc.), that's a major bonus. If not, I'm willing to train you on this, as it's my specialty.



Skills & Qualities I'm Looking For



The #1 quality I need is someone who can watch 5–10 existing videos on a channel and match that editing style independently. I don't want to micromanage every cut.



Specifically:



Strong sense of pacing and comedic timing — knowing when to hold on a reaction, when to cut, when to let a 
nt breathe, and how to land a joke

Ability to emulate an already established editing style by studying existing content — not imposing your own creative preferences

Resourceful b-roll sourcing — you can find relevant, appropriate visuals quickly without being told exactly what to search for

Basic color correction skills

Comfortable with basic transitions — clean and intentional, nothing flashy

Self-directed work ethic — you study the training materials, ask smart questions when something is unclear, and deliver work that doesn't require heavy revision





What I Provide



Detailed training recordings — I have multi-hour screen recordings showing my complete editing process for both short-form and long-form content, start to finish. These cover everything: how I select clips from streams, how I pace edits, how I handle captions, how I source b-roll, and the specific style choices that matter. Additional training recordings will be added as we work together.

Style guides and caption specifications — You won't be guessing. The visual style, caption style, and editing approach are documented.

Clear, specific feedback — If something needs adjustment, I'll tell you exactly what and why. I don't expect perfection on day one, but I do expect quick improvement and consistent effort to match the established style. To confirm you've read this far, please include the word "mangoes" somewhere in your application message.

Example content — Before you start any edit, I will provide reference videos so you can see exactly what the finished product should look and feel like.



Compensation & Payment



$600–$1,000/month USD depending on experience, skill level, and weekly workload. Higher pay for editors who can handle more volume independently and deliver work that requires minimal revision.



Payment schedule: Weekly, paid after each week of completed work. This is standard practice — you work, I review, I pay. No upfront payment required from either side. After the first 1–2 months, we can transition to biweekly or monthly if we both prefer.



Payment method: EasyPay (Payoneer), PayPal, or Wise — we can discuss what works best for you.

This is a long-term position with room to grow in both scope and compensation as my business takes on new clients.



How to Apply (Follow These Steps Exactly)



1. Use exactly 10 Apply Points when submitting your application. Applications with any other number of points will not be considered.



2. Send a link to your portfolio OR 2–3 samples of short-form video content you've edited (YouTube Shorts, Reels, TikToks, etc.). Bonus points if any samples include b-roll that you sourced yourself.



3. Confirm that you have access to Adobe Premiere Pro, Descript (or willingness to get it), and a stock footage platform



4. Confirm you are comfortable editing right-leaning American political commentary content.



5. On a scale of 1–10, how would you rate your ability to understand heavily accented American English? Be honest — this will be tested during the trial.



6. Briefly describe your process when you're given a new channel to edit for — how do you learn and match the style?



7. Do you have any experience with AI image or video generation tools? If yes, which ones?



Hiring Process



Selected applicants will receive a paid test task ($15–$25) before any ongoing commitment is made. You'll edit one real short-form video so we can both evaluate whether the fit is right. This test is paid regardless of outcome.

title: Inbound Appointment Setter & Admin for US Junk Removal Company (Near?Native English Only)
description:
About the Role

We run a growing junk removal & light demolition company in Florida (USA). Most of our leads are high?intent inbound calls from Google. Your #1 job is to answer/return those calls fast, understand what the customer really needs, and book them into our schedule. When phones are quiet, you’ll handle light admin tasks.



Salary: 

$900–$1,200 per month (full?time) + performance bonuses based on booked & completed jobs. 

Salary once fully ramped with incentives can reach $1,500.



Responsibilities



Answer inbound calls from US customers and call back missed calls quickly.

Understand what the caller actually wants (example: difference between “where can I drop my brush?” vs “can you haul this brush away for me?”) and respond appropriately.

Ask a few simple questions, collect photos when needed, and book jobs into our calendar in the correct time windows.

Run our 7?day follow?up playbook on unbooked leads: calls, texts, and confirmations using our CRM (GoHighLevel).

Confirm next?day jobs, reschedule when needed, and keep the schedule tight for our crews.

Do light admin work between calls (updating notes, simple spreadsheets, basic
 tasks).

Requirements



Excellent spoken and written English with near?native / neutral American accent.

Strong listening and comprehension skills. You must catch subtle differences in what people say and ask clarifying questions.

Prior experience on the phone with US/UK/AU customers (appointment setting, customer service, or call center). Ideally 3 years on the phone with us/uk/eu customers.

Comfortable working US hours (roughly 9am–5pm US Eastern,  Monday to Saturday).

Reliable internet, backup connection, and a quiet place to take calls.

Coachable, reliable, and willing to follow scripts AND use judgment when real life doesn’t match the script.

Nice to Have



Experience with home services (plumbing, HVAC, cleaning, junk removal, etc.).

Experience using CRMs like GoHighLevel, HubSpot, or similar.

Compensation



Full?time, 50 hours/week.

Competitive salary based on experience, paid monthly (we will discuss your desired rate).

Long?term role for the right person; we invest in training and want you with us for years, not months.

How to Apply (follow these steps exactly)



Subject line: Appointment Setter – [Your Name]

Include:

Your resume.

Your expected monthly salary in USD for full?time work.

Voice sample (required):

Record 45–60 seconds (Vocaroo, Loom, etc.) introducing yourself and reading this scenario in your own words:

“A caller says: ‘Can I drop my brush off somewhere?’

Please respond as if you work for our junk removal company. Clarify what they mean and explain what we can or cannot do for them.”



Send the link in your
.

Screenshot of your internet speed test.

Applications that do not follow all steps will not be considered.

title: Product Manager - IT Hardware
description:
Multimedia Technology is a dynamic trusted partner of tomorrow’s technology that connects people and powers the world’s economy. We simplify the technology supply chain, through strong and meaningful relationships. The ideal candidate will be a team player who will be responsible for leading a team through the entire product lifecycle from strategy to evaluation. You will also work cross-functionally to gain essential industry knowledge and skills and build strong working relationships with vendor and in house teams.



A typical day may include:

Maintain an understanding of the vendors competitive landscape and become the business’s ‘subject matter expert’ for the vendor

Develop strong business relationships with a portfolio of customers to gain an understating of their purchasing requirements

Speak with both vendors and resellers and assist with new business development and identification of new sales channels

Manage internal ERP functions to allow simple and streamlined ordering to keep adequate levels of stock on hand

Prepare communications related to business development opportunities, including proposals, quotations, and presentations

Work within KPI’s to achieve the nominated sales and gross profit budgets

Reporting as required



Skills and experience required:

Pervious product or vendor experience in the IT channel

High level of relationship building skills to maximise development of initial customer relationships and then longer-term business outcomes

Ability to sell a product portfolio to both external and internal stakeholders

Sound analytical and problem-solving skills and demonstrated ability to use various sales methods to reach the desired goal

Ability to understand, interpret and adapt to new technology of products

Demonstrated experience of proactive client engagement

Strong communication skills, both written and verbal

The ability to meet strict deadlines & work autonomously



You must be available to work 9am-5.30p
lbourne (Australia) time.



PLEASE ATTACH A RESUME

mbers

title: Final Cut Pro (Mac) Video Editor + Storyteller (Podcasts / Real Estate / Doc-Style) — Fast Internet Required
description:
Job Type

**Long-term position**



Overview



We’re hiring a **high-skill video editor who is also a storyteller**. You will turn raw footage into **modern, high-retention edits** for:



* **Podcasts** (full episodes + highlight clips)
